loans.name: Raushan

texts.ru: Раушан 35 лет, замужем, есть 4 детей школьного и дошкольного возраста. У Раушан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1999 году. Благодаря упорному труду Раушан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 10 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 4,0 ГА, на котором Раушан ежегодно выращивает картофель под внутрихозяйственное потребление и реализацию. Экологически чистую продукцию, а также домашнее молоко Раушан реализует местным жителям и оптовым покупателям. Ежемесячный доход Раушан свыше 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 нетели  для разведения. Раушан планирует направлять доход от кредита в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, а также вкладывать в воспитание и образование ее детей.
texts.en: Raushan is 35 years old, married, and the mother of four children, some of whom are in school while the others are still in preschool.  She has the equivalent of a high school education and is involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, two activities which constitute her family's main source of income.  She started in this business in 1999.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently owns two cows and ten sheep, and she also grows potatoes, annually, on a 4- hectare plot of land.  The potatoes that she grows are used both for the family's own consumption and for resale.  She sells her organic crops and home-made milk to the local residents as well as to wholesale buyers.  Raushan makes more than 20,000 som per month (KGS).  In order to further develop her farming business, she has turned to the Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy one heifer for breeding.  Raushan is planning to reinvest her earnings from her loan into further increasing her business and into her children's education and upbringing.

loans.use: to purchase one heifer in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman; she has five children, all of whom attend school. Janet owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Janet has operated a charcoal selling business for four years now, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Junrey

texts.en:
Junrey, 23, is married. He lives with his wife and one child in Manga, Tangub City, Philippines. From his desire to sufficiently sustain his family, he engaged in dried fish vending, starting with a capital of 3,000 PHP. His business has operated for a year already.

 Now, he is planning to borrow  PHP 8,000 to buy more stocks of dried fish to increase his inventory and earn more profit. He has requested this loan from Paglaum MP Cooperative, of which he became a member in 2013. He wants to have a stall in the public market to display his dried fish. Someday he will be happy seeing his family live a better life.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Alfonia

texts.en:
Alfonia  is a businesswoman from Ozamiz City. She is 64 years old, a widow with two children and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. 

Alfonia  is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken out several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without record of default. Now, she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic goods and consumable items. Alfonia  continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic goods and consumable items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials, including zinc, nails, wood, cement, and sand to make improvement at home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay education expenses

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha makes a good earning from her farming activities in Dumingag. This is how she supports her family and is able to send her children to school. She wants to increase her farm yield, especially since she has a high cost of living since her children entered college. Editha approached Paglaum for a loan to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides. She has high hopes that she will have good produce this cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina is a 51-year-old mother of six from Baggao, Cagayan. Her husband is a farmer while she manages their eatery. Sometimes their earnings are not enough, especially now that they have school-aged children. Because of that, Josefina wants to take an education loan of PHP 8,000. She will use this to pay for the school fees of their daughter in college. Their daughter Jennifer is taking a BS in Business Administration. Jennifer wishes to finish college so she can help her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fee

loans.name: Marco

texts.es: Marco tiene un hijo y vive en El Alto y vive con sus padres, el cliente es transportista  y quiere un credito para mantenimiento de su movilidad, lo cual conlleva la compra de repuestos y cancelacion de los servicios del mecanico Marco es la unica persona que trabaja en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda para sacar adelante a su familia
texts.en:
Marco has one son and lives in El Alto. He lives with his parents. He works in transportation and wants a loan to maintain his vehicle, which means buying spare parts and canceling a mechanic's services.

Marco is the only person who works in his home, so he needs your help to bring his family up.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle, which means buying spare parts and canceling a mechanic's services.

loans.name: Louelyn

texts.en:
Louelyn, 30, is married with three children. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for 4 years already. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children.

She is still continuing the business because it provides a good income due to her loyal customers. Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be well served. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and is able to also help her immediate family.

She already availed herself of loans previously to purchase additional stocks, and now she is reapplying for a loan to purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store to increase stock and maximize profit.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store to increase stock and maximize profit

loans.name: Artemio

texts.es:
Artemio tiene 48 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado se su cónyuge y seis hijos, dos son mayores de edad que trabajan y aportan ingresos a la unidad económica familiar, dos estudian en colegio secunadrio del centro plablado Tambillo, uno en colegio primario del caserio el pueblo lo hizo y el último tiene 3 años de edad; viven en casa propia de material rustico un piso, Artemio y cónyuge son nacidos en caserío el Pueblo lo Hizo; viven en armonía familiar y en comunión con los miembros de su caserío, viven en la parte rural del caserío el Pueblo lo Hizo en el distrito de Santo Tomas; vive en una comunidad pequeña dedicada básicamente a la agricultura y ganadería, vivienda cuenta con servicios de agua. Dicho distrito está ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Artemio es el cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 1 hectara. Variedad catimor, plantación tiene tres años de edad ya que en la zona todos tienen plantación nuevas; café de cliente esta en primer año de producción y para 2015 estará en segundo año de producción; tiene terreno agrícola propio donde esta parcela de café, actividad la realiza hace 03 años en caserío el Pueblo lo Hizo Distrito Santo Tomas, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de café, producto lo vende en distrito Santo Tomas a compradores de la zona. Adicionalmente cliente se dedica a la actividad pecuaria cría de ganado vacuno y también al cultivo y productos de pan llevar todo esto lo realiza en terreno propio en caserío el Pueblo lo Hizo distrito Santo Tomas.

El destino del crédito sera para mantenimiento de 1 hectarea. De café en producción, con ello asegurará mayor y mejor producción para campaña 2015 y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Artemio is 48 years old and he lives with his family in a stable home. He has six children. His two oldest children work and contribute to supporting the household.  Two children attend high school in Tambillo, one child is in elementary school, and the sixth is 3 years old.  They live in a single-story house that they own and that is made from rustic materials. Artemio and his wife were both born in the town where they currently reside. They live in a rural part of the town, called el Pueblo Lo Hizo, which is in the district of Santo Tomas. This small community is dedicated to agriculture and raising animals. This region is located in the north of Peru.

Artemio manages one hectare of coffee crops. His plantation is three years old, even though in this area all of the other coffee plantations are new. He is currently working on his first year of production and is preparing for the second year of production.  He has his own agricultural land where he grows the coffee. He has been doing this work for 3 years and has prior experience in cultivating coffee crops. He sells what he grows to buyers in the district of Santo Tomas.

Additionally, he has livestock and breeds cattle.  He also sells baked good.  He does all of this work from his home.

He is seeking a loan that will be used to maintain his one hectare of coffee crops.  This loan will enable him to increase and improve coffee production for 2015. By doing this, he will be able to increase his income and provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to maintain a hectare of land for coffee production - to grow and improve production for 2015.

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru:
Мунира 43-летняя замужняя женщина. Она активный и деятельный человек. В 2008 году Мунира ходила на 6-месячные курсы по кройке и шитью и научилась профессии швеи. В том же года она начала свое швейное дело, которое продолжает уже на протяжении 6 лет. Мунире нравится ее деятельность, потому что она таким образом не только зарабатывает, но и общается с разными людьми и приобретает много знакомых.
Мунира живет в городе Исфара вместе с дочерью, которая помогает ей в деятельности. Муж находится на заработках в России. 
В данный момент Мунира обратилась за кредитом для купли новой швейной машинки. Она нуждается в данном кредите для расширения своего дела и ожидает поддержки.
texts.en:
Munira is a 43-year-old married woman. She is an active and business-minded person. In 2008, Munira participated in a six-month cutting and sewing course and learned the seamstress profession. She started her own sewing business in that same year and has been running it for 6 years. Munira likes her business because she can not only earn a living with it, but also communicate with different people and make many acquaintances. 

Munira lives in the city of Isfara together with her daughter, who helps her with the business. Her husband works in Russia. At the present time, Munira is requesting this loan to buy a new sewing machine. She needs this loan to expand her business and awaits support.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine in order to expand her business

loans.name: Rosalia Group

texts.es: Eva de 50 años de edad es separada y tiene 02 hijos dependientes. Ella Pertenece a la Nueva Alcancía Comunal “Rosalía”  la cual lo conforman 05 socios con deseos de salir adelante en sus negocios. Eva lleva más de 10 años  dedicándose  a la venta de prendas de vestir de segunda mano. Con mucho esfuerzo Eva ha logrado salir adelante en su negocio.  Tiene el anhelo de contar con un puesto de venta en un mercado. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de buzos, polos, bivirís, pantalones y camisas. El grupo  “Rosalía” agradecen a los Inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo brindado. Eva es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste chaleco marrón.
texts.en: Eva is 50 years old, separated, and has 2 dependent children. She is part of the new communal bank Rosalía which is made up of 5 partners with desires to get ahead in their businesses. She has spent more than 10 years working selling second hand clothing. With a lot of effort, Evan has managed to get ahead with her business. She has the desire to have a sales point in a market. She asks  the loan to purchase track suits, t-shirts, tank tops, pants and shirts. The Rosalía group is thankful to Kiva investors for the offered support. Eva is the first on the left and is wearing a brown vest.

loans.use: to purchase track suits, t-shirts, tank tops, pants and shirts.

loans.name: Sun's Group

texts.en:
A father living in Kampon Speu province, Sun is 46 years old. He is a father of four children, one of whom is at university and the other three are in school.

He can earn income to support his family via growing rice. He has been involved in this business for ages and it earns him about 10,000 KHR per day.

This is Sun's first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of five members, he is the group leader. He will spend his loan portion to buy a water filter. He hopes that his family will have clean water for use.

loans.use: To buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: María Paulina

texts.es:
María de 36 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato. Su compañero de vida trabaja en estructuras metálicas,tienen tres hijos dos estudian y la otra esta pequeña,viven en casa propia.

María desde hace cinco años trabaja como impulsadora para una empresa de cosméticos, se decidió a este trabajo porque su familia necesita muchas cosas y  con el fin de ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar cemento, ladrillo y dos ventanas de hierro, para terminar de construir un baño.

El sueño de María es seguir trabajando para darles lo que necesitan a sus hijos
texts.en:
María is thirty six years of age and graduated from high school. Her partner works in metal structures. They have three children, two of whom are studying and the other is small. They live in their own house.

For five years Maria has been working as a sales promoter for a cosmetic company. She does this work because her family need a lot of things and to help herself and her husband with the expenses.

The loan which she is requesting is to buy cement, bricks and two metal windows to complete the construction of a bathroom.

Maria's dream is to carry on working in order to provide her children with whatever they need.

loans.use: buy cement, bricks and two metal windows, to finish building a bathroom.

loans.name: Jamel

texts.en:
Jamel, 26, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines is married to Suraine and has three children (one of which is in elementary school). His wife manages their household while he attends to his business. 

Jamel sells accessories in their town. He buys accessory items from wholesalers and sells them per piece/pack. Products can range from hair clips to head bands, bags and other similar products. He is already well known in their town since he regularly goes around their area. People are attracted to buy due to the low selling price and the many choices he offers. His regular customers are students, moms, and children. He earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help him continue his buy and sell business, he is requesting an18,000 PHP loan which he will use to buy more quantities and varieties of accessory products to serve his growing clients. He is confident that his sales and income will improve as he adds more accessories to his business. His earnings help meet their household needs and to send his child to school.  He is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given him.
 
Jamel hopes to own a stall to display his accessories. He prays for a better life and to give his children the best education until College. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for various accessories to sell.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is a new client of the institution from Ishaka Branch. He is a married man with seven children who are 25, 23, 21, 19, 17, 6 and 4 years old. Four of his children are in school at the moment. His major source of income is farming, specializing in tea growing and trading. His clients are the tea factories and tea traders.  He started farming to be able to have a steady source of income to support his family. He is a very hardworking man and has seen his business grow steadily since 2004 to date. In addition to farming, he also sells milk from his farm to supplement his income. His major challenge is poor weather during the dry season but has learned to manage it by buying manure and mulching to prevent the tea leaves from drying. He has applied for a loan of UGX 5,000,000 (five million shillings only) to buy fertilizer so that he can harvest much more than the usual quantities of tea for trading. He is optimistic that his sales will shoot up and so will his income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Thol's Group

texts.en:
A farmer living in Kampong Speu province, Thol is 37 years old and a mother of four children, three of whom are in school.

To support her family, she grows rice as her single source of income. She can earn income of about 13,600 KHR per day. This is the first time for Thol with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two members to apply for a new loan.

As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that her family will be living in good health.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine

loans.name: Edison

texts.en:
Edson, a previous client, has a grocery store which is his major source of income. He is 32 years old and married with 4 children. 

He has applied for a loan of 5,000,000 UGX to buy stock for his business.  He started this business in 2007 with high hopes of getting income. He also trades in coffee to supplement his monthly income. His business is in his local area of residence Kitagata, Muhito, Sheema District and his clients are from the rural population. 

He is a hard working man who works 12 hours a day, 7 days a week. He is faced with a challenge of competition but at the same time it has encouraged him to work hard. He is determined to carry on his business to be able to achieve his long term dream of becoming financially stable. 

He thanks Kiva lenders for the great job of helping people out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, sugar, corn flour, soap, and more.

loans.name: Sekna

texts.en: Sekna is a 48-year-old married mother of four children. Four years ago she started selling clothes to help her husband to cover the needs and expenses of their family. Sekna is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of winter clothes.  This will her to attract more customers and satisfy their needs. She hopes to expand her business more in the future to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new collection of winter clothes

loans.name: Said

texts.ru: Саиду 31 год. Он женатый примерный семьянин. Его жена домохозяйка она следит за порядком дома и за детьми. У Саида большая семья, состоящая из его родителей-пенсионеров, жены и двое детей. У него 6 летний сын и 5 летняя дочь. Саид сам один кормит свою семью. Он водить мини автобус марки Sptinter. С ним работает один кондуктор. Свой новый мини автобус он приобрел недавно. В машине его все устраивает, и ему стало больше нравиться работать в данной сфере деятельности. Саид все сбережения отдал на приобретения машины и ему сейчас необходимо средства для содержания машины и амортизации. Саид уверен, что если он получит кредит и будет сохранять машину в лучшем состоянии, то его мини автобус прослужит надолго и принесет хороший доход.
texts.en: Said is 31 years old. He is a married, exemplary family man. His wife is a homemaker. She looks after the order at home and the children. Said has a big family, consisting of his retired parents, wife and two children. He has a 6-year-old son and a 5-year-old daughter. Said provides for his family by himself. He drives a Sprinter model mini-bus. A conductor works with him too. Said recently bought his new mini-bus. He is happy with everything in the car and started to enjoy working in this area more. Said had spent all of his savings on buying the new vehicle and now needs to have money for the vehicle upkeep and amortization. Said is certain that, if receives this loan and maintains the vehicle in the best condition, that his mini-bus would serve him for a long time and result in a good income.

loans.use: to upkeep and amortize his new vehicle

loans.name: Kasaija

texts.en:
Kasaija is a 45 year old man, married with five children; he lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He owns a retail shop selling electronics, and obtains other income from tendering works. He is hardworking, and began the business so as to be able to pay school fees for the children. 

He hopes to expand his electronics shop, though he mainly faces a challenge of fake electronic products. 

He is requesting the loan to buy more stock of electronics to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock of electronic products

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn earns an income through her fishing business. She is a married woman and has four children who are still attending school. For more than nine years, Ailyn and her husband have been earning through this venture. 

Ailyn wants to expand their business but lacks the financial resources to do so. She has decided to borrow funds to buy new fishing nets, nylon and a battery for the fishing boat. With this, she and her husband will be able to improve their catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. 

Ailyn hopes to make her business more sustainable and productive. She also wants to save money for her children's educational expenses.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, nylon and a battery for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: In the year 2011, Juanita borrowed a loan to start corn production. After several months, she was able to return her borrowed capital. To this day, Juanita feels she owes her good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as working capital. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase additional fertilizer for her corn production for a more productive corn harvest. Juanita wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply corn in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer for her corn production for a more productive corn harvest

loans.name: Businge Tukole Group

texts.en:
Gladys used the previous loan to rent land, prepare it, and buy seeds ahead of the planting season. She is a farmer who grows maize and beans for selling and home consumption. She also sells fresh foods for extra income. 

She ventured into this business in order to improve her agricultural enterprise, with a vision of being able to educate her children and fight poverty. She faces the hardships of weather changes and inadequate capital to sustain her business. Gladys is a member of Businge Tukole Group where members guarantee one another to get a loan. 

She is in need of a loan to improve her agriculture enterprise. Four members (pictured here) were part of the previous loan cycle but haven't asked for a loan for this cycle.

loans.use: to improve her agriculture enterprise.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a forty-three-year-old married male who used the previous loan to buy building materials for the construction of his house. Wilson is a teacher by profession and has been teaching for nineteen years.

Wilson has a dream of having improved standards of living. Wilson is a hard working and honest person although he is faced with the challenge of poor accessibility of basic needs due to bad roads. Wilson wants money to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming

loans.name: St.mathew Development Group

texts.en: Apollonali, age 59, lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is married and blessed with 12 children and a member of a village bank where members guarantee one another for a loan. He has a produce business and gets extra income from farming. Despite his progress, he is challenged by price fluctuations and the bad roads that make transportation of the produce to his customers difficult. However, his vision is to have a commercial house to store his produce in the urban centre. Apollonali has asked for a loan to buy more beans, rice and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more beans, rice and maize to sell.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
This is James. He is aged 67 years and is married with 10 children. He has an uphill task of taking care of his large family.

James runs a grocery store in Nakuru county, Kenya. He started the stalls two years ago, after changing from his previous business. He is happy the business is doing well. He attributes his success to the good customer care he offers to his customers. He is not able to meet the high demand of goods from his customers due to his limited capital.

A loan from Kiva will help James increase his stock and have a greater variety for his customers. This will increase his income and enable him take better care of his household.

loans.use: to buy more stock for his grocery stall

loans.name: Nhoeb's Group

texts.en: A local farmer living in Kampong Speu province, Nhoeb is 50 years old and a mother of six children. For her living, she grows rice as her main source of income. Moreover, she buys junk items for resale to supplement her income. She can earn an income of about 25,000 KHR per day. For Nhoeb, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is the group leader of three members to get a new loan. She will use her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that her family has better health than before.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Korng Pisey District

loans.name: Armina Duran

texts.en: Armina Duran is gaining a profit through her sari-sari (small grocery) store business. At the age of 44 and married, she never gets tired of tending her store since she is driven by her passion for selling. She earns a meager income from it that sufficiently supports her family. Armina Duran is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without any record of default. Now, she applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items to increase her inventories and her sales. Armina Duran continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the determination to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items to increase her inventories and her sales

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en: Edelyn has always dreamed of opening her own buy and sell business to support her only child. She used her loan to purchase inventories of pyrex, jeans, etc. She is now on her way to repaying the loan with her new profits.

loans.use: to purchase inventories of pyrex, jeans, etc. to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a pensioner and is juggling a business and supervising the renovation of their home. Elizabeth hopes to live comfortably in a house of good roofing supported by her loan of PHP 50,000. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. It matters that Elizabeth has been given priority as a Microfinance member of PMPC.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the renovation of her house to have a safe and comfortable place to live

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmer tiene 36 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Wilmer se dedica a brindar los servicios de limpieza y jornalería, contando con indumentarias propias, con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio, sus servicios los brinda en su distrito y alrededores, él solicita préstamo para compra de nuevos equipamentos, dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas, además de darle un valor agregado a su servicio, con gran influencia en el negocio; Wilmer piensa mejorar la productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona, lo que en un corto plazo le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Wilmer is 36 years old, cohabitating, has 2 children  and lives with his family in a rural area in the Oyotun district of the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region of the north coast of Peru. His community basically makes a living off of agriculture, cattle raising and trade.

Wilmer earns a living providing cleaning and labor services, he has his own garments system and more than 5 years of experience in this business. He provides his services in his district and its surroundings. He requests this loan to buy new facilities, said investment will help him to keep his equipment and tools in better conditions. Additionally, it will add value to his service with a great influence on his business.

Wilmer plans to improve the productivity of his services and in that way attend to the various needs of his customers in the area. In the short term this will allow him to improve his income, increase his earnings and in the end improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy new equipment, said investment will help him to keep his equipment and tools in better conditions.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a 33-year-old married man with five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He sells produce made from cassava flour and grows food crops such as Irish potatoes. 

Alex faces the challenge of limited capital. Besides that, he hopes to educate all of his children to the higher levels of learning. Alex needs a loan to buy cassava for milling and making flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava for milling and making flour to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, soap, and other merchandise to sell

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en: Micheal is a 30-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer and at the same time, he runs a mobile money business. He faces challenges of price fluctuation of agriculture prices and delays in transacting his mobile money business due to network problems. Despite that, he hopes to have a good family income. Micheal needs a loan to construct his house.

loans.use: to construct his house

loans.name: Lidia Nohemy

texts.es:
Lidia de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, está acompañada, el esposo se dedica a la albañilería y son padres de dos hijos.  

Lidia se dedica a los oficios domésticos y al cuido de dos cerdos que tienen, siempre como familia le gusta tener algo que para una emergencia les de dinero al venderlo, pero también tienen una ternera que la compraron de pequeña y la anda cuidando para que en un futuro sea vaca productora de leche.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es  para comprar una ternera que le vende un vecino y ya teniendo dos será mejor la producción de leche que tengan como familia cuando estas crezcan.  El crédito le ayudara mucho porque así se puedo ir haciendo de las cosas y ayudarle a su esposo en algo de los gastos de la casa, ya que le gusta tener gallinas y de los huevos comen y cuando alguien llega venden.

Los sueños que tiene son poder cuidar muy bien estas terneras y que crezcan y así que cuando ya sean vacas tener ese ingreso de la leche y el alimento, el que sus hijos salgan adelante y que terminen el estudio y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Lidia is 26 years old and studied up to 5th Grade. She is married and her husband works as a bricklayer. They have two children. Lidia does domestic work and cares for two pigs that they have. The family likes to have something they can sell to give them money in case of an emergency. They also have a calf that they bought quite young. She takes care of it, so in the future it will give them milk. She does this by herself as her husband is working and doesn't have time to take care of the animal.

The loan that she is requesting is to buy another calf from a neighbor. Having to cows will increase the milk production for the family when these calves grows. The loan will be very helpful because she will be able to do things and help her husband a bit with the household expenses. She would like to have chickens so they could eat the eggs and sell them to people who come looking for them. Her dream is to take good care of the calves and she will have the income and food from their milk. She wants her children to get ahead, finish their studies and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy another calf to increase milk production

loans.name: Kaphuza

texts.en:
Kaphuza is married and all of her kids attend school, which is the reason for her hard work.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Kaphuza has operated a kiosk business from her home for the past six years, selling to passersby and neighbors. She cites seasonality and theft as her main challenges. 

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase iron sheets for renovating her kiosk so that she can sell her goods in a modern kiosk. Her dream is to see her children get a better education and become important people in the society.

loans.use: to purchase iron sheets for renovating her kiosk

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana de 24 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, no tuvo la oportunidad de seguir estudiando. El esposo es empleado en seguridad pública, en esta relación han procreado una hija la cual tiene 3 años de edad aun no asiste a la escuela.

Ana se dedica a los oficios domésticos,  pero también ella trabaja la agricultura con la mamá y un hermano desde hace10 años, la mamá le ha enseñado mucho estos trabajos para que en un futuro ella pudiera defenderse en la vida, este trabajo le queda a una distancia de 10 minutos viaja a pie, en un horario de las 6:00 am a las 11:00 pm

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para complementar una parte del dinero que tiene en la compra de una parcela de terreno, ya  que el esposo cuenta con una parte del dinero y solo le hace falta poco para completarlo; esto ayudara mucho ya que el terreno esta cerca de donde ella vive y así le queda mejor a ellos para cultivarlo y así se van haciendo de sus cositas.
texts.en:
Ana is 24 years old. She received a primary education. Though, she didn't have the opportunity to continue studying. Her husband works in public security and they have a three year old daughter together, who has not yet started school.

Ana is a housewife, but she has also worked in agriculture with her mother and brother for the last 10 years. Her mother has taught her a lot about agricultural work so that she can make her own livings for the future. The place where they work is 10 minutes' walk from Ana's home and she works from 6.00 am to 11.00 pm.

A loan will help Ana add to the money that she and her husband have saved to buy a plot of land. Her husband has already put some money towards this, and they only need a little more to raise enough money. This will help her a lot because the land is near to where Ana lives and so it will be easier for them to work on it.

loans.use: to add to the savings to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married woman and has been blessed with 4 children who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Rehema operates a poultry selling business, which has been operational for 3 years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. 
Rehema dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

With the KES 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Ry's Group

texts.en: A mother of three children living in Kampong Speu province, Ry is 25 years old. She struggles to maintain her family's condition via rice cropping. This business earns her about 25,000 KHR per day. For Ry, this is her first cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of eight to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will use her loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that her family has clean water to use.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en: Chanthy, 47, lives with family members in a rural village of Kampong Speu province. She has five children, two of whom are in university. She grows rice as her single source of income. She can earn an income of about 20,000 KHR per day. For Chanthy, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is the leader of a group of six members to get a new loan. She will use her loan to buy a water filter. She expects that her family will have clean water to use.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Sero

texts.en:
Sero, 37, is married with three children, and all attend school. He trades in goats and works 10 hours a day and six days a week. He also does mechanics to supplement his daily income. He has applied for a loan of UGX 3,000,00 to buy spare parts for his mechanic business.

He started his business in 1999 to have income to look after his family. His business is located in Bushenyi district, and his customers are people of all categories. He hopes to be financially stable and buy a car after getting the loan money and investing it in his businesses. 

He is faced with the challenge of limited capital which affects his business negatively, but he hopes to overcome it after getting the loan. Through his hard work, he is determined to grow his businesses massively. 

Pictured is Sero with the UGAFODE credit officer (on the right).

loans.use: To buy tools and spare parts for his auto repair business.

loans.name: Nai's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in Kampong Speu province, Nai is 45 years old and a mother of five children.

To support her family, she earns an income to improve her family's condition via rice cropping. Moreover, she buys junk items for resale to earn extra income. This is the first time for Nai with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of two, she is the group leader.

She will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that her family can live in healthy way.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Korng Pisey District

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
La tierra ha sido bendecida por manos que les gusta trabajar y cuidarla.  Es un oficio digno de admirar el que hombres se dediquen por años y para toda la vida.  La tierra sin la labor de hombres campesinos dedicados al cultivo de la misma, no daría los frutos que sostienen generalmente a toda generación, es el trabajo que realiza Francisco de 31 años de edad  y es residente en Sololá el tiene 2 hijos y 1 hija todos ellos estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad.

La actividad que  realiza es la siembra de maíz, el eligió esta actividad porque cuenta con terreno y clima apta para la siembra de ello y le genera muy buenos ingresos económicos para el, la segunda actividad que el realiza es la venta de abarrotería  en su comunidad siempre con la visión de ayudar a sus vecinos en su comunidad en sus consumos diarios.

El uso respectivo que el le dará al crédito que el realiza es para la compra de fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz. Una de las metas de Francisco es incrementar su producto de maíz y mejorar  sus prácticas de manejo en el cultivo de ello para tener mejores ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
The land has benefited from hands that like to work and care for it. Caring for the land is a dignified profession that others admire and to which many dedicate years of work, and often their entire lifetime. Land without dedicated manual labor to cultivate it does not bear the fruit that sustains entire generations.  This is the work that Francisco does. He is 31 years old and lives in Sololá. He has 2 sons and one daughter. All three children attend school in the community.

He grows corn.  He chose this work because the region has the proper soil and climate for corn. This work generates a good income for his family.  He also sells groceries in the community, always with the vision of helping his neighbors have enough to fulfill their daily needs.

He is seeking a loan so that he can buy fertilizers for his corn crops. One of his goals is to increase production of his corn and to improve the management of the land so that he can increase his income in order to improve the welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn lives in the town of Concepcion, Iloilo. She is 40 years old, married and has three children. For more than 10 years now, Merlyn and her husband have been earning an income though their fishing venture. Fishing is the main source of income in their locality.

Merlyn wants to take a loan to buy plywood, nails and epoxy for the repair of her fishing boat. Once the repair is complete, her husband will be able to go back to fishing, thus allowing him to improve his daily catch.

Merlyn hopes to expand their business in the future. She wants to save money for the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy plywood, nails and epoxy for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es:
Agustin tiene 32 años de edad de estado civil casado vive con su esposa e hijos de 8 y 7 años de edad en el cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar, en la comunidad Nueva Esperanza.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Rural Cooperativa Curi-Ñan  se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad de Nueva esperanza, esta se dedican a las labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Agustin se dedica a la agricultura y a la cría de animales. Solicita el crédito para la compra de cerdos y ganado para criarlos y venderlos. Su meta es seguir realizando sus proyectos para el sustento de su familia. Su desafío es las enfermedades. en su tiempo libre  le gusta salir a caminar.
texts.en:
Agustin is 32 years old and is married. He lives with his wife and children of 8 and 7 years in the Guaranda canton in the Bolívar province, community of Nueva Esparanza.

He is a member of the rural cooperative bank Curi-Ñan, found in the community of Nueva Esparanza. It's dedicated to agricultural and livestock work.

Agustin earns a living through agriculture and raising animals. He's seeking the loan to buy pigs and cattle to raise and sell. His goal is to continue completing his projects to sustain his family. His weakness is illness. In his free time, he likes to go out for walks.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie signed up her membership with PMPC to avail herself of the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital it extends to a small time borrower like her. Elsie was able to turn the tide in her favor and makes good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she availed herself of a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to mount a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José tiene 49 años de edad  de estado civil casado vive con su esposa e hijos de 14 y 15 años de edad en el cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar, en la comunidad Nueva Esperanza.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Rural Cooperativa Curi-Ñan  se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad de Nueva esperanza, esta se dedican a las labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
José se dedica a la agricultura y a la cría de animales. Solicita el crédito para la compra de cerdos de raza para criadero. Su meta es aumentar su negocio y sacar adelante a su familia. Su desafío es la falta de apoyo al sector agricola. En su tiempo libre le gusta ver la televisión y salir a pasear.
texts.en:
José is 49 years old and married. He lives with his wife and children who are 14 and 15 years old in the Guaranda canton, Bolivar province in the Nueva Esparanza community.

He's a member of the rural bank Curi-Ñan which is found in the Nueva Esparanza community. It's dedicated to agricultural and livestock labor.

José earns a living through agriculture and raising animals. He's seeking a loan to buy breeding pigs for a nursery. His goal is to improve his business and bring his family ahead. His challenge is the lack of support for the agricultural sector. In his free time, he likes to watch TV and go out for walks.

loans.use: to buy breeding pigs.

loans.name: Annonciata

texts.en:
Annonciata is 65 years old. She is married with two children aged 47 and 25 years, both of them married. 

She sells electronic equipments and has been selling them for 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more electronics for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more electronics for sale.

loans.name: St Theresa Girls Group

texts.en:
Cleo is grateful to Kiva, whose support has made him increase his income. Cleo is a sixty-five-year-old married man with six children. He is a member of St.Theresa Girls group and lives in Kasese, Uganda. 

Cleo operates a retail shop of general merchandise and has been in that business for fourteen years. He began the business to generate income for his family. Cleo has a dream of turning his business into a supermarket. 

Cleo wants money to buy sugar, salt, millet, flour, cassava flour, and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, millet, flour, cassava flour, and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 28 years old and married with one child. They live in Kasese, Uganda. For four years, Agnes has been teaching - a profession she joined because she wanted to socialize with children. She is hardworking, and dream of making a business of her own. 

She is requesting a loan to buy land for settlement with her family.

loans.use: to buy land for settlement with her family.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia, aged 40, is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a retail shop selling from home to her neighbors and passersby.She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Sofia dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 50,000, she wants to purchase a stock of wheat flour, maize flour and beans for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of wheat flour, maize flour and beans for her business

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a resident of Sanga, Kiruhura district, Uganda. She has four biological children and two other dependents, all in school. 

She started farming about five years back, but could not yield anything because of the poor methods she was using. That is when she got to know UGAFODE Microfinance and acquired a loan of 1,000,000 UGX, which helped her farming business grow. Because of Annah’s hard work, she continued expanding. 

Now she is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to diversify her farming business; thus hiring labour and buying improved maize seeds.

loans.use: to hire labour and buy improved seeds.

loans.name: Carlos Gilberto

texts.es:
Carlos de 61 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, en el tiempo en que se iba creciendo, la educación era bastante escasa ya que no contaban con escuelas, si no que en una casa habitacional les enseñaban.  Se casó a la edad de los 18  años, su pareja se dedica a los trabajos del hogar, a procreo tres  hijos con su pareja, quienes son mayores de edad y trabajan.

Carlos es empleado desde hace más de 9 años, se desempeña como personal administrativo, con esta fuente de ingreso a logrado sacar a delante a su familia y darle estudio a sus hijos,  anteriormente trabajo en la agricultura, que la aprendió por medio de su hermano mayor. El trabajo en la alcaldía le queda a unos 300 metros de su casa, se desplaza a pie, el horario que cumple es de  8:00 am a 4:00pm.  A Carlos se le tramito un crédito anterior por kiva, dándole una oportunidad de poder  realizar sus proyectos, lo que se ha visto que ha logrado mejorar su condición de vida al poder mejorar su vivienda. 
  
El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar  cuatro láminas Zinc Alum de 4 metros de largo, para ponerle techo a la habitación que anteriormente estaba construyendo. 

Desea preparar bien su casa para que en un futuro tenga mejor valor de adquisición, para sus hijos espera dejarles una herencia digna donde al vender pueda cada quien obtener una buena parte, ya que con la construcción tendrá un mejor valor la propiedad. De lo que gana de su empleo pagara la cuota que le genera el préstamo.
texts.en:
Carlos, 61, studied up to fourth grade.  Education was very scarce when he was growing up because they didn't have schools; they were taught in homes.  He got married when he was 18.  His wife is a homemaker.  He had three children with his wife; they're adults and they work.

Carlos has been employed for more than nine years.  He has been able to get his family ahead and pay for his children's education with this source of income.  Previously he worked in agriculture, which he learned from his older brother.  His job in the town hall is about 300 meters from his house.  He walks to work and works from 8 a.m. until 4 p.m.

Carlos received a previous Kiva loan, which gave him to opportunity to be able to complete some projects.  He has managed to improve his living conditions by improving his home.  

The loan he's requesting from CrediCampo is to buy four four-meter sheets of metal roofing to put a roof on the room he was building before.

He wants to get his house ready so in the future it has a better sales value.  He hopes to leave his children a decent inheritance from which each one can get a good part when it's sold, because with the construction the property will be more valuable.  He'll make his loan payment from what he earns from his job.

loans.use: to buy four sheets  of metal for the roof that he built

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. Teresa lives in the town of Concepcion, Iloilo. She supports her husband in their fishing business. For the past 17 years, this business has provided them the income that they need. Teresa also earns additional income from her hog-raising business. 

For now, Teresa wants to avail herself of a loan to buy a new boat engine, plywood, hardwood, and nails, and to pay for the labor. This investment will allow Teresa and her husband to expand their business as well as their income.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine, plywood, hardwood, and nails, and to pay for the labor.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida and her daughter live in Armavir. Her daughter studies at the Pedagogical University.

Aida established her own business at a rented store where she sells clothes for men and women, and also a small assortment of children's clothes. This business is the only source of income for Aida's small family.
 
She asks for this loan to be able to buy a new winter collection of clothes for men. She will be very grateful to lenders for their support of her trading business.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothing for the clothing store

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.en: Inocencia has a farm in Mahayag. She grows a variety of commodities from fruit trees, root crops, rice and corn. Farming is her primary source of income for her family. She makes it a point to have good land preparation for the maximum yield and will have a good income. Recently, she needed a loan to pay for irrigation costs, which she received from Paglaum MPC. She wishes to sustain her business and be able to supply various commodities in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs for irrigation to soften the tillage pans

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 32 years old and is married. She has three school-going children between the ages of seven and twelve.

For the past fifteen years, she has been selling fruit. She will use the loan to buy more fruit to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Safari

texts.en:
Safari is single. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

Safari has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour and maize flour from home to his neighbours. He faces a challenge of delayed payments by creditors in his business. Safari dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000, he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking fat oil.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Nadila

texts.en:
Nadila vehemently thanks the kiva lenders alongside UGAFODE Microfinance for the support accorded to small entrepreneurs. She is not sure how she would be managing had it not been for the financial boost. 

Nadila started her own school, which she renovated with the first Kiva loan. She is still overwhelmed by the large number of pupils in a small place. She is therefore requesting a loan to continue expansion of the school. She is hard working and is optimistic she will break even in a short period of time.

loans.use: to buy building materials to add a room to expand her school.

loans.name: Leyla

texts.en:
Leyla is 65 years old and lives in the village of Lernagog in the Armavir region.
 
Leyla has a nice and big family; she lives with her husband, son, daughter, daughter-in-law and three grandchildren. 

On her farm, Leyla has 6 cows, 2 pigs, a calf, and 20 chickens. Thanks to her farm, she sells milk, meat and eggs. Leyla also cultivates wheat, barley, tomatoes and peppers, which also bring profit to her family. All of Leyla's family members help her greatly; her husband helps in agricultural occupations, and her son helps her in the care of the farm cattle.
 
Leyla has applied for this loan to be able to purchase seeds and fertilizer and hire workers for land cultivation. She is sure that this will surely make a greater profit for her and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and fertilizer and hire workers for land cultivation

loans.name: Baballe

texts.en:
Baballe is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Baballe joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children. He e is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. 

As a result of his previous loan for inputs, Baballe expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize; double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Baballe would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Baballe can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Baballe to generate earnings of up to $1000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. When asked, Baballe said: “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to make more money for myself and my family."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses such as paying school fees, buying food and repaying a farm loan

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen, age 41, is married and does tea farming in rural Ishaka, Bushenyi District. He is a hardworking man who works 8 hours a day and 6 days a week. He also sells bananas from his own plantation where he earns additional income to support his needs. He began his businesses in 2005 to be able to earn income to care for his family and to educate his children. 

He has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to buy fertilizer for his plantations. His clients are factories and tea traders who have supported his farming. He hopes to be financially stable and to educate all his children for a better future. However, he is faced with the challenge of poor weather during the dry season, which affects his business negatively. He has learnt to manage it with fertilizing the soil, which prevents the tea leaves from drying up.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer for his tea crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: María de 55 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su hijo de 32 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que vive feliz junto a su hijo, ya que además de tener su casa, posee un pequeño negocio de venta de tortillas, con el que se gana la vida desde hace 30 años, ella ha logrado mantener su negocio durante tanto tiempo en el gusto del público gracias a que sus productos son de muy buena calidad y a precios considerables. María ha observado que cada vez son más los clientes que solicitan su productos por lo que se siente muy feliz pero sabe que si compra los ingredientes como el maíz por mayor sus ganancias serán mejores por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito para invertir en: maíz, cal y gas propano para elaborar las tortillas que tanto gustan a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria is 55 years old. She lives in her own house with her 32 year old son. She is a woman who lives happily with her son. 
She owns her house and a small tortilla business. She has been making a living with this business for the last 30 years.

She has been able to keep customers attracted to her business because she offers high quality products and good prices.

Maria has realized that more customers each time request her products, so she is very happy; but she also knows that if she buys ingredients wholesale, such as corn, her profits will be better. 

That's the reason why she has decided to request a loan to invest in corn, lime, and propane to make the tortillas that her clients like so much.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, and propane for her tortilla business

loans.name: Pablo Humberto

texts.es: Pablo Humberto, tiene la edad  de 22 años, está en unión libre, vive con su esposa la cual es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de terneros para el engorde. La idea es aprovechar el espacio que tiene de pasto y las buenas condiciones de terreno y clima  y el agua potable que cuenta la finca para poder tener estos animales y a la vez obtener animales para el futuro venderlos para carne. Con esta compra podrá desarrollar una actividad más, y a la vez tener un ahorro que le permitirá ir teniendo más animales e invertir más en la actividad.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Pablo Humberto is 22 years old and is in a common-law marriage. He lives with his wife, who is his greatest priority. With this loan, he intends to buy calves to raise. The idea is to take advantage of the grassy space he has, and the good conditions of the land, the climate, and the drinkable water that the farm has to be able to keep these animals. At the same time he can obtain animals in the future and sell them for their meat.

With this purchase, he will be able to develop another activity, and have a savings that will allow him to go on acquiring more animals and invest more in raising them. This is the first loan he will receive from FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans before from state banks, but FUDECOSUR can provide him a loan with more facilities and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine, 35, is married. She has four school-going children between six and thirteen years old.

For the past three years, she has been selling shoes. Christine will buy more shoes to sell with the loan. She will use the business profits to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is married. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Riziki cooks food to sell at the market and sells to town dwellers and passersbys. She cites price fluctuations as a challenge in her business. She dreams of establishing a café business in the future.

With the 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Precious Mawuena

texts.en:
Precious is a first year student at the Wisconsin International University College, pursuing a Bachelor of Arts in Business Administration. She hopes to become a marketing officer in the future. The loan is to help pay her school fees.

Her profession interests her because she enjoys working with people. After her course she would be able to support herself and the people around her,  most importantly those who might need her help in one way or the other in her community, especially where she comes from, Anlo-Afiadenyigba.

She believes that in the next five to ten years she will be working in a reputable company, practicing her profession with the needed skills and intelligence to help her excel in what she does. A friend’s mother and a cousin of hers, who lost their parents as they were growing up, inspired her to get a higher education, because they have made it in their career in spite of their loss.

If she did not have access to this loan, she would have had to put furthering her education on hold for some years in order to save up to finance her education. “It is a laudable program," she says, "and I applaud investors for such noble cause to help alleviate poverty and create more jobs for the youth”.

loans.use: To pay her tuition fees for her Bachelor in Business Administration

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is a forty-year-old man who does farming and also has a business selling pork, which he started in 2003. He is a married man with five children. He is a hardworking man, who started his businesses to be able to have a sustainable source of income so that he could educate his children. The business is located in Kabagoma, Katojo, Ruharo ward, Igara, Bushenyi district and his clients are pork eaters of all categories. He has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to buy pigs for slaughter. His major challenge is competition from other business people of the same category but he is determined to grow his businesses. He hopes to boost his business after getting a loan and in the long run to achieve his dreams.

loans.use: To buy pigs for slaughter.

loans.name: Manuel Alejandro

texts.en: Manuel is currently working as a freelance. He edits video for a TV company, operates the video camera for the Arena Mexico. He does independent photography work, and video and web design and maintenance. As a photographer, he works with different clients. Manuel is the founder of a crew, called Dots Films, and of his own photo studio. He is planning to invest this loan into new equipment and providing new services such as drone (helicopter for altitude shots in videos), and improved techniques and fiber optic lighting production photo.

loans.use: to buy new equipment and provide new services, including a drone for getting shots from altitude for videos

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is Kubo.financiero's client, and this is her story. Miriam is 33 years old. She has been married for 12 years to Manuel, and she is the mother of two boys who are 11 and 7 years old. Together, they live in a house they own. Miriam describes her family as a united one.

In addition to her husband's income, Miriam makes a living by selling baby care products. These include items such as diapers, bottles, cream, shampoo and powdered milk. She asks for this loan to provide products for her business, which will increase her sales and her income.

Thanks to the effort she puts into her business, Miriam has been able to have her own house. She looks forward to keeping her business stable and making it grow.

loans.use: to stock up her baby care products business

loans.name: Cruz

texts.en: Cruz is a businessman in Aloran. He runs a retail store selling bamboo poles, charcoal and firewood. Having this type of business has supported his family, especially in the education of his children. Recently, he applied for a loan to purchase bundles of firewood to sell. Cruz believes having enough inventory would allow him to cater to his customers' needs. He is thankful that he has signed up for membership with PMPC as his financing partner.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Khomiya

texts.ru: Хомия проживает в маленьком городке Турсунзоде. Ей 51 год. Ее дети школьники. Она зарабатывает на жизнь путем предоставления услуги швеи. Хомия берет заказы на шитье на дому. Таким образом, она может не платить налоги и ей удастся собрать больше дохода. На обеспечения и образования детей уходит много средств и Хомия старается больше работать и больше зарабатывать, чтобы откладывать на будущее. На данный момент Хомии необходимо купить швейные принадлежности, чтобы создать условия работы и продолжить деятельность. Она намерена на заемные деньги купить все необходимое для работы, и надеется, что ей не откажут в кредите.
texts.en: Khomiya lives in the small city of Tursunzoda.  She is 51 years old.  Her children are still in school.  She makes a living offering sewing services; she takes orders and works from home.  This allows her to not pay taxes and consequently make a larger income.  Because the children's upbringing and education are very costly, Khomiya is eager to increase her workload and income, which will enable her to save some money for the future.  At the moment, and in order to continue her activity, she needs to buy some sewing supplies for her home-business.  She plans to use her loan to buy everything she needs to work.  She is hoping that she will not be turned down for this loan.

loans.use: to buy some sewing supplies.

loans.name: Esmaelita

texts.en:
Esmaelita is 56 years old and lives in Dumingag, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with four children. 

Esmaelita has focused on her farming activities and earns by selling her harvest with the support of her husband. She requested a loan to pay for seedlings and compost for good crop results. Esmaelita has been a member of PMPC for five years. 

In the future, Esmaelita hopes to have a good life and that her children will finished their studies.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost

loans.name: Babylyn

texts.en: Babylyn is a collector and seller of ornamental garden plants. She finds pleasure in gardening, and also in earning an income for her family. As a member of PMPC, she is seeking financial help to purchase a variety of ornamental plants to grow and sell. In the future, she wishes to become the supplier of flowers to the neighbouring towns.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of ornamental plants to grow and sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 59 years old, married, and lives at Ozamiz City, Philippines.  With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own as well. Through Pauglam PC she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets & feed. 

Now she requests a loan of 12,000PHP to buy additional feed. She really hopes & prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. 

Someday she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for growing hogs

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is a married woman with children. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Tatu has operated a food making business, making stables like beans and chapatti (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbours. She mentioned the high cost of purchasing food stuff to be her major challenge. 

With the Kshs 25,000, she wants to purchase food items like wheat flour, cooking fat oil, sugar, and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and wants to establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking fat oil, sugar, and beans

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is a 45-year- old male married with 10 children living in Kasese, Uganda. Jonathan sells fish and has been a fish monger for 10 years and also does brick laying to get a side income. Jonathan began the business in order to look after his family and pay school fees for his children. 

Jonathan has a dream of  expanding his business, however he is faced with a challenge of limited capital. 

He wants money to buy fish for selling.

loans.use: to buy fish for selling.

loans.name: Tania Lisseth

texts.es:
Desde pequeña Tania creció viendo como el negocio de su papa crecía y como lo administraba, eso fue uno de los motivos por los cuales decidió seguir los pasos de su papa y ahora estudia administración de empresas, cursa su último año y como ayuda extra está trabajando como promotora de venta, sin embargo su sueño siempre ha sido poder honrar a sus padres con un buen trabajo acorde a su carrera y de esa manera recompensarles toda la ayuda y apoyo que le brindaron. Tania a sus  21 años es una joven, exitosa, enfocada, responsable, dedicándose un cien por ciento a sus estudios, para ser una profesional de calidad.
Tania con mucho entusiasmo quiere culminar sus estudios y por eso solicita un crédito para solventar los gastos de titulación, ya que de esta manera podrá ejercer su carrera en un trabajo acorde a ella, deposita su confianza en el financiamiento para poder terminar sus estudios con éxitos y ser una profesional de calidad, y al mismo tiempo será un soporte económico en su familia, para poder tener oportunidades futuras, como una casa, un auto, o estabilidad económica, como metas a futuro Tania quiere seguir especializándose, estudiando cursos que le ayuden a desarrollar su carrera en su quehacer diario.
texts.en:
Since she was little, Tania grew up seeing how her father's business was growing and how he managed it.  This was one of the motives because of which she decided to follow in the footsteps of her father and now she studies the business administration.  She is in her last year and as an extra assistance she is working as a sales promoter.  Regardless, her dream has always been to be able to honor her parents with a good job according to her career and in this way repay them for all the help and support they offered her.  Tania, 21, is a successful, focused, responsible, young woman who dedicates herself 100% to her studies in order to become a quality professional.
Tania wants with much enthusiasm to complete her studies and for this reason she is requesting a loan to cover the expenses for a degree, since in this way she will be able to realize her career in a job which suits her.  She puts her faith in the financing in order to be able to finish her studies successfully and be a quality professional; at the same time, be an economic support for her family; and in order to be able to have future opportunities, such as a house, a car, or economic stability.  As a future goal, Tania wants to continue specializing, studying courses which will help her develop her career in her everyday activities.

loans.use: to cover the expenses for a degree.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 63 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children now at their adult age.
 
Gloria is engaged in an agri-business, specifically in rice production, for 13 years already. She earns approximately PHP3,000 each month doing this type of business activity. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing commercial fertilizer and sprays for her rice production activity. 

Gloria has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, she hopes to acquire an additional parcel of riceland.

loans.use: To purchase commercial fertilizer and sprays

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is age 44, married to a overseas Filipino worker, and they're blessed with six children. She has owned and managed a internet cafe in their village for almost four years, and earns PHP 800 daily. 

Due to insufficient funds from her business, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to have additional capital to purchase 10 units of personal computers for her internet cafe. 

She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase 10 units of personal computers

loans.name: Daphne

texts.en:
Daphne is a widow with four children who are all of adult age. 

Daphne's major source of income is rice farming, but she is also engaged in palay/rice trading and sells rice. She has been in this business for thirty years already. The business helped her to meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children until they graduated and got jobs. She is still continuing the business because it provides a good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. 

Daphne wants to live comfortably in a house with good roofing. She is also planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She previously received loans to purchase more sacks of palay to produce more rice. 

Now Daphne is re-applying for a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase materials for her house that will provide a safe, wide, and comfortable living space for her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her house to provide a safe, wide, and comfortable living space for her family

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma, 38 years old, is married and a resident of Taboc Norte, Oroquieta City, Philippines. Her husband is a fisherman. The fish he catches is sold to the public market or to their neighbors. They have been in this business for many years already. 

Since she wants to be more productive, she has now decided to enter into business herself, purchasing fish in bulk for sale at the market. On June 25, 2011, both Vilma and her husband agreed to join Paglaum MPC to avail a loan because they wanted to buy fishing nets. But aside from the financial assistance they received, they say that they also enjoyed the add-on benefits like insurance and savings.  

She has now applied for a loan of 30,000PHP to buy more fish to sell and to increase inventories and able to generate more income. She is hoping that with Paglaum’s help, and with patience & diligence of her husband, she is looking forward to being a successful vendor someday and to owning a stall in the public market.

loans.use: To buy more fish

loans.name: Verna

texts.en:
Verna, 44, lives in the town of Concepcion, Iloilo. She is a married woman and a mother of five grown up children. For the past eight years, Verna has worked with her husband in their fishing business.
 
To help expand their fishing business, Verna has decided to take a loan to buy new fishing nets, and materials for the repair of the fishing boat, like wood, paints, nails, epoxy and to pay for the labor of the repair. 

A loan will enable them to improve their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

Verna is optimistic that in the future she will be able to improve their state of living together with her family.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, and materials for the repair of the fishing boat, like wood, paints, nails, epoxy and to pay for the labor

loans.name: Enji Group

texts.en:
Zeinab is the featured borrower of Enji Group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends. 

Zeinab is a 39-year-old married mother of four children. She sells clothing from her house to support her family, and she is responsible for seven family members in total. Zeinab's portion of the loan will be invested in increasing her stock of merchandise by purchasing new winter clothing items.

In the future Zeinab hopes to expand her business and increase her income by opening her own clothing shop. In the photo, she is the lady on the left, Nawal is in the middle, and Samiha is on the right.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing for resale.

loans.name: Roger Gabriel

texts.es:
Roger es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, ha estudiado la carrera de Psicología en la Universidad y hoy ejerce su profesión trabajando en una Institución prestigiosa de su ciudad natal, Ica. Es una persona muy emprendedora y estudiosa, en sus tiempos libres brinda servicios de Consultoría a diversos clientes porque quiere ayudarlos a superar sus problemas. Es muy amable, alegre y honesto.
