Roger quiere crecer profesionalmente es por ello que piensa utilizar el crédito para poder tramitar su Título Profesional, él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva por su generosidad, quiere que ellos sepan que esto lo ayudará a sobresalir y más adelante espera abrir su propio consultorio.
texts.en:
Roger is a person with a lot of desire to get ahead and improve the quality of life of his family.  He studied for a career in psychology in the university and now he exercises his profession working in a prestigious institution in his hometown of Ica.  He is a very enterprising and studious person.  In his free time, he offers consulting services to various clients because he wants to help them get over their problems.  He is very friendly, happy and honest.
Roger wants to grow professionally which is why he is thinking of using the loan in order to be able to acquire his professional certificate.  He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity.  He wants them to know that this will help him get ahead and later on he hopes to open his own office.

loans.use: to cover the expenses to obtain his certificate in psychology.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent used the previous loan to buy a motorcycle. He still  rides a motorcycle, and also does farming to supplement his income. He faces a challenge with the rainy season, since the roads become impassable, hindering his motorcycle transport to boot. 

However, he hopes to have enough family income. 

Innocent needs a loan to buy land for further farming.

loans.use: To purchase land for farming.

loans.name: Ramzi Al- Wadi Group

texts.en:
This group is called Ramzi Al-Wadi. It consists of five women from Sana'a city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 190,000 YER from AMB.

Fatima is the leader of the group. She is a 43-year-old married woman, and a mother of seven children, living with them in a very small and old house. The family is inconvenienced with this condition. Fatima works as a housewife, and her husband is the breadwinner of the family. Fatima and her husband want strongly to expand the house by building other rooms. Unfortunately, their income is not enough to do that. For this reason, Fatima applied for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase construction materials to build one room in order to expand the house.

Fatima looks forward to building the second floor and renovating it to make more expansion possible for the house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build one room in order to expand the house.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is married, he is known in his neighborhood area for being a hard working father.  Francisco receives a monthly retirement pension. 

He became a member of PMPC and is actively participating in the various programs and services that the co-op offers. He hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house. He applied for a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase construction materials for his house to provide a safe living space for the family. 

He hopes to maintain his membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. 
This is what he is thankful for, when all his financing needs are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for his house to provide a safe living space for the family.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a forty year old man, married with five children, and living in Bundibugyo-Uganda. He buys and sells cocoa in Bundibugyo as a major source of income. He started the business in 1997 and has cocoa gardens.

He hopes to have more cocoa gardens in future so that he can sells from his own yields.

He is affected by inadequate capital to invest in cocoa buying. He wants the loan to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cesar is driven by a passion for selling. At the age of 47, a father in Oroquieta City, he operates a store that is the primary support for his family. Everyday he never gets tired of tending his store. 

Cesar is a full fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. He religiously repaid his obligations without records of default. Now, he has taken another loan to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, noodles and soft drinks to sell more and generate more income. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities for him and the ability to pay land rental each month. 

In the future, he dreams of sustaining his store to continuously provide for his family.

loans.use: to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, noodles and soft drinks to sell more and generate more income

loans.name: Annalie

texts.en:
Annalie is a farmer with a great deal of experience. She has mastered various farming activities including growing, tending, and harvesting. Annalie supports her husband with her farming income.  

Like a farmer, she has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows that she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase quality rice seeds which she hopes will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.  

Someday, she hopes to purchase another rice plot to cultivate, which will potentially add more income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase quality rice seeds that will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is from Buenavista, Oroquieta City. He is a very responsible and hardworking father when it comes to the welfare of his family. He has always been known to provide the best for his family. He earns a living through his farming activities. 

He hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which he applied for a loan of PHP 9,000. He plans to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks to provide a comfortable living space for the family. He hopes to maintain his membership in good-standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that he has been given a priority, as a regular member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). 

This is what he is thankful for, when all his financing needs are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for his house to provide a comfortable living space for the family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to do carpentry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy compost for his cacao plantings.

loans.name: Valeri Pamela

texts.es:
La socia Valeri Pamela se dedica al negocio de venta de joyas,la socia vende aretes,pulseras y collares,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le ve muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de joyas.La socia solicita el credito para comprar joyas como pulseras,collares y aretes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Member Valeri Pamela sells jewelry, including earrings, bracelets and necklaces. She works from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm. Valeri Pamela has been in this business for various years and she is doing very well. Her dream is is expand her jewelry business. 

Valeri Pamela is requesting a loan to purchase more jewelry, especially bracelets, necklaces, and earrings.

She is happy about the loan and is committed to complying with her schedule of payments.

loans.use: purchase jewelry such as bracelets, necklaces, and earrings to sell.

loans.name: Unidos Por El Destino Group

texts.es:
MARISOL  mujer de nacionalidad colombiana que por razones de violencia llegó al Ecuador en busca de refugio.
Ella lleva en ecuador 4 años- en los que ha podido obtener a través de brigadas de cedulación sus documentos locales.
Ahora ella goza de los derechos ciudadanos de este país. Donde ha podido emprender  su propio negocio de ventas de prendas de vestir para niños jóvenes y adultos.
MARISOL realiza sus ventas de forma ambulante en las calles de San Lorenzo.
Renta una pequeña vivienda donde habita con su pequeño hijo de 5 años. Es separada del padre de su hijo y no recibe ningún tipo de apoyo.
Ella espera poder construir su propia casa y establecer su negocio, brindar mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y prosperar en sus ideas de negocio.

Agradece mucho a FODEMI por preocuparse por la gente que no tiene oportunidad de adquirir préstamos en la banca tradicional y da la facilidad de emprender un negocio con un capital semilla.
texts.en:
Marisol is Colombian and came to Ecuador in search of refuge from violence. She has been in Ecuador for 4 years, during which time she has been able to get local documents through registration campaigns. Now she enjoys the rights of citizens of this country.

Marisol has opened her own business selling clothing for children, adolescents and adults. She sells clothing door-to-door in the streets of San Lorenzo. She rents a small home where she lives with her 5 year old son. She is separated from the father and does not receive any type of support.

Marisol hopes to build her own house and establish her business, giving her child a better quality of life and becoming prosperous. She is very grateful to FODEMI for caring about people that don't have the opportunity to get loans from traditional banks and for making it easy to open a business with seed money.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell in neighborhoods and communities.

loans.name: Candido Francisco

texts.es:
Don cándido tiene 59 años de edad, está casado y tiene seis hijos ya independientes. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de productos perecederos. Don cándido vio la necesidad de su familia por la falta de ingresos para sustentar sus gastos y es así como decidió poner su propio negocio que le ayudaria en las necesidades básicas logrando salir adelante ahora con mucho ánimo quiere expandir su negocio para incrementar sus ganancias y sustentar los gastos familiares. 
Cándido quiere seguir trabajando y sueña con establecer mejor su negocio, de esa manera solicita el crédito para la compra de aceite, azúcar, arroz y frijoles, para surtir su negocio y mejorar las ganancias, de esa misma manera podrá ampliar y viajar a otra comunidad que le ofrece un buen punto de comercio. Sus planes a futuro son trabajar con su propio capital. Deposita su confianza en el financiamiento de estos productos para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, obtener mayores ingresos a la economía familiar y mejorar, surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Don Cándido is 59 years old. He is married and has six children who are now independent. He is a businessman and works selling perishable products. Don Cándido saw his family’s need, due to a lack of income to support their expenses, and that is how he decided to create his own business that would help him with basic necessities. Now managing to get ahead with a lot of spirit, he wants to expand his business to increase his earnings and support the family expenses. 

Cándido wants to continue working and dreams of better establishing his business. In that way he requests a loan to buy oil, sugar, rice and beans in order to supply his business and improve his earnings. In that same way he will be able to expand and travel to another community that offers him a good point of business. His future plans are to work with his own capital. He places his confidence in the funding of these products in order to improve his quality of life and that of his family, obtain better income for the family economy, and improve and supply his business.

loans.use: to buy oil, sugar, rice and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build more enclosures for raising his pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Niche Group

texts.es:
XIMENA es una mujer joven de 27 años de edad - vive en San Lorenzo con sus 3 hijos (de 10-7-5 años) ella renta una pequeña casa en un barrio vulnerable de esta ciudad – 
Con su primer crédito el año anterior – ella comercializó prendas de vestir – negocio que no le dio buenos resultados – y  desde entonces  ella se dedica a la venta de arroz, azúcar, aceite - al por mayor y menor.
Con este nuevo crédito.  Ella aumentará su mercadería y podrá comercializar mayores cantidades de arroz, azúcar y aceites en las comunidades cercanas.
Espera poder ahorrar para dentro de 3 años poder tener su propia casa y que sus hijos puedan gozar de un espacio más acogedor.
XIMENA  es integrante del grupo “NICHE”  y se siente muy contenta de trabajar en beneficio de comunidades – llevando a bajo precio estos productos de consumo masivo.
Agradece mucho la gestión de FODEMI de llegar a los sectores más vulnerables y brindar la oportunidad de trabajar y superarse – sin solicitar tantos requisitos.
texts.en:
Ximena is a young woman, aged 27, who lives in San Lorenzo with her three children (aged 10, 7, and 5). She rents a small house in a vulnerable barrio of this city.

With her first loan last year, she sold items of clothing, but her business did not succeed. Since then, she has been selling rice, sugar, and cooking oil, at both wholesale and retail.

With this new loan, she will augment her merchandise, selling quantities of rice, sugar, and cooking oil at retail in nearby communities.

Ximena hopes to be able to save in order to have her own house within three years, so that her children can look out over a more agreeable location.

Ximena is a member of the “Niche” group, and she is very content to work to benefit communities, providing these products of mass consumption at low prices.

She greatly appreciates the efforts of FODEMI to come to the aid of the most vulnerable sectors and offer one the opportunity to work and advance themselves without making so many requirements.

loans.use: augment her merchandise, buying rice, sugar, and cooking oil, to sell in neighboring communities where people lack the opportunity to shop in nearby cities.

loans.name: Sevinc

texts.en: Sevinc is 28 years old, and married with two daughters. The father of the family earns money working as a worker and Sevinc is a gardener. She raises seasonal vegetables and greens in the backyard and sells them. She earns 150 AZN monthly and this is the main source of income for the poor family. She has been selling her harvest next to her house in a small grocery for 8 years and local people attend it very often. They know that she sells quality and fresh produce. Although Sevinc loves gardening very much, the income doesn’t cover her family’s demands. She applied for a loan of 1500 AZN in order to buy a small plot of land to grow more vegetables and fruits. She wants to make higher income and help her family.

loans.use: to buy a small plot of land to grow more vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Santos Angelica

texts.es:
La joven Santos es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de refrescos y  churros, desde hace 5 años.
Santos necesita el préstamo para la compra de más productos como refrescos, churros para seguir realizando su trabajo el cual le brinda una gran parte de sus ingresos. Con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos necesarios para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por sus cliente.
espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hermanos tengan los estudios necesarios, para que puedan tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre del  2014
texts.en:
Santos is a hardworking and responsible young woman. She lives in a community in the southern part of Honduras with her family. For 5 years Santos has run a business selling sodas and snacks. She needs a loan to buy more products like soft drinks and snacks to keep doing her work, which generates a large portion of her income.

With the loan she hopes to increase her sales. It would be very helpful for her because she currently doesn't have enough products to cover orders from her customers. She hopes in the short term to grow her business, and with that to continue supporting her family so that her brothers can go to school and have better opportunities in life.

- Choluteca, Honduras - September 2014

loans.use: to buy sodas and snacks for her business.

loans.name: Cloris Anabel

texts.es: La socia Cloris Anabel  se dedica al trabajo como farmacia,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es amplair el farmacia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar medicamentos para la farmacia.
texts.en: Member Cloris Anabel works as a pharmacist from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. She has worked in this business for several years and it is going very well. The member's dream is to expand the pharmacy. The member is applying for the loan in order to buy medicine for the pharmacy.

loans.use: to buy medicine for the pharmacy

loans.name: Ana Marisela

texts.es:
La joven Ana es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de cuajada y verduras desde hace 5 años, actividad que realiza en su casa de habitación y en un  mercado en el municipio donde vive. 
Doña Ana necesita el préstamo para la compra de más productos como plátanos, papas, yuca, cebolla, tomates, cuajada, etc. para seguir realizando su trabajo el cual le brinda una gran parte de sus ingresos.
Doña Ana con el préstamo espera que sus ventas de su negocio aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos necesarios para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes y gracias a esto poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar.
espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia.


Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre del  2014
texts.en:
Ana is a hardworking and responsible young person. She lives in a community in the south of Honduras with her family. She has had her business selling cheese curd and vegetables for 5 years, and she carries out this activity in her home and at a market in the town where she lives. Ana needs the loan to purchase more products like bananas, potatoes, cassava, onions, tomatoes, curd, etc. to continue working, as this provides a large part of her income. With the loan Ana hopes that sales will increase and that this will be valuable to her because she doesn't have enough products to meet orders placed by her customers. With increased household income, she hopes she can improve the quality of life for her family. She hopes to grow her business in the short-term and be able to continue supporting her family. 

Choluteca, Honduras - September 2014

loans.use: to buy bananas, potatoes, cassava, onion, tomatoes, curd, etc for her business.

loans.name: Prospero

texts.es:
Propero tiene 54 años, es conviviente, conocido en el medio, por prestar servicio de yuntas. Vive en casa propia, con cónyuge e hijo de 14 años respectivamente, su cónyuge se dedica a labores de casa, hijo estudia secundaria en colegio nacional de la zona. Propero tiene buenas referencias personales y laborales. Su familia es unida. Vive en una comunidad conocida por sus famosas ruinas de Saña, habitada por gente amable y respetuosa, que se dedicadan al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia. Dicha comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de Saña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Propero se dedica a prestar servicio de alquiler de yuntas y cargas de panca seca desde hace más de 05 años aproximadamente. Necesita préstamo para invertir en compra de un toro pequeño, para criarlo para posterior alquiler del mismo, lo que le perimitirá a unos meses mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Propero, 54, is married and lives in his own home with his partner and their 14 year old son. They live in a community known for the famous ruins of Saña. It is an area inhabited by friendly and respectful people who work in commerce, agriculture and livestock. This community is located in the district of Saña, in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayaque region on the northern coast of Peru.

Propero is known in the area for his business renting out his team of oxen and carrying loads of dried maize leaf. He has been doing this work for about 5 years. His wife works in the home and his son studies at the national secondary school in the area. His family is united. Propero has good personal and professional references.

He needs a loan to buy a young bull that he can raise and later rent out, which will allow him to increase his income in several months. This will result in an improved quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy a young bull.

loans.name: Fernando Jose

texts.es:
Fernando tiene 23 años de edad  de estado civil casado vive con su esposa e hijo de 4 años de edad en el cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar, en la comunidad Nueva Esperanza.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Rural Cooperativa Curi-Ñan  se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad de Nueva esperanza, esta se dedican a las labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Fernando se dedica a la agricultura y a la cría de animales. Solicita el crédito para la compra de cerdos y pollos para criarlos y venderlos. Su meta es aumentar su negocio para el bienestar de su familia Su desafío es la falta de empleo. En su tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear con su familia y realizar mingas de limpieza.
texts.en: Fernando is 23 years old, married and lives with his wife and 4 year old child in the Guaranda canton of the Bolivar province, in the community of Nueva Esperanza. He's a member of the Curi-Nan rural cooperative program, which is located in the community of Nueva Esperanza, and it's dedicated to farmwork and livestock. Fernando works in agriculture and in raising livestock. He's requesting a loan to purchase pigs and chickens to raise and sell them. His goal is to grow his business for the benefit of his family. A lack of employment is his challenge. In his free time he enjoys going out with his family and he takes care of cleaning chores.

loans.use: To purchase animals for fattening and selling

loans.name: Glenda Yosmary

texts.en:
The young Glenda is a very hardworking, responsible person who lives in a community in the south of Honduras with her family. Her business is making and selling bread and pastries, and has been doing it since 10 years ago. Glenda has her business at home in the municipality where she lives, and needs a loan to purchase flour, sugar, firewood, eggs, etc, ingredients to continue doing her job which provides a large portion of her income. Glenda hopes to increase her business' sales, fulfill her customers' orders and thus improve she and her family's quality of life with increased household income. In the short term she hopes to grow her business and continue supporting her family. 


Choluteca, Honduras – September, 2014

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, firewood, eggs, etc for her business.

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is a 31-year-old single lady who started four years ago to give private lessons to cover her expenses and needs. Besides her work, she started a year ago working as a hairdresser from her house. 

Maya is an ambitious and talented lady who is trying desperately to improve her living conditions, thus she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to open her own beauty salon. She hopes to achieve success in her business to save profit for her future.

loans.use: to open a beauty salon.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a thirty-four-year-old married female with three children, living in Kasese, Uganda. She used the previous loan to pay school fees for her children. Josephine has been selling cassava flour since 2000 and also does farming to increase her income. Josephine has a dream of educating her children and buying a house. Lack of enough capital is a challenge she faces. Josephine wants money to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
For the past two years, Veronica has sold rice to the people in her place in Iloilo, Philippines. A married woman and a mother of two children, Veronica works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of their children.

This business has given Veronica the opportunity to earn an income. As of this time, she needs additional capital for the expansion of her business. Veronica is now asking for a loan to buy more rice to sell and a new weighing scale. This will allow Veronica to sell more rice to her customers. In the future, Veronica hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell and a new weighing scale.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en: Leonardo is a pensioner and supervising the renovation of their home. Leonardo hopes to live comfortably with a house of good roofing. This will be supported by his loan of PHP 47,000 to purchase construction materials, which will allow him to provide a safe and comfortable living space for the whole family. He hopes to maintain his membership in good standing with a good repayment record. Leonardo was given priority as a regular member of PMPC. This is what he is thankful for when all his financing needs were supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to provide a safe and comfortable living space for the whole family.

loans.name: Demetrio Nicolas

texts.es:
Demetrio Nicolás vive en casa propia de material rustico, vive con su cónyuge y sus cinco hijos de edades 19, 15, 6, 3 y 2años de los cuales el de 15 cursa secundaria y el de 6 primaria en colegio nacional del caserío de Sondor, cuenta con 9 años radicando en la zona. Demetrio Nicolás cuenta con muy buena referencias tanto personales como laborales en su comunidad. La misma que está ubicada en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

La actividad a la que se dedica Demetrio Nicolás es la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, ubicado en el Caserío Sondor - Pucara, con una experiencia en el rubro de 7 años. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Demetrio Nicolas lives in a house of his own, built with rustic materials. He lives with his spouse and five children ages 19, 15, 6, 3, and 2. The 15 year old is in high school and the 6 year old is in a public elementary school in the village of Sondor. For 9 years he has lived in this area. Demetrio Nicolas has very good references, both personal and work-related, in his community. Said community is located in the Pucara district, in the province of Jaen in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru. The community is basically dedicated to agriculture, livestock, and business.

The activity to which Demetrio Nicolas commits himself is agriculture, specifically growing coffee in the village of Sondor in Pucara. He has 7 years of experience in this line of work. He'll use the loan provided to him on farmwork, adding and applying pesticides, fertilizers, and labor for the harvest. In this way he'll improve his crop physiologically, morphologically, and in terms of productivity, as well as obtaining a timely harvest. Thus he'll have better production, and a better quality product that he'll have no problem selling. In the short term this will allow him to improve his income, increase his profits, and thus improve he and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To do farmwork, adding and applying pesticides, purchase fertilizers, and pay for labor for the harvest.

loans.name: Maimuna

texts.en:
Maimuna is a married woman with children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to pay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase livestock to raise.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth owns and operates a junkshop. She has been successful in this business for many years. She repaid her previous loan which she used for her food stall. She also finds ways to improve her income through her small variety store.

Related to this, she would like to take a new loan to increase her profit. She is requesting an amount of PHP 17,000 which she will use with her current revolving fund to buy scrap and recyclable materials. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elizabeth hopes for her business to grow bigger and better. She dreams of giving her family a good life in the future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit lives with her husband in Dalarik village, in the Armavir region. She is involved in her farming business. On the farm Anahit keeps livestock (10 cows, seven calves and 40 chickens) as well as cultivating grass to feed the livestock. Anahit loves her farming business and takes care of it with great pleasure. 

Realizing how important agricultural income is for her family, she would like to enlarge her farm. Anahit asks for this loan of USD 3,000 to purchase eight oxen and enlarge her livestock.
 
Anahit will be very grateful to lenders for their support and goodwill.

loans.use: to buy eight oxen for the farm.

loans.name: Semu

texts.en: Semu is a thirty-five-year-old married man, with seven children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has a retail shop that has mixed merchandise and is very hard working. He started the business in 2012 with an aim of increasing his household income. He is affected by price fluctuations and competition. He wants a loan to buy merchandise such as curry powder, shoe polish and cooking oil for resale.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as curry powder, shoe polish and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Malikakhon

texts.ru: Маликахон родилась в 1970 году. Она очень добрая и трудолюбивая женщина. Маликахон родилась и выросла в семье простого рабочего. После окончания средней школы она вышла замуж за Маруфчона. Он работает в государственном учреждении. Маликахон сама занимается скотоводством. Она покупает скот, откармливает дома несколько месяцев и продает на местном рынке. Она всегда старается для благополучия своих детей. Данное время ее сын учится на первом курсе Технического Института Технологического Университета Таджикистана. Он изучает экономику и программирования и после окончания университета хочет работать в банковской сфере. Он отлично окончил среднюю школу и планирует окончить университет с красным дипломом. Маликахон запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора своего сына. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Malikakhon was born in 1970.  She is a very kind and hardworking woman.  She comes from a modest working-class family.  After finishing secondary school she married a man named Marufchon, who is currently employed in a public institution.  Malikakhon herself is involved in animal husbandry: she buys livestock, feeds her animals at home for a few months before reselling them at the local market.  She works very hard to provide a good life to her children.  At the moment, her son is a first year student at the Technical Institute of the Technological University of Tajikistan.  He is studying economics and programming, and he wants to work in banking after graduation.  He finished secondary school with outstanding grades and plans to graduate from university with honors.  Malikakhon is taking a loan to pay for her son's tuition fees.  She is awaiting your kindness and relying on your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for her son's higher education tuition fees.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married with six children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is a very hard working woman who used the previous loan to buy cocoa to sell. She has a cocoa garden and all her children are in school now. She hopes to expand her business and look after her children well.

She wants a loan to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Shahla

texts.en: Shahla  is 49 years old; she is married and raising two sons. Her elder son is married and lives with her parents together. Shahla is a farmer and has been raising fruits and vegetables for 25 years. She sells the harvest at the local bazaar and her husband and sons help her in this business. He gets additional earnings working as a laborer in his free time. The family gets 350 AZN monthly from selling the harvest and this is not enough to cover demands. The place where Shahla lives has a dry climate and she needs to build a greenhouse for the fruits and vegetables. She applied for a 1500 AZN loan in order to buy good gardening tools and hire workers for building the greenhouse.

loans.use: to buy good gardening tools and hire workers for building the greenhouse.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Элмира, 31 год, замужем, мать 2 детей дошкольного возраста. Образование у нее медицинское средне-специальное. В поиске источника доходов для своей семьи, она 4 года назад стала заниматься полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря непосильному труду и емкой работе Элмира достигла хороших успехов и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме около 5,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Элмиры имеется 1 дойная корова, 1 бычок, 10 овец и 2 лошади, также 1,36 ГА земли, где она выращивает картофель и эспарцет для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Так как в доме Элмиры живут и ее дети, и родители, она решила провести в дом отопление, поэтому и обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS). На полученный кредит Элмира купит котел для отопления, батареи, трубы и прочее. Утепление дома поможет позаботиться о здоровье ее семьи в зимний период. А доходы от бизнеса будут направляться на дальнейшее его развитие.
texts.en: Elmira is 31 years old, married, and the mother of two children who are not in school yet. She has a specialized secondary education in the health sciences.  Four years ago she started working in agriculture and animal husbandry to provide a source of income to her family.  Thanks to her constant labor and very hard work, she has done well and she now makes a monthly income of 5,000 som (KGS).  She currently owns one dairy cow, one young bull, 10 sheep and two horses, as well as 1.36 hectare of land on which she grows potatoes and sainfoin for the family's consumption and for resale.  Since she lives at home with her children and parents, she has decided to install a heating system inside her house.  For this reason, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy a heating boiler, radiators, pipes and other items.  With a heated house, Elmira will be able to take better care of her family's health during the winter months.  She plans to re-invest the earnings from her business into further expanding her activity.

loans.use: to purchase a boiler, radiators, pipes etc., in order to install a heating system inside her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, and seeds for her farming business.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en: Amalia is aged 50; she is married to a tricycle driver and blessed with two children. She owns and manages a retail store in their village for almost three years and earns a net income of PHP 200/day. Due to insufficient capital on her business, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase canned goods, noodles, breads, beverages, and personal necessities. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and continue to grow so that she can earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, noodles, breads, beverages, and personal necessities for her general store business.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred, aged  42, is a married woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She and her husband are engaged in a fishing business. For more than 17 years now, this business has given them the income that they need. 

Mildred wants to expand their fishing venture to augment their earnings. With that, she requested a loan to buy new fishing nets and to pay for the repair of the fishing boat. With this, they will be able to improve their fishing business as well as their income. Mildred hopes to make their business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and to pay for the repair of the fishing boat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase merchandise and stock her business.

loans.name: Songül

texts.en:
Songül is divorced and has a daughter. When she was married, she began making jewelry as a hobby. She made the pieces for herself and would give them as presents. When she got divorced, she went into business and began earning her living by selling jewelry. She opened a stand on the shore where she sells her jewelry. With the loan, she will buy materials and some pre-made jewelry. Her dream is to open a store. She wants her daughter to be educated so she won’t be dependent on anyone.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Songül Hanım eşinden ayrılmış bir kız çocuğu annesi.  Evli iken hobi olarak takı yapma işine başlamış.  Yaptığı takıları kendisi için yapıyor, yakınlarına hediye veriyormuş.  Eşinden ayrıldıktan sonra başka bir şegre yerleşiyor ve takı artık onun ekmek parası oluyor.  Sahilde stand açarak,çevresine satarak geçimini temin ediyor.  Aldığı kredi ile takı malzemesi ve birazda hazır takı alacak.  Hayali ileride bir dükkan açmak.  Kızını kimseye muhtaç olmadan okutmak.

loans.use: to buy materials and some pre-made jewelry for her jewelry retail business.

loans.name: Huriye

texts.en:
Huriye is married and has a daughter.  She decided to sell Tupperware at her aunt’s suggestion.  With her first loan, she became a Tupperware member and bought goods wholesale.  She sold them in three months.  She used what she earned to make new orders and continue her work.  With her second loan, she will again buy products wholesale. Huriye was satisfied with this job from the beginning. She was able to contribute to the household financially and meet her child’s needs, she explains.  She says it is very nice for a person to earn his or her own money, even if it’s only a little. She wants to continue working with Tupperware and become a group leader. She wants to help her husband with their dream of buying a house.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Huriye Hanım evli bir kız çocuğu annesi.  Teyzesinin önerisi ile Tuppware satmaya karar  verdi.  Aldığı ilk kredi ile Tupperware üye olup toplu ürün  aldı.  Aldığı ürünleri üç ay içinde sattı.  Kazandığı ile de yeni siparişler alarak işini ilerletti.  İkinci kredi ile tekrar toplu ürün alacak.  Huriye Hanım bu işe yapmaya başladığına  memnun.  Evine maddi katkı sağladığı gibi çocuğunun ihtiyaçlarını da karşıladığını belirtti.  İnsanın az da olsa kendi parasını kazanmasının çok güzel olduğunu söylüyor.  Tuppeware işinde daha da ilerlemek grup lideri olmak istiyor.  Eşine daha çok destek olup bir ev almak hayali var.

loans.use: to buy products for resale

loans.name: Muborak

texts.ru: Муборак живет вместе со своей семьей на севере Таджикистана. Она замужем и имеет сына. Муборак имеет высшее образование. Она работает в Худжандском Государственном Университете библиотекарем. Муборак в библиотеке работает более чем 30 лет. Она очень добросовестная и трудолюбивая женщина и выполняет свою работу на высшем уровне. Муборак сама очень много читает книг и считает, что самым лучшим другом человека является книга. Она обратилась в ИМОН за займом в сумме 2000 сомони для лечения зубов. Последнее время у нее очень болят зубы. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Muborak lives with her family in northern Tajikistan. She is married and has a son. She also has a higher education and works as a librarian at the Khujand State University.  She has been working in the same library for more than 30 years.  She is very conscientious and hardworking, and she does an outstanding job.  She reads a lot of books herself and believes that books are a man's best friends.  She is taking a loan of 2,000 somoni from "IMON International" to get dental treatment because she has recently had problems with her teeth, causing severe pain.  She is awaiting your kindness and relying on your generosity.

loans.use: To get dental treatment.

loans.name: Derya Aysun

texts.en:
Derya is married and the mother of two children. She worked as a beauty specialist until she became pregnant. Then she had to stop working because of health problems. Four years ago, with her husband’s support, she opened and began running a café. She began working with jewelry when she saw her friends doing this. In addition to selling from a stand on the shore in summer, she sells to her customers at the café year-round. She will use the loan to buy supplies for her café and pre-made jewelry. She wants to succeed at her work.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 

Derya Hanım evli iki çocuk annesi.  Güzellik uzmanı ve ikinci çocuğuna hamile kalana kadar kendi işini yapıyor.  Sağlığı el vermediği için bu işi bırakmak zorunda kalıyor.  Dört yıl önce eşinin isteği ile bir kafe açıp işletmeye başlıyorlar.  Arkadaşlarından görerek takı işine başlıyor.  Hazır takılar alıyor.  Sahilde stand açarak satışını yaptığı gibi yazları genellikle kafesinde müşterilerine de satış yapıyor.  Aldığı kredi ile kafesine malzeme ve hazır takı alacak.  İşinde başarılı olmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her café

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase livestock to raise and benefit from their milk and meat

loans.name: Sreythorn's Group

texts.en: A young mother of one kid living in Kampong Speu province, Sreythorn is 18 years old. To improve her living, she grows rice as her main source of income. Nowadays, she can earn about 20,000 KHR per day. This is Sreythorn's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of eight members to get new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that her family has clean water to use.

loans.use: To buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida is 27 years old, married, and she has 2 kids. Her husband earns money for the family by working as a driver. Saida has been working as a farmer for 10 years and has good skills in this area. She grows fig trees, then sells them at a local bazaar. For this she gets 150 AZN monthly.

Fig is a very useful and tasty fruit. Azerbaijan people prepare jams for dessert with tea. They use it as liquor when they catch a cold. Dried figs are also very useful for health. 

Saida needs money to make her garden better. She wants to build a greenhouse for fig trees and protect them from severe weather. Besides that, she wants to expand her business and increase her income. She needs to cover her family’s living expenses and children’s education. She applied for 1500 AZN in order to buy other fruit trees and raise them.

loans.use: to buy fruit trees and raise them.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is a 29-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. Jenelyn lives with her family in the town of Concepcion, Iloilo. Jenelyn makes a living through her sari-sari, or retail store, business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Her husband also works as a fisherman.

Jenelyn is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, cooking oil and condiments, and to buy a new fishing boat. A loan will help Jenelyn in augmenting her income as well as her husband's earnings. In the future, Jenelyn hopes to make their business more sustainable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, cooking oil and condiments, and to buy a new fishing boat

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en:
Arzu is 47 years old, married and the mother of 5 beautiful kids. She works as a seller in a small product shop. She sells sugar, sweets, cookies, a few sorts of tea and other goods. Her elder son helps her in her small business. Arzu's monthly profit is 195 AZN.
 
Azerbaijan people like drinking tea with sweets and cookies very much. It's a tradition from ancient times to produce tea in Azerbaijan and sell it. Azerbaijan tea is very delicious and flavorful. Every day and every event in Azeri families is followed by a tea party.
 
Arzu borrowed 1500 AZN loan from the Credit Union for the first time. She needs this money to expand her business and help her family. Arzu wants to provide her kids with an excellent education and to cover family's demands.

loans.use: to expand her business and help her family

loans.name: Serafin

texts.es:
Serafin tiene 48 años de edad. Reside en el distrito de Buenos Aires, junto su esposa en casa propia, él es natural de la zona. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila y se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, además del comercio. Dicho distrito está ubicado en la provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad a la que se dedica Serafin es a la producción y comercialización de plátano, desde hace más de 05 años, cuenta con clientela fija en la zona muy conocido y con buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales. Destino del crédito será para la compra de abonos para su plátano el cual tiene en producción y capital de trabajo para la comercialización del mismo. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Serafin is 48 years old. He lives in the Buenos Aires district with his wife in their own house. He is originally from the area. Life in the community is peaceful and they make their livings farming and raising cattle, as well as in sales. This district is located in the Morropón province, in the Piura region, on the northern coast of Peru.

Serafin has worked producing and selling bananas for more than five years. He has regular clients in the area, is well-known and has good references - both personal and work-related.

The loan will be used to buy compost for his bananas, which he has in production, and as working capital in order to sell them. This will allow him to improve his income over the short term, increase his profits, and therefore improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: buy compost for his bananas, which he has in production, and have working capital in order to sell them

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: reinforce and plaster the walls of his home

loans.name: Maria Elizabeht

texts.es:
Maria Elizabeht tiene 52 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo, en casa propia, en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Saña y goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Y está ubicada en el distrito de Saña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Maria Elizabeht se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de animales como cerdos, patos y pavos, desde hace más de 10 años de antiguedad en el negocio, en su propio domicilio. Ella solicita préstamo para la compra de alimento de engorde balanceado para sus animales. De esta manera hacer crecer mas su negocio, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Elizabeht is 52 years old and married. She lives with her husband in their own house in a large community in the urban area of Saña. She has good personal and work references from her neighbors. Her community works in farming, cattle raising and sales. The community is located in the Saña district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Peru.

Maria Elizabeht works raising and selling animals such as pigs, ducks and turkeys. She has been in this business for over ten years, from her own home. She is requesting a loan to buy balanced feed to fatten her animals. In this way, she can make her business grow more, which will allow her to improve her income in the short term, increase her profits and therefore improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten her animals

loans.name: Mazen

texts.en:
Mazen is a 44-year-old married father of three children, and a Palestinian refugee. Due to the low social and financial situations of Palestinian refugees in Lebanon, he started two years ago working as a blacksmith to cover the needs and expenses of his family.

Today, Mazen is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to expand his business through buying necessary iron products to facilitate his work and provide his customers with better and quick service. 

Mazen is trying hard to increase his income to improve his family's living situation.

loans.use: To buy necessary iron products

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Johnson is a hardworking, ambitious and go-getter farmer who is 57 years of age. He hails from Kianjiru, a small village in the Kerugoya area of Kenya. He comes from a very humble background, and did not manage to attend college, but that did not kill his spirit to succeed. He has actively been involved in farming for the past 10 years. Although he has made great strides in farming, he wants to diversify his farming, and is kindly seeking a loan to buy pigs. 

Pig farming is one of the profitable agricultural ventures in Kenya and Johnson, having an entrepreneur's mind, wants to take advantage of that to improve his living conditions. Johnson loves pig farming because pigs are not demanding to keep, unlike poultry, which require special care and attention. Johnson believes that with the loan his life will permanently change because he will be selling pork meat to the ready market that is available. As far as the market of pig products is concerned, demand is greater than supply. Johnson always says, “To become a successful pig farmer you need three ingredients and that is getting the right breed, giving the right feed, and proper care." With the loan he believes he will become a successful pig farmer and be able to realize his dream of transforming his life. Having been farming for the past 10 years, Johnson finds it very enjoyable to raise pigs because he does not spend more money on buying food. Pigs feed on remains that can be collected from hotels and restaurants and hence save a lot of money. Johnson will also sell manure from the pigs and use it on his farm, also saving much more money and improving his living conditions. Profits from selling pig meat to the local market and to the industry that produces sausages and bacon will be used to fully repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
The borrower's name is Gemma, a 47-year-old resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Dandy Roy, an artist, she has one child who is still in the elementary level. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal, household needs and to send her child to school. 

Gemma operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all the products are essential household items and food. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also sells snacks like hotcakes and the native food "puto" (steamed sticky rice), favorites among the Filipinos. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of 700 PHP (Philippines pesos) a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy grocery items such as sacks of rice, flour, sugar, charcoal, soda and other grocery stuff. She is positive about a good return on her investment. Her store earnings are their source to meet their daily expenses and to send her child to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Gemma hopes to maintain and grow her business into a canteen someday. She wants to give her child the best education until college. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional grocery items and ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Amanat

texts.en:
Amanat is 52 years old, married and she has two kids. Amanat is a good farmer. She raises seasonal fruits and then sells them at the local bazaar. Her monthly income is 200 AZN. She has been working in this field for 22 years and has a good experience.
 
People like eating fresh fruits. They use them to prepare juice or jam for tea. They also cook fruit cakes and other kinds of sweet things. People prefer to buy fresh fruits from Amanat, because her products are cheaper and don’t contain pesticides.
 
Amanat is a good mother. She does everything for her kids. She wants her children to be well-educated. She plans to increase her income and provide them with as excellent of an education as possible. She applied for a 1500 AZN loan in order to buy new fertilizers. She wants to raise and sell not only fruits, but vegetables too in order to expand her business and income.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizers for her farming business.

loans.name: Nazmiye

texts.en:
Nazmiye is married and the mother of five children. All of her children are married. She began selling Tupperware with her sister’s support. With her first loan, she bought goods wholesale. She sold them at meetings that she went to in homes. With her second loan, she’ll buy products wholesale. Nazmiye said she felt an emptiness and lack of purpose after her children married, but has a purpose again since she began this job. She is happy not to pass her days idly.


Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Nazmiye Hanım evli beş  çocuk annesi.  Çocuklarının hepsini okutup evlendirmiş.  Kardeşinin desteği ile Tuppware satışına başlamış.İlk kredisi ile toplu ürün alıp sattı.  Ürünlerini  gittiği ev toplantıların da satıyor.  İkinci kredisi ile de toplu mal alacak.  Nazmiye Hanım,çocuklarını evlendirdikden sonra boşlukda kaldığını ve amaçsız olduğunu ama bu işe başladıktan sonra yeniden bir amacının olduğunu söylüyor.  Günlerini boş geçirmediği için memnun.

loans.use: to buy products for her retail business.

loans.name: Sofik

texts.en:
Sofik lives with her husband (in the photo), father-in-law and 8-year-old daughter. This family is engaged in farming. They cultivate tomatoes and have some fruit trees (apricot, plum, peach and apple). Sofik's husband and her retired father-in-law greatly assist her in farming: They help to transport the harvest to market and sell it. 

Sofik has now applied for this loan to purchase  fertilizer, seeds and hire workers for gathering the harvest. The loan will greatly help this hardworking woman to develop her farming business. She hopes for your support.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, seeds and a workforce for gathering the harvest

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman. She stays at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

She operates a fruit selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is stiff competition from other fruits sellers. 

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits for resale at a profit. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits for resale at a profit

loans.name: Mangale

texts.en:
Mangale, aged 40 years, is married with five school-going children. They live at their own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She operates an agricultural selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of disease outbreak and pests affecting her crops.

With the loan she is requesting of 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase more seedlings and a water pump for water irrigation on her farm. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more seedlings and a water pump for water irrigation on her farm

loans.name: Cemile Mualla

texts.en:
Cemile is a widow and mother of two daughters. She makes prayer beads from semiprecious stones and sells them from a stand on the shore. She began work helping her daughter make and sell jewelry. Then she began making prayer beads. When she had enough, she began selling them at the stand. She is very happy with this work and finds it entertaining and enjoyable. She now has regular customers and makes items to order. With the loan she will buy materials wholesale in Istanbul. She wants to continue working as long as she is healthy enough.


Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Cemile Hanım dul, iki kız annesi.  Hakiki  taşlardan tesbih yapıp sahilde stant açarak satıyor.  Takı yapıp satan kızına yardım ederek işe başlıyor.  Sonra kendisi tesbih yapımına başlıyor.  Ürünleri çoğalınca kızının tezgahında kendi yaptığı ürünleri satmaya başlıyor.  Bu işden çok memnun kendisini oyaladığını zevk aldığını belirtiyor.  Artık kendisinin özel müşterileri olduğunu ve özel siparişler aldığını belirtiyor.  Aldığı kredi ile toplu malzeme alacak.  Sağlığı el verdikçe teşbih yapmaya devam etmek istiyor

loans.use: to buy materials wholesale to make prayer beads to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La  señora Vilma vive con su esposo y sus hijos en una comunidad al sur de el país, la actividad que realiza es vender productos por catalogo  y  cuenta con  más de 2 años de dedicarse a esta  actividad.
Doña Vilma está solicitando le préstamo para la compra de cremas, lociones, perfumes, talcos, champús, etc.  y así surtirse de mercadería para  mas mercadería para poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes  y esto contribuirá a tener una mayor ganancia y mejorar sus ingresos financieros en su hogar.
Doña Vilma espera poder cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos  su sueño es darle una mejor vida  a sus hijos y darles un mejor futuro con una buena educación.


Choluteca, Honduras -  Septiembre del  2014
texts.en:
Vilma lives with her husband and children in a community in the south of the country. She makes a living selling products from catalogs, and has been in this business for more than two years.

Vilma is requesting the loan in order to buy creams, lotions, perfumes, powders, shampoo, etc. She is stocking up on merchandise in order to be able to meet the demands of her clients. This will contribute to her increased profits and a better income in her household.

Vilma hopes to be able to cover the family´s expenses and commitments. Her dream is to give her children a better life, and to give them a better future with a good education.

Choluteca, Honduras -  September 2014

loans.use: to buy creams, lotions, perfumes, powders, shampoo, etc. for her business

loans.name: Rose Ann

texts.en:
This is Rose Ann. She is 24 years old and resides with her family in Busuanga, Palawan, Philippines. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for five years, and she profits well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for her family's needs, especially for her children. She and her partner have to work hard, determined to have a better income, to provide their children with a better education.

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 pesos worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP (Philippines pesos) in sales every day.

To improve sales, Rose Ann would like to apply for a loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. At an amount of 8,000 PHP, she could already purchase larger quantities and more varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Rose Ann hopes to maintain an increasing profit from her business. She dreams for her family to be always happy and healthy. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies. 

*All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Zeddiah

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Zeddiah, a mother of four who has defied the notion among her friends that farming is an old-fashioned way of earning a living. 

Her primary sources of income are milk, eggs and farming. Zeddiah hails from Kisii, Kenya, an area that enjoys favorable weather patterns, and this boosts crop production in the area. 

Zeddiah, being someone who is very ambitious and someone who always takes advantage of positive things, would like to capitalize on the good weather patterns experienced in the region and boost her farming. Being a hardworking mother, Zeddiah has always ensured that she puts food on the table for her family. She also ensures she is able to take her children to school. 

Zeddiah detests living in conditions of poverty, and she has a plan to improve her standard of living. This is why she is seeking a loan of 20,800 KES (Kenyan shillings) in order to be able to purchase a dairy cow. This will help in producing milk and manure to be used on her farm. Milk from the cow will be sold to the local market, and this means improved cash flow. Through improved cash flow, this means that profits will be higher and she can comfortably take care of her family and take her kids to school. Through your loan, Zeddiah will be empowered economically and be able to improve her standard of living and also that of people living within the area. 

Zeddiah is very comfortable with the repayment plan and the monthly installments.

loans.use: To buy an additional dairy cow

loans.name: Yolelia

texts.en:
This is Yolelia, 56, a resident of Busuanga Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Elisor, a mechanic, and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Yolelia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5-pesos-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 35,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Yolelia hopes to grow her business. She dreams for her children to finish their studies and become successful. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
This is Bernardo, 57, a resident of Busuanga Palawa, Philippines. He is married to Yolanda, and they have four children. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Bernardo is an ice dealer. He operates icemakers or ice generators inside their house and then delivers the ice to his regular customers. He travels through a boat from Busuanga to nearby islands to deliver the ice products. He earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy another refrigerator to increase his ice products. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.

Bernardo wants to give his family a better life in the years to come. He also desires to try new possible business opportunities. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week, and this is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy a new refrigerator for his ice-making business.

loans.name: Shoghakat

texts.en:
Shoghakat is from Kanachut village, Ararat region. She lives there with her husband, son and daughter. Her son works in the private sector and other family members are involved in farming. 

In the orchard near their house, Shoghakat grows fruit trees. She gets high quality and tasty fruits which her husband sells in the local markets. 

Shoghakat has applied for this loan and is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders in order to improve her farm. She plans to purchase pears (3 tonnes) for freezing and then to sell in the winter. 

She hopes to receive her loan and works hard to make her plans come true.

loans.use: to pay for pears (3 tonnes) for freezing and then to sell in the winter

loans.name: Segundo Gabriel

texts.es:
Segundo es un señor de 68 años, vive junto a su esposa en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas ciudad de la región costa, con un clima cálido húmedo, un sector muy comercial ya que es la unión entre la sierra y la costa. Segundo tiene varios hijos pero ellos ya se han independizado, por ello comparte tan solo con su esposa y con los nietos cuando llegan a visitar.
Segundo cuenta con 26 años de experiencia en la fabricación de escobas, trapeadores y cepillos, con ayuda de su esposa se levantan muy temprano a pintar los palos, luego en las cajas ponen una buena fibra para que la escoba barra bien. Aprendió de este arte de su padre quien le dejó como herencia este don. Una vez fabricadas las escobas, Segundo salea recorrer en su pequeño triciclo que lo ha adecuado con una bocina donde va promocionando su producto, recorre casi toda la ciudad.
Acudió a Fundación Alternativa por referencias del sector, la institución pudo ayudar a don Segundo con este pequeño crédito, se siente muy agradecido con KIVA ya que podrá mejorar su taller, va hacer unas mejoras y además va a comprar materiales necesarios para la elaboración de sus productos.
texts.en:
Segundo is a 68-year-old man. He lives with his wife in the city of Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas, a city in the coastal region with a hot, humid climate. It is a very busy trade sector, since it is at the intersection of the mountain range and the coast. Segundo has several children but they have become independent, which is why he lives only with his wife, and grandchildren when they come to visit.

Segundo has 26 years of experience making brooms, mops and brushes, and has the help of his wife. They get up very early to paint the broomsticks, and in the bases they put a good fiber so that the broom sweeps well. He learned this art from his father, from whom he inherited this natural gift. 

Once the brooms are fabricated, Segundo goes out on his little tricycle, to which he has added a horn with which he promotes his product. He goes through almost the whole city. 

He went to Fundación Alternativa after being referred there by the sector. The institution was able to help Segundo with this small loan. He feels very thankful to Kiva, since he will be able to improve his workshop. He is going to make some improvements, and buy the materials necessary to make his products.

loans.use: to make improvements to his workshop, and buy the materials necessary for making his products

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine is from Vardaqar village, Shirak region, where she lives with her husband, retired mother-in-law and two children (13 and 12 years old). 

Narine and her husband work at a local potato cultivating and gathering company as a rented workers. Besides their work, Narine and her husband also run their family farm. They keep livestock and cultivate wheat, barley and potatoes. 

To be able to develop their farm, Narine asks for this loan of $1,500. She plans to purchase forage for feeding the livestock and seeds for land cultivation. 

This investment will greatly help Narine's farming business, so she hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock and seeds for land cultivation

loans.name: Yughab

texts.en:
Yughab lives in Tufashen village, Shirak region with her nice, big family of her three children and father-in-law. 

Yughab's husband is a migrant worker in a neighbouring country, and he works hard to support his family financially. Her only son is a soccer player working in the local football club. Her two daughters are dentists and only Yughab takes care of their family farm. She keeps a livestock of 2 cows, 3 calves and a pig, as well as cultivates wheat, barley and potatoes. 

To be able to invest in her farming business,Yughab has aplied for this loan. She is asking for help to purchase potato, barley and wheat seeds, and also fertilizer for land cultivation. 

Yughab hopes for her farm's success and dreams of developing it so her husband will not have to go abroad and live far from the family.

loans.use: to pay for potato, barley and wheat seeds, and also fertilizer for land cultivation

loans.name: Elman

texts.en:
Elman is a 56-year-old farmer. He is married, and he has four kids. His wife is a housekeeper. Elman has been working as a farmer for 36 years and has good experience in this area. He raises seasonal fruits and sells them at the local bazaar. His monthly income is 170 AZN (Azerbaijani new manat).

Raising and selling fruits is much expanded in Azerbaijan. People sell seasonal fruits at the local bazaar. And buyers use fruits to make delicious kinds of jam, pies, cakes and juice. They also use dry fruits because it’s very useful for health. 

Elman’s situation is very hard. He needs to raise fruits and care for them, but the lack of water in the region makes a problem for him. Because of this problem, the productivity has fallen, and he can’t cover the family’s needs. 

He applied for a 1,200 AZN loan in order to be able to supply water to his garden weekly. This will increase the productivity again, and the family’s income will rise.

loans.use: to supply water to his garden weekly

loans.name: Zebijon

texts.ru: Зебичон 57 лет.Она  мать троих детей и счастливая бабушка . Несмотря на то что дети уже выросли  и сами зарабатывают на жизнь и даже помогают родителям не сидит сложа руки  и старается  самостоятельно  подрабатывает, чтобы не только не зависеть от детей но и самой помогать им . Муж Зебичон мастер по ремонту  жилья , также  занимается своим делом . Двое детей Зебичон уехали на заработки  и так как работа детей вдали от Родины и семьи не самое лучшее  но другого выхода у ее детей нет каждому из них нужно содержать свою семью . Вот почему Зебичон не хочет быть обузой для своих детей.  Зебичон занимается тем, что шьет национальные платья для женщин. Для усовершенствования своего дела она хочет купить новую швейную машину и тем самым  увеличить  производительность своего труда. Так как она уже пользовалась услугами «Арванд» и довольна обслуживанием здесь она обратилась за кредитом. Она очень надеется  воплотить задуманное  в реальность.
texts.en: Zebijon is 57 years old. She is a mother of three children and a happy grandmother. Despite the fact that her children are already grown and earn their own living and even help their parents, she does not sit with her hands down and instead tries to work independently, so that she is not relying on her children and is able to help them too. Zebijon's husband is a skilled house repairman and is also involved in his own business. Two of Zebijon's children left for work, and because the children's work is far away from their native land, it is not the best situation for the family, but her children do not have another alternative and need to support their family. This is why Zebijon does not want to be a burden for her children. Zebijon is involved in sewing national women's dresses. To advance her business, she wants to purchase a new sewing machine and, thus, improve her work productivity. Because she has already used Arvand's services and is happy with the service here, she requested this loan. She really hopes to make her dream a reality.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine in order to increase her productivity

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
In 2008, Peninah ventured into farming as a way of life so that she could be able to produce food for her family. Six years down the line, Peninah is deep into commercial dairy and horticultural farming. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea and vegetables. The money she makes from her various investments have helped elevate the quality of life led by her two children who are both in school. 

Peninah is seeking a loan to purchase dairy goats and expand her horticultural farm. The crops she grows on her farm are insufficient to fulfill the demand. However, to grow more crops, she needs more land, more farm inputs, more equipment and more labor. Crops aside, the other concern Peninah is dealing with is the shift in preference in the dairy industry. Goat milk demand is on a steady rise in Kenya. As more people in Kenya are levitating towards goat milk because of its nutritional value, cattle farmers are being forced to start adopting dairy goat farming. Caught up in this situation, Peninah will find your loan very handy. With KES 50,000, she will be able to purchase a couple of dairy goats to start with. She is also going to pay for the resources necessary to expand her crop production.
 
She has made a commitment to herself that the money she will make from this investment will go to loan repayment and her children's education. The money will also offset some of the farm expenses. She is certain that your lending will have a very big impact on her life.

loans.use: to pay for dairy goats and expand her horticultural farm

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to raise chickens and pigs

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima is a nice, hardworking woman from Geghakert village. She lives there with her husband and daughter. Her only son lives and works as a migrant in a neighboring country and time by time supports his family financially.
 
The family's main income comes from their agribusiness. Rima owns a greenhouse where she currently cultivates greens. After gathering the new harvest of greens, she plans to sell it locally and start cultivating tomatoes and cucumbers for the winter season. Unfortunately, the greenhouse is very old and needs to be improved. Rima asks for this loan of USD 2,600 to renovate her greenhouse and be prepared for the winter season.  She also wants to purchase fertilizer and seeds for cultivation of potatoes.
 
Rima hopes for the lenders' support and as a hardworking woman, with a good credit history behind her, she believes in her farm's success.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of the greenhouse and to buy fertilizer and seeds for cultivation of potatoes

loans.name: Biakoye Group

texts.en: The members are part of Biakoye group and are beginning their fifth loan cycle with ID-Ghana. The group is made up of five members. The members’ businesses include shoes, soft drinks, electrical accessories and cooking utensils. This loan will help with their small businesses, including Daniel's. This is his fifth loan from ID-Ghana, having joined on a friend’s invitation.
