He has a business selling electrical accessories and says that he started this business with a little bit of capital on his parents’ recommendation. He will use the money from this loan as working capital to buy more electrical accessories in quantity from the wholesalers market to sell to his customers. This work will allow him to generate income with which to support his family. He is married and has three children. When asked what he likes abut ID-Ghana, he says that he likes the health care that the institution provides. The group will need a total of GHS 4,000 to better their businesses.

loans.use: to buy more electrical accessories in quantity from the wholesalers market to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools for his electrician's business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer so she can learn computing skills.

loans.name: Ofelya

texts.en:
Ofelya is a farmer living in Aregnadem village. Her husband and son are herdsmen so Ofelya is the only one who takes care of their family farm. She keeps livestock including sheep, cows, calves and hens and cultivates wheat. Ofelya and her whole family work hard to be able to gather income and cover their basic needs. 

By applying for this loan, Ofelya asks lenders to support her with purchasing forage for the livestock. Because of the hard financial condition of the family, this loan is very important for Ofelya and her farm, so she greatly hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Bavakan

texts.en:
Bavakan lives in Aregnadem village with her husband and three sons. Her elder son is an army officer and the other two help their parents in farming. Bavakan and her family keep livestock and cultivate wheat and barley. Agriculture is the main source of the family's income. Bavakan's husband is a village veterinarian but his work is not stable. 

Bavakan has now applied for this loan to purchase seeds, forage and fuel for land cultivation. This loan is very important for Bavakan and her family's farm, so she hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, forage and fuel for land cultivation

loans.name: Nilzon

texts.es:
Nilzon tiene 33 años de edad, vive con su esposa y su hijos, posee casa propia, él esta dedicado a las labores agrícolas, cultivando café, la casa del cliente se encuentra en el distrito de Callacyuc, provincia y región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Nilzon se dedica al Cultivo de café. Hace 15 años en el caserío san Isidro. Destino del crédito es para la compra de insumos, abonos para realizar el abonamiento de su cultivo. Esto lo ayudará a incrementar sus rendimientos de su cosecha. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Nilzon, 33, lives with his wife and children.  He has his own house and works in agriculture, growing coffee.  His house is located in the Callacyuc area, which is in the province of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru. 

The people in his community work in agriculture, livestock and commerce.

He has been growing coffee for 15 years, an activity he started in the small village of San Isidro. 

He will use the loan to buy supplies, such as manure so that he can feed his crops.   This will help him to increase the productivity of his harvest. 

This in turn will mean that in the short term, he will generate a better income which will improve the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies so he can feed his crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more pigs and food for them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a home appliance for his family.

loans.name: El Abir Group

texts.en:
Fatima is the featured borrower of the El Abir group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends and they are working hard on developing their families' living conditions.

Fatima is a 48-year-old married mother of two who has been working from her house for three years selling beauty cosmetics to help her beloved husband cover their family's needs and requests. Fatima has 10 years of experience in this business. She used to have an accessories retail shop, but unfortunately her employee stole her shop and she had to start her own business from home.

Fatima's acquired loan will be invested in increasing her business merchandise with specially-released products, especially facial creams, before the coming winter season. She hopes that in the future, she can open her own shop again and develop her business properly again.

Fatima is the lady at the center of the picture. Nahida is the lady on the far right side of the picture, while Abir is the first from the left.

loans.use: To purchase specially-released products, especially facial creams, before the coming winter season

loans.name: Marika

texts.en:
Marika is 23 years old. She is married and lives with her husband Giorgi in the Khashuri district.The only source of income for the family is Giorgi's small monthly income working at a local petrol station. 

Marika married at an early age and wasn’t able to get an education. She has no university degree, which is one of the main reasons for her unemployment. She has a great desire to be involved in the trading business. 

Marika couldn’t request a loan from financial institutions until the Start Up program began, which is a joint product of Kiva and Credo. She requested a loan of 2,500 USD to begin trading in jewelry. She plans to purchase the products at wholesale prices and then resell among her friends and villagers.  This will give her a chance to earn income.

loans.use: to begin trading in silver jewelry.

loans.name: Kanze

texts.en:
Kanze is married with children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates an open air food business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a wholesale business in the near future. 

With the KES 40,000, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Haykanush

texts.en:
Haykanush lives in Hoghmik village. Her only son currently serves in the army and her husband and daughter are migrant workers. Her husband, a contractor by profession, and her daughter (a hairdresser) support Haykanush with her agribusiness and living costs.
 
Haykanush runs her family's farm. She keeps livestock and cultivates some wheat. The barn that she owns is very old so it is very difficult for her to keep her big livestock.

She has applied for this loan to be able to purchase forage for feeding the livestock and improving her farming business. She hopes for lenders' goodwill and their support.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en: Ilham, 33 years old, lives with her husband and their children. She has worked at a beauty salon for women for several years. Many people seek her for her good work. Ilham wants to improve her home after the Gaza war. For that reason, she requests a loan to buy construction tools, since these are important for her to mend the damages and to be able pay for the workers. She wants to rebuild the ceiling and the windows, and in that way. live safely with her family.

loans.use: to buy construction tools to repair the damages to her house. She wants to rebuild the ceiling and the windows, and in that way, live safely with her family.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Her name is Amy, 42, and she is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Carlos who serves as a soldier in the Philippine Marines. They have five children, two of whom are already working, two are in High School and the other one is not of school age yet.  She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs and to send her four children to school. 

Amy has operated a variety store for 11 years already. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store that sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food.  She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 600 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan to buy grocery items such as fresh meat, sacks of rice, charcoal , soda and other grocery items. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. Her store earnings are her source to meet their daily expense and to send her children to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her.

Amy hopes for her general store to grow bigger. She wants to give her children the best education until college. She dreams of a bright future for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Carlos Edwin

texts.es:
Carlos Edwin tiene 38 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 3 hijos menores, vive en casa propia junto a su familia, el caserio cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz. Carlos Edwin es natural de la zona. La comunidad es pequeña, los pobladores se dedican a la crianza de ganado menor y a la agricultura. Y está ubicada en el distrito de Buenos Aires, provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que desarrolla Carlos Edwin es el servicio de transporte público urbano en su mototaxi, tiene más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio, sus recorridos son las zonas de Rio Seco, Buenos Aires y Morropón. Además de trabajar en la agricultura ya que su padre le ha cedido un terreno para que el siembre. Destino del crédito es para realizar el mantenimiento a su mototaxi ya que se hacercan las elecciones y cliente quiere tener en optimas condiciones su movilidad para asegurar el correcto funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos Edwin is 38 years old. He has a partner and three children. Carlos lives with his family in a house that he owns. He has running water and electricity in his home. Carlos was born and raised here in the Buenos Aires district of Morropón province, Piura region on Peru's northern coast. This is a small community where the inhabitants work raising cattle and in farming. 

Carlos works in urban public transport services as a motorcycle taxi driver. He has over five years experience with the business taking people around the Río Seco, Buenos Aires and Morropón areas. In addition, Carlos works in farming as his father give him a plot of land for growing crops. 

This loan will be used to carry out maintenance on Carlos' motorcycle taxi. The elections are approaching and Carlos will have many customers who want the best transport conditions and he wants to ensure that his vehicle is working properly. In the short term, this loan will allow Carlos to increase his income and profits and, as a result, improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to carry out maintenance on his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: By His Grace Group

texts.en: These members are part of the group called By His Grace on their first loan cycle with ID-Ghana. The group has five members. They sell groceries, pork meat, corn dough, drinks, biscuits and gizzards. The featured borrower is Cordillia, who is 32 years old and single with children. This loan benefits the small micro entrepreneurs group where Cordillia is a member. She says that this is the first time she has joined ID-Ghana. She joined through an invitation from a cousin who is a member of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling pork meat and gizzards that she buys from the market and sells to customers. She says that the business started with a little capital she had, and it still will need financial support. That is why she has come to ID-Ghana, so that she can grow the business. The group will need a total amount of GHS 2,900 to grow their businesses.

loans.use: to buy pork meat and gizzards from the market to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To open a traditional Georgian bakery and get income from the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy some new spare parts to do the necessary maintenance on his bus

loans.name: Grigor

texts.en:
Grigor is a farmer living in Hayrenyants village, Shirak region. His big and beautiful farm includes cows, calves, sheep, piglets, hens and 70 colonies of bees. Near the house where Grigor lives, he also cultivates wheat, barley and potatoes, and sells the gathered harvest in local markets. Due to his and his family's hard and tireless work on the farm, they get high-quality products that sell well among local buyers. 

Grigor requests this loan to be able to invest in his farm. He plans to purchase fertilizer, fuel and seeds for land cultivation. As for every farmer, it is very important also for Grigor to be prepared for the winter season. So Grigor and his family members hope for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, fuel and seeds for land cultivation

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, a 59-year-old married father of four, has spent years selling construction supplies in his own shop in the Ain region. His business is very remarkable because he has broad experience in this field. Unfortunately his region's situation is very critical because they are near the Syrian border and they face a lot of unexpected invasions. His earned income is not as good as before because of the security situation.

Ali works hard to keep his business up-to-date. Thus, although his region's security situation isn't stable, he is insisting on updating his business as much as he can. He is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, which will be his tenth cycle. The loan will be invested in improving his business through increasing his merchandise to meet new construction demand that will help in rebuilding his region. His previous loans all met with very impressive results, which he is hoping that the current one will achieve.

He has worked hard on improving his business gradually. With increased merchandise, he will surely increase his income, and target more construction businessmen and workers with the special offers he provides. He hopes to keep on expanding and improving his business capital so that he can make sure that his family will be satisfied with what he provides, and never ask for others' help.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise to meet new construction demand that will help in rebuilding his region

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna lives with her husband and 20-year-old daughter in Ditavan village. Her only son serves in the army. 

Susanna is self-employed in her agribusiness. She, with the help of her husband, cultivates potatoes, corn, and fruit trees, and also keeps livestock as the only source of the family’s income. Susanna's husband and daughter help her by selling the gathered harvest in the local market. To continue running their farm, the family needs to invest some financial resources. They particularly need a loan of $1,500 to purchase two piglets, two oxen, forage for feeding the livestock, and wheat seeds.

Susanna and her hardworking family will be grateful to the lenders for helping them with a loan, which will greatly impact their agribusiness and their lives in general.

loans.use: to pay for two piglets, two oxen, forage for feeding the livestock, and wheat seeds

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en: Kaneez is a 51-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She has been doing tailoring for six years to support her family. She has accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to afford their household expenses. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family. She is in her third loan cycle and has requested a loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase more spools of thread, packs of buttons and laces, etc., to meet the increasing demand of her regular customers.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, packs of buttons and laces, etc., to meet the increasing demand of her regular customers.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
La tierra ha sido bendecida por manos que les gusta trabajar y cuidarla.  Es un oficio digno de admirar el que hombres se dediquen por años y para toda la vida.  La tierra sin la labor de hombres campesinos dedicados al cultivo de la misma, no daría los frutos que sostienen generalmente a toda generación, es el trabajo que realiza Julian de 58 años de edad  y es residente en Sololá el tiene 7 hijos y 2 hijas, 5 de sus hijos ya tienen familias separadas y los 2 hijos y 2 hijas son estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad.

La actividad que  realiza es la siembra de maíz, café, aguacates y cultivos de hortalizas, el eligió esta actividad porque cuenta con terreno y clima apta para la siembra de ello y le genera muy buenos ingresos económicos para el, la segunda actividad que el realiza es jornalero  en su comunidad siempre con la visión de ayudar a sus vecinos en su comunidad.

El uso respectivo que el le dará al crédito que el realiza es para la compra de mata de aguacate y fertilizantes para el cultivo de que el realiza para así obtener mejores ingresos económicos para el sustento de su familia. Una de las metas de Julian es incrementar su producto de aguacate y mejorar  sus prácticas de manejo en el cultivo de ello para tener mejores ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
The land blessed by the hands which like to work it and look after it. Working the land is an honest job and men make a living doing this for many years or for their whole lives. Without being worked by farmers who are dedicated to cultivating it, the land would not bear the crops that support more or less every generation. This is the job that 58-year-old Julian does. He is a resident of Solola and has 7 sons and 2 daughters, 5 of whom already have their own families and 2 of the sons and 2 of the daughters are students in the local school. 

His job is to plant corn, coffee, avocados and vegetables. He chose this job because his land and the local climate are fitting for planting these crops and it makes him a good income. He also works as a laborer in his local community with a view to helping his neighbors. 

He will use the loan to buy avocados bushes and fertilizers for his crops to make more of a profit to support his family. One of Julian's goals is to increase the amount of avocados he produces and improve the management practices of his avocado crops to make a better income to improve his family's wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy avocado bushes and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en: Jameela, a 59-year-old married woman, runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sews it and then sells it to the people of her locality.  She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. For the improvement of her business, Jameela has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors. These purchases will allow her to fulfill the demands of her customers on time. With a good credit history, this will be Jameela's fourth loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Orfelina

texts.es:
Orfelina tiene 64 años de edad, es conviviente, no tiene hijos dependientes; vive con su conyugue y sus 04 nietos a quienes ella los cuida. Orfelina vive en el caserío de Sondor. El caserío de Sondor es un caserío mediano con aspiraciones a superarse, el cual se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Pomahuaca, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. En dicho distrito sus actividades principales son la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, caserío mediano .

Orfelina se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con cultivos de café, de variedad Catimor de 05 y 06 años de edad, cuenta con fincas fruteras de café en buen estado, dichos cultivos se encuentran ubicado a unos metros de su domicilio, Orfelina además se dedica a la cría de animales de corral(patos, pollos, gallinas) y cultivo de pan llevar, cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en la agricultura, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos. El destino del crédito es para invertir en el negocio comprando abono para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café. Invirtiendo en su negocio podrá adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Oferlina is 64 years old, has a live-in partner and doesn't have any dependent children. Her and her partner live with their 4 grandchildren who she looks after. Oferlina lives in the hamlet of Sondor, located in the Pomahuaca district of the Jaen province in the Cajamarca region of the northern highlands of Peru. Sondor is a medium-sized hamlet which is growing. In the local area the main work is in agriculture, commerce and livestock breeding. 

Orfelina works in farming. She has coffee crops of the 5 and 6-year-old Catimor variety. Her coffee plantation is in a good condition and the crops are located just a few metres from her doorstep. 

Orfelina also breeds farmyard animals (ducks, chickens, hens) and grows local crops. She has more than 10 years of experience in farming and has very good personal and professional references from her neighbors. She will use the loan to invest in her business by buying manure for the upkeep of her coffee crops. By investing in her business she will be able to make a decent profit to help her improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in her business by buying manure for the upkeep of her coffee crops.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
This is Gemma. She is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her because she was able to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 Philippines peso (PHP) loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Gemma hopes that her business will grow more and she dreams for her children that they will all finish their schooling. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. There she can draw strength and inspiration through fellowship and studying the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Jennyfer Alexandra

texts.es:
Jennyfer es una joven con muchos deseos de superación, soltera y vive en Imperial junto a su familia. Actualmente está estudiando la carrera de Derecho en la universidad, también trabaja como Asistente en el Municipio de su ciudad, ciertamente trabajar y estudiar es un poco cansado, pero es un reto que ella asume con mucho entusiasmo porque quiere convertirse en una profesional exitosa.
Jennyfer tiene pensado utilizar el crédito para poder apoyar a su mamá en algunos gastos del hogar, como pago de algunos servicios, ella está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, porque gracias a ello su familia sentirá mayor bienestar y ella seguirá luchando para graduarse con honores de la universidad.
texts.en:
Jennyfer is a young woman who really wants to get ahead. She is single and lives in Imperial with her family. Right now she is studying law at college. She works as an assistant at the city hall in her city. It's true that working and studying is a little tiring, but it's a challenge she takes on with a lot of enthusiasm because she wants to become an successful professional. 

Jennyfer is planning on using the loan to help her mother with some household expenses, such as paying for some utilities. She is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity, because thanks to it her family will have more well being and she will continue to fight to graduate from college with honors.

loans.use: to help her mother with some household expenses.

loans.name: Alba Felipa De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La tierra ha sido bendecida por manos que les gusta trabajar y cuidarla.  Es un oficio digno de admirar el que mujeres se dediquen por años y para toda la vida.  La tierra sin la labor de mujeres campesinos dedicados al cultivo de la misma, no daría los frutos que sostienen generalmente a toda generación. Es el trabajo que realiza Alba de 21 años soltera residente en Sololá.
	
La actividad principal que le ha venido abriendo campos a Alba  en el área del comercio es la compra de arvejas chinas y verduras en su comunidad donde ella vive, la actividad que ella realiza lo ha venido haciendo desde hace 5 años, porque por esa actividad que ella realiza puede obtener recursos económicos para sustentar a su familia.

El fin principal con que desea realizar el crédito es para la compra de fertilizantes para el cultivo de arveja china con que ella cuenta para luego a su respectiva venta en su comunidad a las personas que lo requieren y así mismo que le genere un ingreso económico.

Uno de los más grandes sueños es obtener ganancias para poder compra más terrenos para poder cultivar la tierra para obtener un ingreso económico en el beneficio de su comunidad.
texts.en:
The land has been blessed by hands that like to work and take care of it. It is an admirable trade that women work at for years and all of their lives. Without the work of women farmers cultivating it, the land wouldn't give the products that generally support a whole generation. This is the work that Alba does. She is 21, single, and lives in Sololá.
	
The main activity that Alba has been making inroads in is commerce, the purchase of snow peas and vegetables in her community where she lives. She has been doing this activity for five years, because with this activity she obtains resources to support her family.

The main reason she wants to take out the loan is to buy fertilizer to grow snow peas so she can later sell them in her community to people who need them and generate some income. 

One of her biggest dreams is to make profit to be able to buy more land to cultivate it and have income to benefit her community.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy display cases for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, bricks, paint, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Greta

texts.en:
Greta is from Achajour village in the Tavush region. She is an experienced agronomist and her family consists of her husband and two children. 

Greta and her husband work hard to be able to earn a living for their family. They are engaged in breeding livestock, specifically, piglets, pigs and hens. Greta sells their agricultural products in the local market. As the autumn is progressing, she needs to make some investments in her agribusiness. She needs a loan of USD 2,000 to purchase a pig, forage for feeding the livestock and to pay for renting a tractor for land cultivation. 

Greta and her family will be very thankful to all the lenders for helping them collect the needed loan and to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for a pig, forage for feeding the livestock and to rent a tractor for land cultivation.

loans.name: G.s La Victoria Group

texts.es:
El señor Marco tiene 38 años es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable el vive con su esposa y sus hijo, en una Aldea de Santa Cruz de Yojoa,  Cortes. Desde hace más de 5 años. 
Su actividad comercial es la venta de condimentos como ser especias, canela, pimienta gorda, sal de ajo, recado, curri, azafrán, algodón, color rojo, etc. Productos que el vende de manera ambulante en las aldeas desde hace más de 5 años. 
Don Marco está solicitando el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de más condimentos como ser: especias, canela, pimienta gorda, sal de ajo, recado, curri, azafrán, algodón, color rojo, etc. Ya que se aproximan los meses en que sus ventas son más elevadas y el quiere tener todo el producto necesario para poder abastecer a todos sus clientes. 
Don Marco espera mejorar su clientela al contar con una buena variedad de productos  podrá ofrecer a un mas a sus clientes y de esta manera le generara más ganancias para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia a su vez desea seguir creciendo con su negocio, uno de sus sueño es ayudar a sus hijos para que pueda recibir una buena educación. 
Don Agustín tiene 74 años y vive con sus hijos, su actividad económica es el cultivo de café, desde hace ya 8 años, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable. 
Doña Wendy tiene 25 años vive con su esposo y su hijos, su actividad comercial es la venta de ropa nueva y usada y venta de plásticos, desde hace mas de 2 años es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable.   

Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras –  Agosto del 2014
texts.en:
Marco is 38 years old. He is a hard-working and responsible. He has lived with his wife and his children in the village of Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes for the past 5 years. He works selling condiments such as spices, cinnamon, pepper, garlic salt, achiote paste, curry, saffron, cotton, red coloring, etc. He has been selling these products itinerantly in the villages

Marco is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of condiments such as spices, cinnamon, pepper, garlic salt, achiote paste, curry, saffron, cotton, red coloring, etc. In the coming months he has his highest sales and he wants to have all the product necessary to keep his clients supplied.

Marco hopes to increase his clientele by having a good variety of products to offer to his clients. In this way he will generate more profits to improve the conditions of living for his family. At the same time he wants to expand his business. One of his dreams is to help his children so that they can get a good education.

Agustín is 74 years old and lives with his children. His business is growing cafe which he has done for 8 years. He is a hard-working and responsible person.

Wendy is 25 years old and lives with her husband and children. Her business is selling new and used clothing and selling plastics. She has been doing this for more than 2 years and she is responsible and hard-working.

Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras – August 2014

loans.use: to buy spices, cinnamon, pepper, garlic salt, achiote paste, curry, saffron, cotton, red coloring, etc, for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años, comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños, con las ventas que realiza ayuda en los gastos del hogar, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el joven está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía y así continuar con sus cultivos.
texts.en: This youth, who has his face blanked, is 28 years old and lives in a high risk area. He has been farming for several years. He sells his product in the neighboring communities. With the sales that he makes he helps with the household expenses. He lives in his own house with his family. He is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, pest control and improve the land that is shown in the photo so that he can continue with his crops.

loans.use: A loan of $300 helps this borrower to buy seeds, fertilizer, pest control and improve the soil.

loans.name: Shahzad  Parveen

texts.en:
Shahzad Parveen is a 35 year old married woman and a mother of four. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing it for many years. She is very knowledgeable about stitching techniques. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operation of her business, she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy Stocks of threads, zippers, laces and ribbons in different colors to meet up with increasing demand. 

In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy threads, zippers, laces and ribbons in different colors to meet increasing demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy brooms, parts for stoves, nails, lights, lamps, extension cords, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, beer and sodas for his business.

loans.name: Jose Ruben

texts.es: Jose de 34 años de edad vive con su esposa en casa propia, el posee una taller de carpintería ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 18 años, tiene muchos clientes fijos por la calidad con que realiza su trabajo, José está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para comprar mas materia prima como: madera, clavos, pega, barniz, junco y de más artículos que logren atraer a más clientes de tal forma que pueda logra su objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
José, 34, lives with his wife in a house of his own. He has been running a carpenter’s shop at home for eighteen years and has many fixed customers thanks to the quality of his work.

José is requesting a loan again to buy more materials, such as wood, nails, glue, varnish and reeds. This will result in more customers and the achievement of his goal, which is to improve his and his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, glue, varnish, reeds and other materials for his carpenter's shop.

loans.name: Henry

texts.es:
El Señor Henry es un señor muy esforzado es casado le tienen dos hijos de los cuales uno de ellos esta en edad escolar, es un señor  muy esforzado empezo su negocio de linea de cortero con poca mercaderia solo tenia dos lineas que cubria en repartir productos para el hogar, hoy en día el señor atiende mas de doce barrios y repartos  tiene diez muchahos quienes trabajan con el colocando productos y cobrando al mismo tiempo. trabaja desde las ocho de la mañana a seis de la tarde de lunes a sabado

el señor solicita un financiamiento para comprar electrodomesticos al por mayor y lograr colocarlos a mejor precio con el fin de que le queden buenas ganancias, ha sabido administrar su negocio, su calidad de vida ha mejorado.
texts.en:
Henry is a hard working man. He is married and has two children, of which one is of school age.

He is a hard working man and started his business selling door-to-door on credit with very little merchandise; he only had two sales routes that he covered, offering household products.
Nowadays, Henry attends to twelve neighborhoods and allocations. Ten men work with him, distributing products and collecting money at the same time. He works from 8am to 6pm from Monday to Saturday.

Henry is asking for the loan to buy household appliances at wholesale so as to sell them for a better price and in this way make good profit.
He has been a good business administrator and therefore his living quality has improved.

loans.use: to buy home products such as: sunshades, rain gear, tablecloths, plastic products and household appliances

loans.name: Patrocinio

texts.es:
Al trabajar la tierra bajo un sol agotador sin embargo dispuesto a sudar todo el tiempo para brindarle un mejor futuro a sus hijos. De 55 años de edad casado y tiene 5 hijos los 3 primeros hijos ya son casados y tienen vida independiente y los 2 últimos son estudiantes de la escuela de su comunidad,  por la que se esfuerza todos los días para una mejor vida, el lucha por el futuro de sus hijos para que ellos tengan la condición de vida mejor a la que el tubo.

La actividad que el realiza con  todo empeño todos los días es al cultivo de maíz ya que para el se ha convertido en un buen negocio para tener un ingresos económico, el viene realizando dicha actividad durante 30 años a el le ha gustado ver crecer la milpa y como llega el tiempo de cosecha, el realiza esta actividad con su esposa y si les ha dejado buena ganancia.

El motivo de la realización del préstamo es para la compra de fertilizantes para que su cosecha de maíz sean mejores que los años anteriores, los sueños de Patrocinio en conjunto con su esposa es poder instalar en su comunidad un depósito de venta de maíz para poder atender mejor a las personas que requieren de este producto de primera necesidad como lo es el maíz y brindarles estudios a sus hijos para que sean profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
Despite the exhausting heat, this man is willing to work hard in order to offer his children a better future. He is 55 years old, married, and has five children; the oldest three are married and live independently, and the youngest ones go to the community school. He works hard every day for his community and to improve the general living conditions. He is fighting so that his children can enjoy a better life than he did.

He works hard every day growing corn, which has become a good business for him and represents his source of income. He has been doing this for thirty years and enjoys watching his plants grow and waiting for the harvesting time to come. His wife helps him. This activity has left them good profits.

The objective with this loan is to buy fertilizers, which will help them to have a better harvest, compared to previous years. Patrocinio and his wife have a dream: building a storage room to sell the corn and be able to better serve their customers, for whom it is a staple food. They also dream of being able to pay for their children’s education so that they can become professionals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Bilqees

texts.en:
Bilqees is a 47-year-old married woman. For the past four years, she has been involved in the business of cloth trade. She purchases cloth of different varieties at low prices from the city market and sells the cloth in her own town. She has a strong customer base. 

Bilqees is in her 6th loan cycle and has requested a loan of 55,000 PKR. She wants to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase different kinds of foods and other items for his small grocery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a variety of beauty products and clothing to increase her inventory and improve her sales.

loans.name: Iram

texts.en:
Iram has successfully built up her business of hand embroidery with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By now she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her 5th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more spools of thread and colorful beads, pearls and sequins to complete orders in a timely way so as to earn good profits to meet her household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread and colorful beads, pearls and sequins to complete orders on time

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in brick flooring, cement, sand and gravel to brick the floor of her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a spigot, pipes, cement, gravel and labor costs to build a cistern in her home.

loans.name: Shenaz

texts.en:
Shenaz is 43 years old and a married woman and mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is Shenaz’s husband who is a driver by trade and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving the rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Shenaz has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and some auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Shenaz is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and some auto spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 50-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. One of her sons (also shown in the photo) runs a small shop where he sells various items such as used mobile phones, calling cards, mobile accessories and chargers, etc. He earns a good amount to contribute to the family income. 

For the improvement of his business, Parveen has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more items such as calling cards, memory cards, and mobile phone batteries. In this way he will be able to meet the increasing demands of his clients and generate more revenue.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as calling cards, memory cards, and mobile phone batteries.

loans.name: Sirush

texts.en:
Sirush is a hardworking agronomist from Ijevan town. She lives with her husband and retired parents-in-law. The family earns a living through the cultivation of tomatoes and some fruits (peach, apricot, cherry, apple, grapes). Sirush also keeps livestock of cows, calves, and beehives.  This is the only source of the family's income. Sirush's husband helps her a lot in selling the agricultural products at the local market. 

To be able to continue the business, Sirush needs to make some investments. She needs a loan of USD $2,000 to buy a cow and to pay for the renovation of the barn. 

Sirush and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders, and are very thankful to them for their support.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and renovation of the barn

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 41-year-old married woman. She initiated a business of ‘tandoor’ (clay oven used for cooking in North India and Pakistan) with the support of her husband, who is also shown in the photo. They cook chapattis and naan for the people of their community, and earn a sufficient amount of income to run their household activities. Nasreen is a mother of six, and is motivated to provide them with a beautiful life with a good education, food, and clothing. It is her fourth year with Kashf Foundation. 

Now she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase sacks of flour, and packs of salt and oil to cope with customer orders so she can increase their revenue.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of flour, and packs of salt and oil

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 58-year-old married woman. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years, and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; recently she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is 48-year-old married woman who has been running a business of milk selling for many years, with the help of her husband. She has three buffaloes for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has four children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. 

It’s her sixth year with Kashf Foundation. 

Now she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo to increase her sales; she wants to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo

loans.name: Noor  Ilahi

texts.en:
Noor Ilahi is a 56-year-old married woman. She has two children. She has been running a business of animal sales and purchases, along with her husband, for many years. She looks after the animal and is responsible for feeding it, while her husband sells it to different markets in the city. Their business is providing them with enough income to support their family. However, they need to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, health, and clothing. 

In order to expand their earnings, Noor Ilahi has requested a loan amount of 45,000 PKR to buy more animals such as baby goats and calves to sell.  She is hopeful that expanding the business will help in improving her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy more animals such as baby goats and calves

loans.name: Ana Marina

texts.es: Ana tiene 40 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Ana se gana la vida por medio de la crianza y venta de gallinas y pollos. De esta forma logra sacar adelante a su  familia junto con la ayuda de su esposo. Ana solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea construir un  muro perimetral en su vivienda para lo cual necesita invertir en materiales como: cemento, piedra, arena, postes de cemento, tela metálica, etc. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así poder dar inicio a la construcción lo antes posible .
texts.en:
Ana, 40, lives in her own house with her husband and her two children.  She earns a living raising and selling hens and chickens, and gets her family ahead with her husband's help.

Ana's requesting this loan from FUSAI because she wants to build a perimeter wall at her house.  She needs to invest in materials such as cement, stone, sand, cement posts, and wire mesh.

She hopes to be able to get this loan and start construction as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement, stone, sand, cement posts, and wire mesh to build a perimeter wall

loans.name: Mushagalusa Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kazaroho est  trésorière  du groupe d’affaire Mushagalusa. Commerçante expérimentée, elle est mère de 7 enfants dont seulement 5 sont scolarisés et  mariée à un agriculteur. Le nouveau crédit va lui permettre d’acheter un bassin de fretin. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son entreprise, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima de son soutien et lui souhaite plein succès.
texts.en: Ms Kazaroho is the treasury of the Mushagalusa group. An active retailer, she is married to a farmer and the mother of 7 children, only 5 of whom attend school. This new loan will allow her to purchase a basket of fish. The sale of these fish will enable her to expand her business, educate her children and feed them. She is grateful to Herkima for their support and wishes them much success.

loans.use: purchase a basket of fish

loans.name: Omaira De Jesus

texts.es:
Omaira es una persona muy trabajadora que gracias a su esfuerzo diario ha logrado sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos brindándoles una educación de buena calidad. 

Omaira, a pesar de su avanzada edad ha tenido una gran fortaleza y ha podido salir adelante con su negocio. 

Desde hace mucho tiempo comenzó a vender tendidos y accesorios de cama en el municipio de Itagüí. 

Actualmente Omaira tiene unos grandes pedidos por parte de sus clientes y debido a que no cuenta con un gran capital, busca un préstamo para comprar surtido de mercancía y responder a los grandes pedidos que tiene de sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es salir adelante con su negocio y desde este poder ofrecerles a sus 3 hijos una buena calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Omaira is a very hard-working person who thanks to her daily efforts has managed to bring up her 3 children giving them a good education.Omaira, in spite of her age has had great fortitude and has been able to get ahead with her business.

A long time ago she started to sell bed-clothing and bed accessories in the municipality of Itagüí. Currently Omaira has large orders from her customers and as she does not have a great amount of capital she is looking for a loan to buy an assortment of merchandise to respond to the requests from her clients.

Her main dream is to get ahead with her business and doing this can provide her 3 children with a good quality of living and greater financing stability.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of bed-clothing and bed accessories to supply and strengthen her sales business.

loans.name: Oumy's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 03 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé le 06 juin 2011. Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même village et les environs. Il y a une bonne cohésion du groupe. Leur principale activité est le commerce.
Ndeye,debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 30 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont une fille. Sa principale activité est le commerce. Elle vend de l'eau et de l'huile d'arachide. Elle fait cette activité depuis un bon bout de temps et a une très bonne expérience dans ce domaine.
Pour le commerce de l'eau, elle dispose d'une charrette qui transporte des bidons d'eau pour les vendre dans la ville voisine dont l'eau courante est salée. Elle perçoit chaque jour 7200 F. Elle a embauché un jeune garçon qui fait office de charretier pour la vente de l'eau et à qui elle paie 45000 F par mois. Elle dépense également 10000 F par mois pour l'alimentation de l'âne.
Pour le commerce d'huile, elle achète 03 bidons d'huile de 20 litres à 15000 F le bidon et le revend à 18000 F. Elle refait le processus à chaque fois que son stock s'écoule. Le transport de l'huile de son fournisseur jusque chez elle lui revient à 800 F par mois.
Avec les bénéfices, elle renforce ses épargnes, paie ses intérêts et aide son mari dans les charges familiales à savoir l'alimentation et les frais scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
This group, composed of three members, is part of the village bank that was created on 6 june 2011. The members all live in the same village or surrounding areas, and get along well. Their main activity is commercial. Ndeye, seen standing in the right of the photo with her hand raised, is 30 years old. She is married and the mother of three children, including one girl. Her main activity is commercial; she buys and sells water and peanut oil. She has been involved in this activity for a number of year and has acquired a lot of experience in this field. 

For the sale of water, she has a cart to transport cans of water to sell them in the neighborhing city where accessible water is salty. She earns daily revenues of 7 200 F. She hired a young man to help pull the cart, and pays him 4 500 F per month. She also spend 1 000 F a month on feed for the donkey. 

For the sale of oil, she purchases 3 large 20 L cans of oil at 1 500 F per can, and sells them for 1 800 F. She repeats this prcoess every time her stock has been depleted. Transporting the oil from the wholeseller to her home costs her 800 F a month. 

Profits are put into savings, used to pay interest on the loan, and to support her husband in taking care of family expenses, such as school fees for their children.

loans.use: sell water and peanut oil

loans.name: Crusade Group

texts.en:
The Crusade Group consists of four members. They are traders from Chorkor who on average are 40 years old. They requested their third loan from ID-Ghana for 5,3000 GHS so they can carry out their activities. 

Georgina will use her loan to buy soft drinks to sell to customers. She sells daily in a kiosk at her residence and is quite in demand. She gets her supplies from the wholesalers in Accra and sells for cash to clients. She hopes to achieve a good average monthly profit, which will enable her to repay her loan and help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and sell

loans.name: Ep Kahuwa Group

texts.fr: Madame Pendeki  est la représentante de l’école primaire Kahuwa, une institution éducative présente dans la ville.  Elle a pris connaissance de l’existence du produit credit enseignant au sein de Hekima qui a retenu son  attention. Cet ainsi, qu’elle  vient de solliciter un crédit pour construire sa maison. Son objectif est d’augmenter l’effectif des élèves dans son école et ainsi contribuer à la promotion de la scolarité dans la province. Elle remercie Hekima pour cette nouvelle initiative en faveur des enseignants.
texts.en: Mrs Pendeki is the representative of the primary school Kahuwa, an education institution in her city. She found out about the teaching loans provided by Hekima and was intrigued. She is asking for a loan in order to build her home. Her aim is to increase the number of children able to attend her school and thus contribute to the education of children in her region. She is grateful to Hekima for this new initiative on behalf of teachers.

loans.use: build her home

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en:
Tereza runs her own business in Kapan town. She is not married and lives alone. In the center of Kapan town, Tereza runs a store where she trades with bridal dresses, accessories, decorations, flowers and different home appliances. 

Over 4 years of running her store, she was able to gather loyal clients and thanks to them she gets a stable income during the month. Tereza has applied for this loan to be able to purchase new stock of bridal dresses, flowers and home appliances for her trading business. 

This hard working woman, with perfect credit history behind her, will be very thankful to all lenders for their support.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of bridal dresses, flowers and home appliances for reselling in her store

loans.name: Jesus Abelardo

texts.es:
El es Jesús, un hombre de carácter y buena voluntad, con deseos de progresar y salir adelante con su esposa y sus tres hijos.

El se decidió por iniciar su negocio de preparación y venta de mazamorra desde hace aproximadamente 5 años en un pequeño carrito impulsado por una bicicleta con muchas ganas y empuje. 

Este oficio lo aprendió trabajando de manera empírica y esto le permitió obtener gran experiencia.

Hoy en día desea darle un gran impulso a su negocio, por esta razón requiere un préstamo para realizar la compra de una bicicleta con motor.

De esta forma podrá optimizar su negocio y podrá desplazarse mucho más fácil a través de las calles del municipio de Medellín.

Realiza un préstamo para que la vida de Jesus Sea mucho mejor en su negocio!
texts.en:
This is Jesús, a man of character and good will, with the desire to make progress and get ahead, together with his wife and their three children.

Approximately five years ago, with great will and drive, he decided to begin his business of preparing and selling mazamorra [a Colombian corn dish] with a little cart driven by a bicycle.

He learned this business by working empirically, and this allowed him to obtain great experience.

Now he wants to give a boost to his business, and for this reason he needs a loan in order to purchase a bicycle with a motor. In this way, he will be able to optimize his business, and he will be able to move much more easily through the streets of Medellín.

Make a loan so that the life of Jesús will be much better in his business!

loans.use: to buy a bicycle with a motor for his food cart

loans.name: Tushuhudiane Group

texts.fr: Madame Zawadi, femme ambitieuse et  courage de l’association d’affaire  Tushuhudiane ;  est  commerçante depuis plus de 2003 au marché public de la ville.  Agée de 31 ans, elle est mère de 5 enfants qui  vont  tous à  l’école  et  est  engagée  à un agent de la fonction publique. Elle sollicite ce nouveau prêt pour acheter  250kg de farine de maïs et 250kg de farine de manioc.  Elle souhaite prospérer dans son entreprise et épargner d’avantage. Au final,  elle remercie Hekima.
texts.en:
Madame Zawadi, an ambitious and courageous woman in the borrowing group Tushuhudiane, has maintained a shop in the public market of her town since 2003. She is 31 years old, the mother of 5 children who all attend school, and is engaged to a public service employee.

Zawadi is requesting this new loan to be able to purchase 250kg of corn flour and 250kg of cassava flour. She hopes to grow her business and increase her savings. In closing, she thanks Hekima.

loans.use: to purchase 250kg of corn flour and 250kg of cassava flour

loans.name: Iqbal

texts.en:
Iqbal is a 48-year-old married woman. She has 5 children. She, along with her husband, has been running a business of cattle selling and purchasing for many years. She looks after the cattle and is responsible for feeding them, while her husband sells them to different markets in the city. 

Their business is providing them with enough income to support their family. However, they need to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, health and clothing. In order to expand their earnings, Iqbal has requested a loan amount of 40,000 PKR to buy cattle for resale purposes for improving her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy cattle for resale

loans.name: Salamat

texts.en:
Salamat is a 46-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has 6 years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts in years.

She is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salts, sugar, biscuits, cooking oil, and beverages to meet the increasing demand in her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, sugar, biscuits, cooking oil, and beverages

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad, age 51, is a married woman.  She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 55,000 to purchase more animals to expand her business and income level. She is in her 6th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to expand her business and income level.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a ceiling and walls and install pipelines  to renovate his home

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 61 years old and is a charismatic, active, and attentive man. Being a father has been his main motive for fighting tirelessly day to day to seek alternatives to earn a living and support his children. Approximately 15 years ago, Samuel started doing mixed farming and through those years he has gathered a great deal of experience with farming techniques. Through the income from farming he has been able to take care of his family and also provide for the basic needs for his children. Samuel is a very enterprising man, and although he never got formal employment, he has always worked hard on his farm and he has always provided his family with a decent meal. He lives in the Kerugoya area, which has favorable conditions for horticulture and that is why he is seeking a loan. Because of good roads, a good climate, and a good transportation network, he is sure that he will reap maximum profits and be able to increase his business. 

Samuel is requesting a loan to purchase farm inputs and expand his crops. Being a man from a marginalized community and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Samuel feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising men like him. Samuel is very disciplined with his finances and he plans to use his accumulated profits to improve his living conditions and also secure the future of his children.

Samuel says that his age doesn't stop him from doing what he is passionate about. That is why he always sets new goals for himself and among them is becoming a great horticulture farmer and generating employment opportunities. In this way, Samuel will be able to improve his quality of life and the well-being of his family and those people who help him do his daily work.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and expand his farm

loans.name: Oscar Alberto

texts.es:
Oscar es un hombre que desde el año 2000 lleva realizando las labores de oficial de construcción, actividad que inicio por iniciativa propia ante la falta de oportunidades para empelarse en alguna empresa. 
A partir de este tiempo Oscar con la experiencia que obtuvo de su padre quien le enseño todo lo que sabe ha realizado trabajos y cumplido a cabalidad las expectativas que le cliente tiene de este, en su trabajo emplea un familiar que es su hijo al cual quiere enseñarle lo duro que es el trabajo de la construcción y que debe estudiar para aspirar a una mejor vida.
Oscar quiere solicitar un crédito para comprar herramienta de mano, martillos, un recipiente para mezclar cemento, espátula, pala, almádana entre otras. 
Con la ayuda de este crédito tendrá herramientas para agilizar sus trabajos y hacer un poco más fácil esta extenuante labor con la que sueña poder mejorar sus ventas para arreglar el mismo su propio hogar, para dar una buena calidad de vida y permitirlo a su hijo a través del trabajo que pago sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Oscar is a man who has been doing construction work since the year 2000.  He started this business activity on his own initiative when faced with the lack of opportunities to get a job with some company.

From that time on, Oscar, with the experience that he got from his father, who taught him everything he knows, has been doing jobs.  He thoroughly fulfills the expectations that his customers have of his work.  In his work he employs a relative, his son.  He wants to teach his son how hard construction work is and that he needs to study in order to aspire to a better life.

Oscar wants to request a loan to buy hand tools like hammers, a container in which to mix cement, a spatula, a shovel, and a sledge hammer, among others.  With the help of this loan he will have tools to speed up his jobs and to make this grueling work a little easier.  

Through his work he dreams of being able to improve his sales in order for him to fix his own house; to have a good quality of life; and to allow his son, through his work, to pay for his university studies.

loans.use: to buy hand tools for construction.

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
Zahra is 55 years old and a married lady. For many years, she has run a small general store in her community with the support of her husband, who also appears in this photo. Zahra and her husband offer variety of grocery items at a reasonable price. They have retained many customers and make enough money to provide for their family. 

Zahra is requesting a 40,000 PKR loan to fully stock her store and buy rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. She will use part of the profit from her loan to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products from the family shopping basket to give his business a significant push

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
El medio ambiente forma parte importante en el planeta y es bueno saber que aun hay personas que se dedican a cuidar el medio ambiente como un actividad productivo tal es el caso de Santiago que desde muy pequeño tiene ese deseo de plantar en su comunidad, el es de 57 años de edad casado que tiene 12 hijos, los 7 hijos  primeros ya tienen familias independientes  y los 5 últimos son estudiantes en su comunidad.

La actividad que Santiago ha venido realizando desde hace 20 años es la plantación de café y el lo aprendió de sus padres ya que es la única herencia que ellos le dejaron y es por ello que el se a dedicado de la plantación de los mismos para poder tener un ingreso económico para su familia e obtener ganancias para el sustento de su familia.

El propósito de la realización del préstamo de Santiago es para la compra de insumos para el cultivo de café como semillas  abonos químicos y orgánicos para poder obtener mejores productos de café para luego venderlos por los alrededores de su comunidad.

Santiago quiere ser diferente que sus padres y uno de sus más grandes aspiraciones por el futuro es la compra de terreno para dejárselos a sus hijos para que vivan en condiciones adecuadas.
texts.en:
The environment is an important part of the planet.  It is good to know that there are still people who devote themselves to taking care of the environment as a productive business activity.  This is the case with Santiago.  Ever since he was very little he has had this desire to plant in his community.  He is 57 years old, married, and has 12 children.  The first 7 children now have their own families.  They last 5 are students in their community.

The business activity that Santiago has been doing for 20 years is growing coffee.  He learned this from his parents, and it is the only inheritance that they left him.  That is why he has devoted himself to growing coffee.  He does this in order to be able to have financial income for his family and to get earnings to support his family.

The reason for getting Santiago’s loan is to buy supplies for the coffee crop.  He will buy things like seeds and chemical and organic fertilizers in order to be able to get better coffee products, which he will later sell in the areas surrounding his community.

Santiago wants to be different than his parents.  One of his biggest aspirations for the future is to buy land to leave to his children so that they have adequate living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds and chemical and organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase goats to raise

loans.name: Suhey

texts.es: Suhey de 39 años, habita con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 11 a 18 años, en un municipio de playa, brisa y mar, en el que se siente muy a gusto.  Ella recogió la sugerencia de su cuñada,  de emprender su propio generador de ingresos e inició hace 2 años su comercialización de  ropa, calzado, perfumes, bolsos, colonias, etc.  Vendiendo de contado y a crédito, directamente a sus clientela. Su meta es abrir un almacén al público y finalmente remodelar su vivienda, pero su mayor desafío es fidelizarla, para incrementar sus ventas y poder ahorrar. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa, calzado, perfumes etc. Con esta inversión su negocio mejorará sustancialmente porque aumentarían sus compras, sus ventas y sus utilidades, haciendo que su credikiva sea muy exitoso.
texts.en:
Suhey, 39, lives with her spouse and her three children, ages 11 to 18, in a town with a beach, a breeze, and the ocean where she feels very comfortable.

She followed her sister-in-law's suggestion to get her own source of income and, two years ago, started selling clothing, footwear, perfume, bags, cologne, and so on.  She sells in cash and on credit directly to her customers.  Her goal is to open a department store to the public and ultimately remodel her house.

Suhey's biggest challenge, however, is building loyalty to increase her sales and be able to save money.  That's why she's applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She's going to buy clothing, footwear, perfume, and so on.

Her business will improve substantially with this investment because her purchases, sales, and profits will increase and make her Kiva loan a success.

loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear, perfume, etc.

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.ru: Тахмина добрая женщина. Ей 38 лет. Она разведенная и одна воспитывает своих 4 детей. Она является единственным кормилицей семьи и поэтому работает упорно с раннего до позднего вечера, чтобы зарабатывать на жизнь. Она предоставляет услуги швеи уже более 4 года. Она шьет национальные и европейские стили одежды. Она предоставляет свои услуги у себя дома. Тахмина образованная женщина и поэтому старается, чтобы ее дети получили высшее образование. Ее старший сын учится на первом курсе в Авиационно техническом колледже города Москвы. Он учится успешно. Тахмина должна оплатить за учебный договор своего сына и поэтому она запрашивает займ с такой целью. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Tahmina is a kind woman of 38. She is divorced and raising her four children on her own. She is the family's only breadwinner and therefore works tirelessly from early morning to late evening to earn a living. She has been working as a seamstress for more than four years, sewing clothing in both national and European styles from her home. 

Tahmina is an educated woman and therefore wants her children to have a higher education as well. Her oldest son is in his first year at the Technical College of Aviation In Moscow. He is doing well in his studies. Tahmina needs to pay his tuition and therefore is requesting a loan to cover these costs. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to pay her son's tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies to prepare food.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is married and a mother of two children, both of whom still attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She operates a fish selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 

Esther is requesting a loan of Kes 25,000 to purchase fish to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: La Fontaine Group

texts.fr: Madame Mawazo, présidente dans le  groupe de credit  La fontaine est  mariée à un agent de la fonction publique  à l’âge de 47 ans. Elle est mère de 8 enfants tous scolarisés et étale sa marchandise à son domicile. Elle sollicite un  nouveau prêt  pour acheter 250 poissons frais.Son objectif est de construire une maison et scolariser ses enfants jusqu'aux etudes universitaire. Elle remercie Hekima pour son encadrement des femmes pauvres économiquement actives.
texts.en: Mrs. Mawazo is the leader of the La Fontaine borrower’s group. She is married to a civil servant and is 47 years old. She has eight children, all in school, and sells her wares in front of her home. She is seeking this new loan in order to buy 250 fresh fish. Her goal is to build a house and to pay for her children’s education through university level. She thanks Hekima for its support of female entrepreneurs who have limited means.

loans.use: to buy 250 fresh fish.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a young agronomist from the town of Kapan, in the Syuniq region. She lives with her husband and two sons.  

To support the family in earning a living, Anna breeds cows and hens, piglets and calves. The livestock breeding is an important source of income for the family. 

Anna and her family need more livestock to be able to address the family's growing everyday needs. A loan of USD 3,000 will assist them greatly in purchasing three cows. 

Anna and her family will be very grateful to the lenders for supporting them and helping them to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for three cows

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan de 22 años de edad es el propietario de una peluquería ubicada al sur occidente de la ciudad. Desde Marzo del año 2012 inició su negocio una vez aprendió las técnicas de peluquería al lado de su madre quien le enseñó este oficio. Inicialmente trabajó como empleado y por eso muestra una experiencia de 8 años en la actividad. Su ímpetu empresarial y deseo de ser independiente lo impulsaron a iniciar su propio generador de ingresos y poco a poco ha ido creciendo. Hoy su oferta de servicios la componen los cortes de cabello, peinados, tinturado, alisado etc. que realiza directamente en su local, todos los días trabajando desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Sus clientes son los vecinos  y referidos que gradualmente han crecido y que espera en esta temporada festiva, hacer crecer mucho más. Su meta más adelante es remodelar su local y finalmente comprar su vivienda y su mayor desafío es fidelizar a su clientela, con servicios que le permitan atenderlos de manera confortable. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará insumos, como tintes champú, queratina, esmaltes etc. Con esta inversión obtendrá mayores descuentos por su compra al por mayor y de contado haciendo de su credikiva un crédito que impactará positivamente a su negocio en tanto a que con él logra mejorar los costos del servicio.
texts.en: Juan, 22, owns a salon in the south part of the city.  His mother taught him to cut hair and he started his own business in March of 2012.  However, he'd been a hair stylist long before that, 8 years all together.  Juan is a born entrepreneur and started the business because he knew that he could make a good living with it.  The business is growing, he says, and he now provides all kinds of services in his salon, from cuts to coloring.  His customers are mostly men and women from the neighborhood and he gains new customers from referrals from long-time customers.  He says that the end of the year is especially busy because of the holidays and that he hopes to gain more new customers.  He wants to remodel his salon because he knows he has to keep his customers and one way to do that is to ensure their comfort there.  He is applying to Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo for a Kiva loan that he will use to buy the supplies he needs to carry on his business.  The investment will allow him to buy the supplies in bulk and take advantage of the best discounts.  He can use the savings to keep his prices down and his customers happy.

loans.use: to stock his salon business.

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna has successfully built her business of a general store with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time, she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her 4th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy packs of salt, biscuits, grains, flour, milk, and beverages in order to meet the increasing demand at her store and to boost her earnings.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, grains, flour, milk, and beverages.

loans.name: Farmeen

texts.en:
Farmeen is 41 years old and an energetic, married woman. She is efficiently involved in the business selling animals, with the help of her son. She has been running a cattle business at home for the last ten years. Farmeen's business is going well, helping her meet her day-to-day expenses. 

For the improvement of her business, Farmeen contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more animals to sell. She wishes to utilize her income for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to sell.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is 42 years old, single, and works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for four years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. 

When Robina was not earning, her family was going through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her brother was the sole bread winner of the family. Robina felt it obligatory to change her family’s living standards and started working from home. 

Her hard work helped her establish a good clientele but she was having difficulty in fulfilling large orders. That’s when she requested 40,000 PKR to purchase a new stitching machine along with needles and buttons to meet with customers’ orders on time and earn a good amount of revenue.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine along with needles and buttons to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her beauty products business.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine has been involved in her farming business for 13 years. She lives with her husband.

They are engaged in the breeding of livestock, such as cows and hens, beekeeping, and the cultivation of wheat and grass. The family has already established a successful agribusiness. 

To continue developing their farming business, the family needs a loan of $1,300 USD to purchase two calves. 

Karine and her family will be grateful to the lenders for supporting them in developing their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for two calves.

loans.name: Nanuli

texts.en:
Nanuli is 53 years old. She lives in Gori district. Nanuli is involved in agricultural activities. She has a vineyard and a plot of land, where she grows fruits. Nanuli sells the harvested products locally. 

As her income is only seasonal, Nanuli decided to start clothes trading. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to receive a loan of 550 GEL, which she will use to purchase a stock of clothes to sell to her neighbors and villagers.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase furniture for his house

loans.name: Together As One Group

texts.en:
