These women are the Together As One Group which is made up of two people who live in the same area. The group's representative, named Racheal, is 44 years old and has attended school to the secondary level. She's single and has three children who are going to school. 

Racheal lives with her children, and she takes care of all family's expenses. For this reason, she's been buying and selling groceries to both men and women. She has been doing this business for the past six years. This enables her to provide for her family and for herself. Racheal gets her supplies from the wholesale market in Ghana. 

To bolster her business, Racheal, together with the other member of the Group, is seeking her eighth loan from Kiva's partner, ID Ghana. They promise to work hard to repay this loan without trouble.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell to customers.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira is an agronomist from the village Dashtadem in the Aragatsotn region. She lives with her husband, son  and elderly father-in-law. 

Elmira is engaged in breeding livestock: cows, pigs, piglets and hens. She is also cultivating wheat. Farming is a very important source of income for the family. To continue developing it, Elmira needs some financial assistance. She particularly needs a loan of $1,500 to purchase forage for feeding the livestock. 

Elmira and her family greatly rely on the good will of the lenders and will be very thankful to them for assisting them in developing their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is an agronomist from the village of Shaqe in the Syuniq region of Armenia. She lives with her husband. 

To be able to meet the everyday needs of their family, Larisa is engaged in breeding and rearing livestock, particularly cows, calves, beehives, hens, and sheep. Her husband helps her a lot in selling the agricultural products in the market. 

However, as life gets more expensive, the family's everyday costs are also increasing. 

Larisa now needs to feed their herd of livestock. A loan of $2,100 USD will be a great support to Larisa and her husband in helping them purchase forage for feeding the livestock. This will give them more opportunities to develop their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase forage to feed their livestock.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 36 years old and lives in Accra-Chorkor city in the Greater Accra region. She is married and has two children; she lives with her husband and children. Esther’s husband works as a taxi driver. 

Esther sells underwear to customers. Despite the effort made by her husband, Esther’s financial support from her small business is great. She has been doing this business for 6 years and still counting. She says that she has a number of loyal customers who do shopping from her stall regularly.

loans.use: To buy underwear to sell to customers.

loans.name: Nelson Enrique

texts.es:
Nelson recuerda hace algunos años cuando iniciaba su negocio de tienda con un surtido muy limitado y ver en lo que se ha convertido lo llena de orgullo y se convence cada vez más que el emprendimiento fue su mejor decisión. 
Nelson también agradece a entidades que le prestaron capital para evolucionar su negocio, comprando implementos que aún conserva como su refrigerador, la expansión del local etc. 
Nelson hoy viene a solicitar un crédito para la compra de mercancía de abarrotes, granos, productos de aseo y productos de refrigeración para mejorar su oferta y tener su negocio con suficiente surtido para abarcar un buen número de clientes y recurre al micro-crédito ya que con este ha podido ser lo que es ahora un tendero exitoso y quiere que le vuelvan a dar la mano para seguir creciendo pues su sueño es tener un mini-mercado por lo cual trabaja diariamente largas jornadas laborales esperando un cliente más para meter una moneda en la alcancía y estar más cerca de su sueño.
texts.en:
Nelson tells us that he remembers having very little to sell when he first opened his store and you can see how proud he is of the business now and how it has grown and prospered.  He says that starting the business was the best decision he every made.
Nelson adds that he is grateful for the help that he's received to fund the growth of the business.  He has used past loans to buy the equipment he needs--a refrigerator, for example--and add floor space.
Nelson is applying for a loan that he will use to stock his store with merchandise--groceries, toiletries, etc.--that his customers most want.  The investment will allow him to expand the range of the merchandise he sells and attract more customers.  He says that micro-loans have helped him grow his business and  he wants to continue building on that past success.

loans.use: to stock her corner grocery.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene, 40, is married with 2 children. She has a soft drink business where she sells soft drinks and fruit drinks. She decided to set up a soft drink store and offer a variety of products to her regular customers. 

Irene's goal is to increase her sales. She is requesting a loan to buy soft drinks and fruit drinks to sell to her customers. 

Irene believes this loan will be very helpful because she will be able to keep items stocked for her customers, with the aim of increasing her income. 

In the future, Irene plans to expand her store.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and fruit drinks to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Samir

texts.es: Samir es el propietario de una pequeña llantería, ubicada en el suroccidente de la ciudad, la cual inició hace 4 años, para generar ingresos familiares y responder a los gastos de su hogar conformado por su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 1 y 4 años. Samir  inició  con este oficio, pues fue el que aprendió desde niño, viendo a su padre y sus hermanos trabajar en lo mismo.  Los servicios de su oferta son las despinchadas de llantas, venta de neumáticos, aceites y lubricantes, lo cual realiza en un local ubicado en el barrio donde habita. Samir ofrece sus servicios  directamente en su taller  de contado, comprando a los distribuidores y mayoristas, vendiendo a transeúntes y amigos, su desafío es fidelizar su clientela y su meta más adelante es remodelar el local, aumentar la base de compradores  con buen servicio y ofreciendo precios que atraigan cada vez más clientes. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará   parches, neumáticos para motocicletas, aceite y lubricantes. Con ello espera un incremento en sus ventas y en sus utilidades, en la época más linda del año: Navidades y año nuevo.
texts.en: Samir operates a tire repair shop in the southwest part of the city.  He is married and has two children, 4- and 1-years old, respectively, and started the business to support them.  Samir learned tire repair from his father when he was just a boy so he long had the skills he needed to start the business.  He can now provide all kinds of tire-related services: sales, repair, and servicing.  His shop is in the neighborhood where he lives.  He buys the products and supplies he needs from wholesalers and distributors and sells his products and services to his customers for cash.  Samir's biggest challenge is ensuring that his customers come back again and again.  The surest way of keeping his customers and attracting new ones, he says, is to deliver a good service at a fair price.  He is applying to Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo for a Kiva loan that he will use to buy the merchandise he needs--patches, motorcycle tires, lubricants, etc.--to carry on his business.  The investment will allow him to grow his business during the coming holiday season.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his auto repair business.

loans.name: Rawan

texts.en:
Rawan is a 25-year-old university student. She is planning to find a job after graduating so she can support herself and experience work life. 

Rawan is majoring in Business Administration, and she is in her last year of university. She is only one step away from reaching her goal. 

However, Rawan currently needs your help in fulfilling her loan request to pay for her upcoming university semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition fees.

loans.name: Tumaini Group

texts.fr: La cliente Zakashimba  est  membre  dans le groupe de credit  Tumaini. Femme dynamique, elle est âgée de 40ans, mère de 7 enfants dont seulement 5 scolarisés  et 2 autres n’ont pas encore atteint l’âge d'aller à l'école. Mariée à un homme d’affaire de la place, elle sollicite ce nouveau credit pour acheter  ½ sacs de souliers en plastic.  Elle souhaite prospérer dans ses affaires, rehabiliter sa maison et scolariser ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima de la soutenir.
texts.en: Zakashimba is a member of the Tumaini loan group. A dynamic woman, she is 40 years old and the mother of 7 children, 5 of whom attend school and 2 of whom are not yet old enough to go. She is married to a local businessman and is requesting this new loan in order to buy half a bag of plastic shoes. She would like her business to succeed, to renovate her house and to make sure her children get an education. She thanks Hekima for supporting her.

loans.use: to buy half a bag of plastic shoes.

loans.name: Ushindi Group

texts.fr: Madame Mburamumwe, femme ambitieuse et  courage de l’association d’affaire Ushindi ;  est  commerçante de longue date à son domicile. Veuve de son état, elle est  âgée de 56 ans et mère de 8 enfants qui étudient tous.  Elle sollicite ce nouveau prêt pour acheter 20 casiers des boissons sucrées.Le plus grand obstacle dans son métier c’est la casse de bouteille.Son objectif est de prospérer dans les affaires et devenir grossiste. Enfin, elle remercie Hekima  et prie Dieu de le bénir.
texts.en: Mburamumwe is an ambitious and courageous woman and a member of the Ushindi business group. She has been selling goods from her home for a long time. She is a 56-year-old widow and the mother of 8 children who all attend school. She is requesting this new loan in order to buy 20 cases of soft drinks. The biggest challenge she faces to her business is the revenue lost due to bottle breakages. Her aim is to succeed in business and to become a wholesaler. Finally, she thanks Hekima and asks for God's blessing.

loans.use: to buy 20 cases of soft drinks.

loans.name: Stellah

texts.en:
Stellah is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, Stellah has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is the high cost of transportation.

With the loan she is requesting of KES 25,000 Stellah wants to purchase 20 bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Tudumu Group

texts.fr: Madame Dunia, femme entrepreneur est trésorière du groupe de credit  Tudumu. Veuve  à l’âge à de 48 ans, elle est mère de 8 enfants dont 2 viennent d’obtenir leur diplôme, 2n’ont pas l’âge d’étudier et 4  sont scolarisés. Elle sollicite ce nouveau credit pour acheter ½ champs  de canne à sucre de 10m pour son commerce. Son objectif est de devenir grossiste.  Elle remercie Hekima  de soutenir les femmes entrepreneurs.
texts.en: Dunia is an entrepreneurial women and the treasurer of the Tudumu loan group. Widowed at the age of 48, she is the mother of 8 children, 2 of whom have just graduated. 4 of her children still attend school and 2 of them are too young to go yet. She is requesting this new loan in order to buy half of a 10-metre field in which to grow cane sugar for her business. Her aim is to become a wholesaler. She thanks Hekima for its support of women entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy half of a 10-metre field in which to grow cane sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay his university tuition

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a single young man living with his five family members. He is aiming to be independent by finding a job with a good income in the future. Now he is a university student majoring in Space Engineering, and he is at the beginning of his journey. He is applying for this loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: pay his university tuition

loans.name: Abdulaziz

texts.en: Abdulaziz is a 25-year-old single young man living with his family that consists of five members. His father is a driver.  Abdulaziz wants to support his father with their household expenses. For that reason, he started running his vehicle shop where he does vehicle repairs in general.  For four years now his station needs some maintenance, but because he doesn't have enough money to do so, he has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: maintain his car repair shop

loans.name: Eman

texts.en: Eman is a married woman living in Salt, Jordan. She has been selling clothes for four years, from where she started gaining good income. Although the place where her business is located isn't attractive, she is planning to expand it to be able to move it to a better place in the future. Now she is seeking to bring a new collection of clothes that will suit the upcoming winter season in addition to Abayas.  But because she doesn't have enough money to do so, she is asking for your help by applying for this loan.

loans.use: buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Andulwahab

texts.en:
Abdulwahab is a 22-year-old single self-dependent man who left high school to start his own business. He started running his own stationery supplies and Internet shop where he sells students needs. He also has computers and Internet service that help student who needs Internet to do their homework and researches.   

Now Abdulwahab wants to expand his shop by purchasing more computers and stationery supplies that students need for the upcoming semester.  But because he doesn't have enough money to do so, he has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: buy computers and stationery

loans.name: Haitham

texts.en:
Haitham is a 21-year-old student who is seeking to support his family in the future. He is a university student living in Irbid, Jordan with his six family members, and he is majoring in Computer Science. 

Haitham is in his third year of university and he is planning to work in his field after graduating so that he will find a good job in his field of study. He is now applying for this loan to help him pay for his next semester fees.

loans.use: pay his university tuition

loans.name: Ayat

texts.en: Ayat is a 20-year-old single lady who is currently staying with her family. Her aim is to experience work life after graduating from university. She is now studying Special Education in her second year, and she is applying for a loan to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: pay her university tuition

loans.name: Eyad

texts.en:
Eyad is a 23-year-old ambitious single man living with his five family members. He is a hardworking man currently working in a restaurant, and he is planning to find a better job after finishing his study. 

Eyad is currently a university student majoring in Managerial Information Systems, and he is in his third year. He is now applying for a loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: pay his university tuition

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer is a 26-year-old single lady who lives with her 5 family members in an area of Jordan called Marka. Her father is retired. 

Abeer's aim is to find a job that suits her study field after graduation. She is currently a university student majoring in Marketing, and she is in her third year. 

Abeer has applied for this loan to help pay for her upcoming semester's tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition fees.

loans.name: Jaquelin

texts.es: Jaquelin de 37 años de edad, habita con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijas, en las edades de 19 y 21 años, en el suroccidente de la ciudad; lugar donde vende a crédito pantalones, camisas, bolsos, directamente a su clientela, conformada por vecinos y referidos, a quienes les ofrece a crédito sus productos, mientras compra de contado en almacenes y distribuidores mayoristas, que han radicado sus empresas en la ciudad de Barranquilla. Su micro negocio inició en el mes de Julio del año 2010, cuando una vecina con mucha experiencia comercial, le sugirió vender artículos de su oferta, para generar ingresos adicionales que beneficiarían su hogar.  Jaqueline acogió esta idea e inició hace 4 años, vendiendo directamente a sus clientes unos pocos artículos, pero su empeño y disciplina, hicieron que su negocio se expandiera gradualmente y hoy su meta es mucho más ambiciosa, pues más adelante planea abrir un local al público, con el fin de generar más ingresos y remodelar su vivienda, aunque su desafío, sea vender mucho más para poder ahorrar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará pantalones, camisas y bolsos, con el fin de incrementar sus utilidades vendiendo más, lo cual contribuye con el mejoramiento de su negocio, respondiendo así con su mayor desafio.
texts.en: Jaquelin, 37, lives in the southwest part of Barranquilla  with her husband and 2 children, 19- and 21-years old.  She operates a business selling clothing and other merchandise.  She buys the products she sells from local stores and wholesalers.  She pays cash for the merchandise and sells to her customer--neighbors, often--on credit.  She started the business in July 2010, spurred on by a friend who had long had a similar business.  Jaquelin had very little to start with, but she was disciplined and worked hard and her efforts paid off.  The business has expanded in the 4 years since she started it and Jaquelin is ambitious for its future.  She wants to grow the business and open her own shop.  For now, Jaquelin is applying to Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo for a Kiva loan that she will use to stock her business with the merchandise--pants, shirts, purses--that she needs to carry on the business.

loans.use: to stock her retail business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his daughter's university fees.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
This is 51-year-old Mariatu. She is married, and has two children, aged six and nine years. In 2005, Mariatu established her textile and shoes business. She sells mainly cotton, lace, women's slippers, and men’s sandals. She began her business, because she wanted to improve her living standard and take good care of her family. Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 900,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Mariatu has already received and successfully repaid one loan, with a good loan repayment history. Now she requires a new loan in order to purchase more stock to sell, such as cotton, lace, men's jeans, uniforms, and women's slippers. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 300,000.

In the future, Mariatu plans to educate her children to university level and to build a dwelling house for her family. Mariatu is a determined and very hard-working business woman. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more stock, such as men's jeans, uniforms, and women's slippers

loans.name: Muqaddas

texts.ru: Мукаддас 45 летняя жительница городка Турсунзаде. Турсунзаде не большой город, был назван в честь великого таджикского писателя Мирзо Тунсунзаде. Мукаддас замужем. Ее муж находиться за приделами страны на заработках. Он уехал и не забывает  о своих родных и финансово помогает им. Мукаддас зарабатывает на жизнь путем шитья женских платьев. У нее есть дочь, ей 15 лет. Она ученица средней школы. После работы дочка помогает ей в работе. Мукаддас покупает ткани, шьет из них женские платья и после продает их. Сейчас ей необходимо купить новые ткани и швейные принадлежности, чтобы шить больше и зарабатывать соответственно больше. Мукаддас надеется на кредит и в свой успех.
texts.en:
Muqaddas is a 45-year-old resident of Tursun-zoda, a small city named after the great Tajik writer Mirzo Tursun-zoda. She is married and her husband is currently working abroad, though he hasn't forgotten about his family and supports them financially. She earns a living sewing women's dresses. She has a 15-year-old daughter who attends high school and helps her mother with the sewing after school. 

Muqaddas buys fabric, sews women's dresses out of it and then sells them. She needs to buy new fabric and sewing accessories in order to sew more and earn more income. She hopes for this loan and for her success.

loans.use: to buy fabric and sewing accessories

loans.name: Bololoke Group

texts.fr: La cliente Ntakobajira est présidente du  groupe de credit Bololoke. Femme dynamique, elle est âgée de 35 ans, mère de 4 enfants  scolarisés et  mariée à un homme d’affaire. Vendeuse des beignets, elle sollicite ce nouveau credit  pour acheter 25kg de farine, 5 litres d’huile et les ingrédients.  Elle souhaite prospérer dans ses affaires et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima du soutien.
texts.en: The customer, Ntakobajira, is president of the Bololoke loan group. She is a dynamic woman, who is 35 years old and mother to four children, who are all at school; she is married to a businessman. She sells fritters and is requesting this new loan to buy 25 kilos of flour, five liters of oil and other ingredients. She would like to prosper in her business and improve her family's living conditions. She is thus grateful to Hekima for its support.

loans.use: to buy 25 kilos of flour, five liters of oil and other ingredients.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a 38-year-old married lady, living in Irbid, Jordan. Her husband's parents are deceased, and they are taking care of his only brother who is a university student. He is majoring in Computer Science, and he is in his third year. Nancy's husband is currently facing financial problems that are not helping him, in paying for his brother's upcoming semester fees. Because of that, she wants to help him by applying for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her stepchild's upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman. She has been blessed with two children, both of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a video-showing business for over five years. She operates in a market center, where neighbours are the potential customers. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition, in her business.

With the KES 25,000 loan, she wants to purchase better video equipment for her business. She dreams of expanding her business, by establishing a theatre in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase better video equipment for her business.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is an artisan from Guatemala who specializes in wood carvings. He would like to hire additional artisans for his workshop, as well as purchase supplies and raw materials, including wood, paint, files and gouges.

Jose has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story:

"When I was younger my father would only allow me to sandpaper a piece, and as I got older he would let me paint, too. It wasn't until I was older that he'd finally let me carve the wood. I remember well the first piece I ever did completely on my own: an angel. I put it among the things my father took to the market to sell, and then I lost track of it! I hope it got sold to someone who appreciated it, because at the time I was only an apprentice."

"Many thanks for the opportunity to receive this microcredit. It will allow me to purchase the materials and supplies I need to craft more items in preparation for the holiday season. It will also allow me to hire two additional carvers for my workshop, so that I can keep up with demand. This is truly a blessing that will improve the lives of several families, including my own."

Use the link below to view Jose's wood sculptures on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7485

loans.use: to hire additional artisans for his workshop and to purchase supplies and raw materials, including wood, paint, files and gouges.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul is an artisan from Ghana who specializes in hand-carved African masks and sculptures. He would like to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including wood, beads, paint and sand paper, and to hire additional carvers for his workshop.

Abdul has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story:

"When I was four, my parents divorced and I was sent to Accra. I initially stayed with an uncle. There were times when he couldn't afford school tuition, and I had to stay home. One morning, while walking aimlessly, a man called out to me and asked me to buy him food and some wood sanding discs. When I returned, he wanted to pay for my services. I politely and humbly declined but on his insistence, I accepted a plate of cooked rice and beans. His show of love and appreciation endeared him to me, to the extent that I became his errand boy. With time, a friendship developed and I became fascinated with his craft. He was a wood carver. He trained me well, and eventually I became a carver in my own right."

"Without your help, I would not have reached where I am today. I thank you so much for this micro credit loan."

Use the link below to view Abdul's hand-carved African masks and sculptures on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/3754

loans.use: to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including wood, beads, paint and sand paper, and to hire additional carvers for his workshop.

loans.name: Lucas Bladimir

texts.es:
Lucas tiene 21 años de edad  de estado civil soltero vive con sus padres en el cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar, en la comunidad Nueva Esperanza.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Rural Cooperativa Curi-Ñan  se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad de Nueva esperanza, esta se dedican a las labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Lucas se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz, papas y trigo. Solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, urea, fungicida y para su mantenimiento para sembrar maiz. La compra lo realiza en Guaranda. Su meta es aumentar la siembra y comprarse una casa. Su desafío es las enfermedades en los sembríos y la falta de empleo. En su tiempo libre le gusta ver la televisión y jugar futbol con los amigos.
texts.en:
Lucas is 21 years old, single, and living with his parents in a neighborhood called Nueva Esperanza in the Guaranda canton of the Bolívar province. He is a member of the Curi-Ñan rural communal bank, which is located in the neighborhood Nueva Esperanza. This bank serves farmers and ranchers.

Lucas is a farmer who grows corn, potatoes and wheat. He requests this loan to purchase compost, fertilizer, insecticides, urea and fungicides to help his corn crop. He will purchase these supplies in Guaranda. 

His goal is to increase his crop size and to purchase a house. His challenges are the sicknesses of his crops, and not having enough work. During his free time, Lucas likes watching television and playing soccer with his friends.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for his corn crop.

loans.name: Ruqia

texts.en:
Ruqia is a 47-year-old, married woman. She has five children and she is motivated to provide them with good quality food, clothes, and education. Therefore, she started her business of animal sales and purchases. She has two cows and buffalo.  

Currently, Ruqia requests a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy more cattle for resale purposes, to boost her net income for providing a good quality life for her children. She is in her sixth loan cycle and has a very strong credit history.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for resale purposes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various articles (including telephones and accessories).

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: Inés hace de todo un poco para generar ingresos, por un lado elabora camisas, muñecos de trapo y comercializa productos de tocador, como cremas, maquillaje, pefumeria colonias etc. Su vida emprendedora la experimentó desde muy niña, cuando aprendió a tejer en la escuela primaria y desde ese momento, empezó a vender lo que hacia con sus propias manos. Trabajó en empresas en el arte de confeccinar y allí aprendió a perfeccionar su técnica, para finalmente con sus propios ahorros, organizar su taller. Sus productos los ofrece por via internet y mediante muestras personales y llamadas telefónicas, trabajando desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. Ines es una mujer trabajadora, que habita con su conyuge y es madre de 4 hijos,  en las edades de 12, 16 y 32 años, con ellos sueña verlos convertidos en personas muy exitosas. Su meta mas adelante es tener una mejor infraestructura, lograr incrementar sus ventas y finalmente comprar su propia vivienda, aunque su mayor desafio es ahorrar, mediante el trabajo persistente. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer finacimeinto que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una máquina industrial, tela, insumos de confección, para elaborar nuevos diseños, y muñecas de trapo, además de comprar mercancia variada como ropa interior, colonias y maquillaje. Con esta inversión espera impactar positivamente su negocio, pues ampliará su capital de trabajo y esto es justamente el exito de su inversión.
texts.en:
Inés does a bit of everything to earn money. She makes shirts and fabric dolls; she sells toiletries like lotions, make up, perfume, cologne etc. She has experimented with all sorts of businesses ever since she was a child when she learned how to knit at primary school. From that time she began to sell whatever she made with her own two hands.

She worked for companies where she learned how to sew well. Finally with her savings, Inés opened her workshop. She sells her products on the Internet, through personal demonstrations, and telephone calls. With hours from 7 am to 10 pm, Inés is hardworking woman.

She lives with her husband and has four children between the ages of 12 and 32. Her dream is to see them become successful people. Her goals are to have better infrastructure, to increase sales, and finally to buy a house of her own. Her biggest challenge is to save money from her work.

Now Inés is seeking a Kiva loan, her first through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With the money she plans to buy an industrial sewing machine, fabric, and sewing supplies with which to make new designs and soft toys. She also wishes to buy a variety of merchandise such as underwear, cologne, and make up. With this investment she expects there will be a positive impact on her business as she will be able to increase her working capital.

loans.use: buy an industrial sewing machine, fabric, sewing supplies, underwear, cologne, and make up

loans.name: Maria Del Transito

texts.es:
María, se dedica a procesar y vender semilla de marañón, esté oficio lo aprendió ayudando a su madre, desde hace 6 años ella se encarga del negocio para que su mamá descanse y no tenga preocupaciones, es así como puede generar ingresos para costear los gastos familiares; ella actualmente es soltera únicamente vive con su madre.
El capital le será de utilidad para comprar semilla cruda de marañón  al por mayor para tostarla, limpiarla y posteriormente venderla, con la inversión aprovechara que aún no ha terminado la temporada y su precio es accesible, espera contar con materia prima para mantener su negocio generando ingresos.
Sus aspiraciones son continuar mejorando el negocio para ser una mujer totalmente independiente, mejorar su situación económica, cancelar su deuda y cuidar de su madre.
texts.en:
María earns her living processing and selling cashew nuts, a job she learned by helping her mother. Six years ago she took charge of the business so her mother could relax and not have to worry any more. This is how she earns money to pay for household expenses. At the moment María is single; she just lives with her mother.

The loan money will be used to buy raw cashew seeds at wholesale prices which she will then roast, clean, and sell. With this investment María will be able to benefit from the season that has not yet ended. She will charge fair prices. She expects to have enough nuts to maintain her business and earn money. 

María’s hopes are to continue improving her business so that she can be a completely independent woman, improve her financial situation, pay off her loan, and look after her mother.

loans.use: buy raw cashew seeds at wholesale prices which she will then roast, clean, and sell

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en: Saidu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Saidu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Ummar, Dayyabu and Harazumi. Saidu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. As a result of his previous loan for inputs, Saidu expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Saidu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, in order to receive cash for immediate needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Saidu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Saidu to generate earnings of up to 1,000 USD/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. When asked, Saidu said, “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs."

loans.use: To access a loan to meet urgent expenses, child school fees, food and  farm loan repayment, eliminating pressure to sell corn at low prices

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es: Teófilo de 65 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a realizar viajes en su pick up a las diferentes colonias y pueblos aledaños desde hace varios años, tiene muchos clientes que lo buscan por la responsabilidad que tiene a la hora de manejar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de  llantas y darle mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que esa es su herramienta de trabajo y asi poder tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Teófilo, age 65, lives in his own house with his wife. For many years, he has worked as a delivery driver, making deliveries in his pickup truck to various neighborhoods and surrounding communities. He has many clients, who rely on him for his responsibility as a driver. He is seeking a loan to buy tires and make repairs on his truck, his primary tool in his business, and thus improve his earnings.

loans.use: to buy tires and make repairs on his truck.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start building her house.

loans.name: Cindy Julieth

texts.es:
Cindy, en su incansable búsqueda de una mejor vida y una mejor estabilidad económica para sus dos hijos de 3 y 9 años, inicio con un negocio de arreglo de uñas y cepillado de cabello prestando su servicio a domicilio en el municipio de Bello, Antioquia, un municipio donde el empuje y verraquera es un referente muy importante de los habitantes de esta zona.

Ella trabaja todos los días en horarios muy variados y siempre está ocupada en algún servicio ya que es muy solicitada por su buen trabajo.

Solicita un aliento económico para realizar la compra de una silla para realizar manicure y pedicura, esta silla le permitirá evolucionar en su negocio y prestara su servicio de una manera más cómoda y eficiente.

Hoy en día se siente feliz por el buen trabajo que hasta ahora ha realizado y que le ha permitido gozar de un trabajo más estable.

Con un crédito podrás apoyar a Cindy a continuar con su proyecto de vida!
texts.en:
In her everlasting search for a better life and more financial stability for her two children aged 3 and 9, Cindy opened her nail and hair business in her home in the municipality of Bello, Antioquia. It is an area where energy and tenacity are very important characteristics of the local people.

Cindy works every day but with a very varied schedule. She is always busy as she is much sought after for her fine work.

She is now seeking a loan that will breathe life into her business. She wishes to buy a special chair for manicures and pedicures; in this way the services she offers will be more efficient, and her customers more comfortable.

Nowadays Cindy feels content with the work she does as it has enabled her to enjoy more economic stability. By lending money to Cindy you will be able to help her continue her life’s work!

loans.use: buy a special chair for manicures and pedicures so she can expand her business

loans.name: Sabina Matilde

texts.es:
Es un día muy caluroso, el mercado mayor de Suchitepéquez está repleto de personas que van y vienen, unos comprando otros vendiendo.  La esperanza baila entre los dos grupos. Entre esos grupos se encuentra Sabina de 27 años de edad, ella realiza un enorme esfuerzo para sostener a su familia ella tiene 3 hijos los cuales todos son estudiantes de la escuela de su comunidad, ella es una mujer emprendedora y con grandes sueños en la vida.

La actividad que ella realiza es la compra y venta de verduras, ella eligió dicha actividad porque le genera ingresos económico para su familia, ella viene realizando dicha actividad durante 5 años y lo aprendió de su mama, a ella le gusta realizar esta actividad porque por medio de ello a mejorado las condiciones de vida de su familia y también la de su comunidad. La segunda actividad que ella realiza es la siembra de zanahoria en un terreno que tiene disponibles cerca de su casa donde ella vive.

El uso respectivo que ella le dará al crédito es para la compra de verduras y fertilizantes para así mejorar sus siembras para obtener buenas cosechas y mejorar sus ventas en el mercado de su comunidad con buenas cosechas. La aspiración de ella es agrandar su negocio y construir casas para sus hijos para que ellos tengan la condición de vida adecuada.
texts.en:
It's a very hot day. The central market in Suchitepéquez is full of people coming and going, some buying, others selling; hope dances between the two groups.  Among the crowd, we find Sabina, age 27, putting in an enormous effort to support her family.  She has three children, all of whom attend the local school. She is an enterprising woman with big dreams in life. 

Her work is buying and selling produce, a line of work she chose because it brings in earnings for her family. She's been working in this field, which she learned from her mother, for five years. She enjoys the work, because through it she has improved the living conditions for her family, as well as her community. As a side business, she grows carrots on a piece of land near her house. 

She will put this loan to use buying vegetables and fertilizers to improve her crops, achieving better a better harvest and improving her sales at the community market with quality produce. She aspires to grow her business and build a house for her children, so they might enjoy an adequate quality of life.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fertilizer.

loans.name: Uwani

texts.en:
Uwani is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Uwani joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her children: Dina, Hauwa and Ibrahim. Uwani is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. 

As a result of her previous loan for inputs, Uwani expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Uwani would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Uwani can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Uwani to generate earnings of up to $1000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Uwani said, “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses (child school fees, food, and farm loan repayment), eliminating the pressure to sell her corn at low prices.

loans.name: Rosa Candelaria

texts.es: Doña Rosa tiene 63 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 10 años, su negocio está ubicado en su casa pero también vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias,  ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para damas y caballeros ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Doña Rosa, age 63, lives her her own house with her husband. She has worked selling clothing for 10 years. Her business is based in her home, though she also makes door-to-door sales in various neighborhoods. She is seeking this loan to buy more men's and women's clothing at wholesale. As this represents her sole source of income, it will allow her to increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy more men's and women's clothing at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sacks of corn

loans.name: Bitrus

texts.en:
Bitrus is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Bitrus joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Raimond, Comfort, and Pamela. Bitrus is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. 

As a result of his previous loan for inputs, Bitrus expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Bitrus would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Bitrus can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Bitrus to generate earnings of up to $1000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Bitrus said, “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately I hope to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses (child school fees, food, and farm loan repayment), eliminating the pressure to sell corn at low prices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn wholesale, milk, oil, etc.

loans.name: Hussaina

texts.en:
Hussaina is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Hussaina joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for her child, Kauna. Hussaina is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. 

As a result of her previous loan for inputs, Hussaina expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before she became a Babban Gona member, Hussaina would have had to sell her maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Hussaina can now store her maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Hussaina to generate earnings of up to $1000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Hussaina said: “I would like to use this additional income to educate my child, and ultimately I hope to make more money for myself and my family."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses (child school fees, food, and farm loan repayment), eliminating the pressure to sell corn at low prices

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy jewellery and silver accessories; steel objects and small electric household appliances etc.

loans.name: Nuhu

texts.en:
Nuhu is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Nuhu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Nansi, Joel and Kauna. Nuhu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. 

As a result of his previous loan for inputs, Nuhu expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize; double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Nuhu would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater to his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Nuhu can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Nuhu to generate earnings of up to $1000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Nuhu said, “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs."

loans.use: To access a loan to meet urgent expenses (child school fees, food, and farm loan repayment), eliminating the pressure to sell corn at low prices.

loans.name: Magaji

texts.en:
Magaji is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Magaji joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Christophar, Malawi, and Grace. Magaji is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. 

As a result of his previous loan for inputs, Magaji expects to reap up to 30 bags/hectare of maize, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. Before he became a Babban Gona member, Magaji would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to cater for his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Magaji can now store his maize at harvest time and sell it a few months later for up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest. This allows Magaji to generate earnings of up to $1000/hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. 

When asked, Magaji said, “I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately I hope to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs."

loans.use: to meet urgent expenses (child school fees, food, and farm loan repayment), eliminating the pressure to sell corn at low prices

loans.name: Jorge

texts.pt:
O senhor  Jorge de 27 anos de idade é seguranca, casado, pai de 1 filho já ainda menor de e sustenta 1 irmao que vive com ele na casa de seus pais ja falecidos.
Ele diz que com este valor irá comprar cimento, varoes, pedra areia chapas de zinco e cimento para sua obra num espaco que a familia lhe cedeu.
No futuro tem como planos terminar sua obra, fazer carta de conducao para ver se candidata se ao cargo de motorista.
Diz que ira pagar conforme o calendario e solicitar mais emprestimos como forma de sustentar seus planos.
texts.en: Jorge, age 27, is a security guard, married, and a father of one young son. He also supports his brother, who lives with him in his parents' house, who are retired.  He tells us that with this loan, he will buy cement, beams, stone, gravel, and sheet metal for his work on a space that his family gave him. In the future, he plans to finish the renovations and get a driver's license so he can become a driver. He promises to meet his repayment schedule and take out future loans to continue with his plans.

loans.use: to buy cement, beams, stone, gravel, and sheet metal.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre de 38 años de edad, casado, padre de dos hijos de 16 y 9 años, y su negocio es la pesca.
Él es constante, independiente, trabajador, paciente y muy responsable. Su trabajo lo realiza en la comunidad ‘Cachilaya’ que se encuentra ubicado a orillas del lago Titicaca, a una altura que promedia los cuatro mil metros sobre el nivel del mar donde los rayos solares caen con bastante fuerza y la temperatura es fría.
Miguel es de tez morena, estatura mediana cabello corto negro, su lengua materna es el aymara que es el utilizado en la zona y habla español para el comercio. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que también es pescadora y sus dos hijos que estudian en la escuela. Su negocio es la pesca de especies nativas del lugar, como; el mauri, el carachi, el ispi, etc. Todos los días en un carrito de dos ruedas, transporta el motor de su bote hasta la orilla del lago, lo instala y navega alrededor de 15 minutos hacia adentro para estirar sus redes y realizar su labor diaria. Debido a uso constante; las redes de pesca se rompen y continuamente debe renovarlas. Ya lleva 20 años de experiencia en el negocio y este es el primer préstamo que solicita. Su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia mejorando sus ingresos económicos para pagar los estudios de sus hijos. Él desea realizar la compra de redes de pesca por mayor.
Es por esos motivos que Miguel solicita un préstamo para la compra de redes de pesca por mayor.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 38 year old man who is married, a father to two children ages nine and sixteen and he has a fishing business. He is persistent, independent, hard-working, patient and very responsible. 

He works in the Cachilaya community which is located on the shores of Lake Titicaca at an altitude averaging four thousand meters above sea level where the sun shines quite a lot and the temperature is cold. Miguel has a darker complexion, medium height and short black hair. His mother tongue is Aymara, which is used in the area, and he speaks Spanish for business. He shares his life with his wife, who is also a fisher, and their two children who attend school. 

His business is fishing for species that are native to the area, such as; 'Mauri', 'Carachi', 'Ispi', etc. Each day, using a small cart with two wheels, he transports the motor for his boat to the lake shore, he puts it on and he navigates about fifteen minutes to stretch out his nets to do his daily work. Due to constant use, the fishing nets break and he always has to fix them. 

Now he has 20 years of experience in the business and this is the first loan he is requesting. His dream is to improve his family's quality of life and to increase his income to pay for his children to study. He hopes to buy the fishing nets in bulk, which is why Miguel is requesting a loan.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets in bulk.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita works hard to support her family. Perlita is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle. Perlita has been in this business for 12 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 52 years old, married and has five children who are in school.

Myrna is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Myrna requested a 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds.

Myrna has been in her business for 10 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Myrna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 51 years old, married and has four children, two of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Lilia requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more feeds and vitamins.

Lilia has been pig fattening for 12 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita is 54 years old and married with nine children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marita is borrowing 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy an additional pig to raise.

Marita has been raising pigs for 15 years and also earns additional income from vegetable farming.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional pig to raise

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos, requiere un nuevo préstamo para comprar pescado seco y fresco, así podrá continuar atendiendo a sus clientes, otra parte lo utilizara para adquirir insumos agrícolas, costales y matates (red rústica en forma de bolsa que se utiliza para transportar frutos y otras cargas), será de utilidad para dar un mejor trato al cultivo de maíz.
Al invertir el crédito anterior en su negocio ha mejorado sus ingresos y los ha utilizado para iniciar a trabajar en la agricultura y en mejorar las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en:
Carlos needs another loan to buy dried and fresh fish so he can keep on serving his customers.  He'll use part of the loan to buy agricultural inputs, sacks, and "matates" (rustic nets in the shape of a bag used to transport fruits and other loads).  This will be a big help to him in improving his corn crop.

By investing his previous loan in his business he improved his income, which he used to start working in agriculture and to improve his family's circumstances.

loans.use: to buy dried and fresh fish to keep on serving his customers

loans.name: Deivinzon

texts.es: Deivinzon de 34 años de edad,  se dedica a la venta de mercancía en general, desde hace 4 años, después de decidir  aceptar la propuesta de su madre comerciante, respecto a generar ingresos elaborando y vendiendo comidas rápidas los fines de semana, además de comercializar con vestuario y cosméticos, para generar dos tipos de ingresos, el primero mediante la venta de contado y el segundo mediante créditos a clientes que hacen sus pedidos. Todos los días desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche,  Deivinzon se esfuerza en trabajar insistentemente, con el fin de independizar  su espacio laboral  del familiar y comprar más adelante un vehículo que le facilite el traslado donde sus clientes de manera efectiva. Su mayor desafío es lograr un trabajo disciplinado  y justamente está decidido a lograrlo.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará insumos para preparar  de comidas rápidas, ademas de  ropa, calzado y cosméticos, con el propósito de incrementar sus ventas y sus utilidades para lograr el cumplimiento de muchos de sus sueños.
texts.en:
Deivinzon, 34, has earned a living for four years selling a variety of merchandise.  He decided to accept the proposal of his mother, a merchant, with regard to earning an income by making and selling fast food on the weekend.  He also sells clothing and cosmetics to earn two types of income: the first with cash sales, the second with credit for customers who make requests.

Deivinzon makes an effort to work insistently every day from 8 in the morning until 10 at night.  His goal is to have a work space independent from the family's and, in the future, buy a vehicle to make it easier to get to his customers efficiently.  His biggest challenge is to do a disciplined job--and he's determined to do just that.

Currently Deivinzon's applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He's going to buy ingredients to make fast food in addition to clothing, footwear, and cosmetics.

His goal is to increase his sales and his profits so he can realize many of his dreams.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for fast food, clothing, footwear, and cosmetics

loans.name: Minda Luz

texts.en:
Minda Luz is 59 years old and married with three children. Minda Luz works very hard to provide for them.

Minda Luz runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Minda Luz has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, snack foods, and other groceries. 

In the future Minda Luz would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 52 years old, married and has four children.

She is in the agricultural business of farming vegetables in the Philippines. Merlinda requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy vegetable seeds, fruit and fertilizer.

Merlinda has been farming vegetables for 15 years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Merlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, fruit and fertilizer

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona. Yusuf joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children: Doretty, Precious, and Kabiru. Yusuf is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. As a result of his previous loan for farming inputs, Yusuf expects to reap up to 30 bags of maize per hectare. That is double the national average of 14 bags per hectare.

Before he became a Babban Gona member, Yusuf would have had to sell his maize for low prices soon after harvest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Yusuf can now store his maize at harvest time. He can sell it a few months later, for a price up to 40% higher than the market price at harvest time. This enables Yusuf to generate earnings of up to $1000 per hectare, more than four times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. When asked, Yusuf said: "I would like to use this additional income to educate my children, and ultimately, I hope to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs."

loans.use: to meet his current cash needs, such as food and farm loan repayment, which will eliminate pressure to sell corn at low prices

loans.name: Ganchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Ganchimeg, 30 years old, lives with her husband and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been running a tailor shop since 2012. Her husband renders taxi service to local people. Their two daughters both go to elementary school. 

Using her previous loan, she stored leather in a large amount, which helped her business not to run out of raw materials during the high demand period for leather coats. 

This time she is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to buy an electronic sewing machine, as her former one became outdated. The new sewing machine will increase productivity and improve the lives of her family.

loans.use: to buy an electronic sewing machine

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en:
Mrs. Batbayar, 46 years old, lives with her husband in their old house on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her grocery store is running well, and her husband is still transporting goods between districts. Their son now lives on his own. 

Using her previous loan, she and her husband made an extension to their house. Now she is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to install an electric heater and hardwood floors in order to improve their living conditions. Installment of an electric heater and hardwood floor will drastically reduce their coal usage. Coal burning is considered the main source of air pollution, according to the state research bureau.

loans.use: to install an electric heater and hardwood floor in order to reduce coal usage

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shovels, trowels, picks, carts, etc.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 45 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buying and selling of charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Rosemarie has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for 18 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Rosemarie aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 30 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

Luzviminda is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Luzviminda requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Luzviminda has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Luzviminda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jeniline

texts.en:
Jeniline is 26 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Jeniline is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jeniline has been farming vegetables for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Janet works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Janet is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Janet has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of three children, Rizalina works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling bamboo and nipa (palm frond mats) roofing in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store. Rizalina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of bamboo and nipa roofing to sell.

Rizalina has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bamboo and nipa (palm frond mats) roofing to sell.

loans.name: Raimundo

texts.pt:
O Sr. Raimundo de 43 anos de idade, casado e pai de 7 filhos dos quais 4 estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario e 3 sao independentes. Ele è seguranca na empresa de producao de banana a mais de 7  anos.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao (cimento, area, janelas, portas e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para iniciar com a contrucao da sua casa.
texts.en: Raimundo, age 43, is married and a father of seven children, four of whom are in elementary or high school and three of whom are independent. He has been a security guard at a banana company for more than seven years. This loan will go toward construction materials (cement, gravel, windows, doors) and paying construction workers in order to start the construction of his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, gravel, windows, doors) and pay construction workers.

loans.name: Oyundelger

texts.en:
Mr. Oyundelger, 24 years old, lives with his wife in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. He has been working as a serviceman at a steel factory since 2012. His wife is a nursing student at a medical college. 

Last month, they moved into their new apartment, and in order to live in a comfortable place, he is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to buy a sofa and television set. The borrower is a very hardworking young man who wants a better future.

loans.use: to buy a sofa and television set in order to improve his living conditions

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen De Moron Group

texts.es: Diana de 22 años de edad separada con 01 hijo dependiente. Ella pertenece al grupo “Virgen Del Carmen De Morón” conformada por 06 mujeres solidarias y responsables. Hace más de 04 años que Diana se dedica a la venta productos golosinarías. Gracias a su perseverancia ha logrado ampliar su negocio en prendas de vestir. Con el fin de seguir mejorando solicitó el crédito para la compra de galletas, caramelos, chupetines y chicles.  Su mayor deseo es de darle una mejor educación a su menor hijo. El grupo “Virgen Del Carmen De Morón” agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva que hicieron posible este crédito, la cual contribuye en su progreso. Diana es la primera del lado derecho, viste polo amarillo.
texts.en:
Diana, 22, is separated and has one dependent child.  She belongs to Virgen del Carmen de Morón Group, made up of six supportive and responsible women.  She has worked selling sweets for more than four years.  Thanks to her perseverance she has managed to expand her business into clothing.

Her goal is to keep on improving, so she requested a loan to buy cookies, candy, lollipops, and chewing gum.

Diana's biggest desire is to give her young son a better education.

Virgen del Carmen de Morón Group is grateful to the Kiva lenders who made it possible for them to get this loan, which contributes to their progress.  Diana's the first person on the right; she's wearing a yellow shirt.

loans.use: to buy cookies, candy, lollipops, and chewing gum

loans.name: La Rinconada Group

texts.en:
The population of the highland town of Chichicastenango is mostly K’iche’ Maya. “Chichi” refers to their ethnicity, and “tenango” roughly means “place of." The local customs of these proud people are deeply rooted and many, especially the women, wear the colorful and ornate textiles of the town. The cemetery of the town serves as a site for both Catholic and Mayan traditions. The large, noisy and colorful market, held on Thursdays and Sundays, is among the most famous in the Americas.

There is a great deal of poverty in the area, and no real government assistance for those needing a little loan. Eight women have joined together to form this Friendship Bridge Trust Bank, La Rinconada. They are requesting a loan from Kiva lenders. Tomasa is a member of the Board of Directors of the Trust Bank. She is 56 years old and has eight children. Her husband has a masonry business. Tomasa sells inventory at the wholesale level, for convenience stores. She also sells these items two or three days each week, outside of her home. She does not have her own convenience store, yet. Tomasa is requesting a loan that she will use to purchase more inventory, including rice, noodles, sugar, oil, laundry and dish soaps. She appreciates the ability to access a loan, so that she can sustain and grow her business. Her earnings will help her meet the household expenses, including the cost of sending her children to school.

The women of the trust bank La Rinconada become familiar with the world around them and within them, through the educational components of their monthly meetings. A Friendship Bridge Loan Officer, through drawings, games and role playing, presents timely and practical information on a variety of subjects. These include effective business practices, health, hygiene, nutrition, and the use of medicinal plants, as well as women’s rights and self-esteem. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of education and loans “Microcredit Plus."

loans.use: to purchase more inventory, including rice, noodles, and soap

loans.name: Sreymom's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in Kampong Cham province, Sreymom is 45 years old and a mother of four children. To support her family, she grows rice and works for others for a fee to earn income to improve their living conditions. She can earn about 33,300 KHR per day in income. 

This is Sreymom's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of two, she is the group leader. She will use her loan portion to buy fertilizers and pesticide to support her farmland. She hopes that she can get more yield than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticide to support her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Federico

texts.en:
Federico is a 52-year-old father who has nine children. He is a farmer raising his family in a rural community. He plants and harvest fruit and vegetables that he sells in the market. Aside from this, he also engages in a hog-raising business to generate additional income. He aims to make this business profitable but he has limited capital. 

For this reason, he would like to access a loan of PHP 30,000 to  buy hog feed, vitamins, additional pigs to raise and materials needed to improve the pigpen. Being a hardworking father, he believes that someday, he will manage to improve the business as well as the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to  buy hog feed, vitamins, additional pigs to raise and materials needed to improve the pigpen

loans.name: Vadim

texts.en:
Vadim is married and has small daughter. Vadim has his own business.

He sells accessories for cell phones. He has two outlets in shopping malls. He is friendly and hardworking, and wants to have success in his work. Vadim says that it is difficult to find a good sales person to hire. In future, he is planning to open a store to sell children's clothes.

Vadim is asking for a loan in the amount of 10,000 UAH. He will use the loan to expand the range of cell phone accessories.

loans.use: to expand the range of cell phone accessories

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is grateful for the financial assistance that was granted to her because she was able to buy additional stocks of clothes and processed meats. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan. She will use her new loan to buy additional safety shoes, which she also now sells, and other products needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs and expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Ligaya hopes to have business expansion soon and she only wants good health and more strength every day. She is active in attending the weekly fellowship* as it helps her to believe more in God’s love for mankind. The Bible sharing allows her to learn more about the life of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional inventory of safety shoes.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Betty has successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Betty's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Leakena

texts.en:
Leakena (shown in photo) is 29 years old and lives in the Muk Kampoul district, Phnom Penh city, Cambodia. Leakena is a widow and lives with her family and seven of her siblings.

Leakena has worked as a laundress for three months in her experience, while her mother has been a weaver at her home for fifteen years. She decided to apply for a loan to purchase a motorbike and materials for her mother’s weaving. She hopes strongly that she will get more income easily for her work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike and materials for her mother’s weaving.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
To have an additional source of income, Marivic has been buying and reselling scrap materials within her community. She is 23 years old, married, and has two children. She wants to continue and improve this business in order to earn a higher income.

Having inadequate capital, she would like to avail herself of a loan of PHP 6,000.00 to buy more bottles, plastics, iron and cans to resell. Through this financial assistance, Marivic believes that she will further improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more bottles, plastics, iron and cans to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more scrap materials and a bicycle to  be used in collecting and re-selling scrap materials

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a 42-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Lorna has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente, comparte la vivienda con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos en edades de 23 y 18 años de edad, no tiene ayuda económica del extranjero, con su esfuerzo puede cubrir las necesidades familiares; su negocio consiste en cultivar granos básicos, crianza de ganado y cerdos, estás actividades las aprendió cuando era un jovencito y vivía con sus padres, desde hace 20 años las está desempeñando como una forma de tener ingresos para la subsistencia familiar, sus hijos lo apoyan en el negocio, cultiva en tierras propias y de esta forma puede tener también alimento para su ganado.
Utilizará el capital para comprar 3 qq de abono para garantizar el buen desarrollo de una manzana y media de maíz que ha sembrado, con lo que aumentara la productividad de su negocio, incrementara las ganancias con las que beneficiara al bienestar familiar y cancelara su deuda. Los riesgos de este negocio son los altos costos en la alimentación del ganado y los cerdos.
Los proyectos del Sr. Vicente son ir mejorando el negocio para tener recursos económicos con los que pueda dar a su familia un nivel de vida más digno y cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en:
Vicente lives together with his life partner and his two children ages 23 and 18.  He does not receive any economic assistance from abroad.  Through his efforts he is able to cover family expenses.  His business consists of growing basic grains and raising cattle and pigs. He learned these activities from a young age when he lived with his parents.  He has been working on his own for 20 years in order to provide sustenance for his family.  His children help him with the farm.  He cultivates his own land and in this way he is able to provide feed for his livestock.  He will use the loan to buy three quintals of fertilizer in order to guarantee the growth of an acre and a half of corn that he has planted, which will increase the productivity of his business, increase his income, and benefit the well-being of his family as well as canceling his debt.  The risks in this field are high costs and the feeding of cattle and pigs.  

Vicente hopes to continue improving his business in order to have enough income to give his family a good quality of life, a more dignified life, and to cancel his debts.

loans.use: to buy three quintals of fertilizer in order to guarantee the growth of an acre and a half of corn that he has planted

loans.name: Lizandra

texts.en:
Lizandra is 23 years old and a married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Lizandra has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more clothing to sell to customers.

Lizandra has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell to customers

loans.name: Anselma

texts.en:
Anselma is grateful for the financial assistance extended to her because she was able to purchase more varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Anselma hopes to encourage more customers to patronize her store. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
This is Milagros, 46, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Danilo, a carpenter, and she is mother to their children. Together with her husband, she manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Milagros operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
