Milagros hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to support her children's schooling. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Rowena successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Rowena's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 45 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. Nancy works very hard to provide for them.

Nancy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Nancy has been in this business for twenty years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and school supplies. 

In the future Nancy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Bureau Coordination 8 Cepac Group

texts.fr: Monsieur  Maendeleo  est le représentant de travailleur du bureau administratif de la 8eme CEPAC, une des coordinations des écoles protestante de la place. Il est âgé de 56 ans, marié et  père de 7 enfants scolarisés. Il a pris connaissance de l’existence du produit credit enseignant au sein de Hekima qui a retenu son  attention et celles de ses collègues de service. Cet ainsi, qu’il vient de solliciter un crédit pour acheter le matériel de construction. Son objectif est d’achever la construction de sa maison. Il remercie Hekima pour cette nouvelle initiative en faveur des enseignants.
texts.en:
Maendeleo is a workers' representative of the Bureau Coordination 8 Cepac Group, one of the organizations of protestant schools in the region. He is 56 years old, married, and the father of 7 children who all attend school.

Maendeleo first became aware of available microloans when he was teaching at Hekima. This grabbed his attention as well as that of his colleagues. It is as a result of this experience that he is requesting a loan to purchase construction materials. His goal is to perform construction on his home. 

Maendeleo thanks Hekima for this new initiative geared towards teachers.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Relita

texts.en: Relita is aged 53, married and they're blessed with two children. She owns and manages a retail store selling onions, garlic, and ginger at the public market. In this business she earns PHP 200 daily. Her daily net income is usually spent on their daily expenses at home. Due to insufficient funds to run her business, she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to purchase onions, garlic, and ginger to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase onions, garlic, and ginger to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain his cocoa crops.

loans.name: Jojo

texts.en: Jojo is a farmer, who is raising his family in a rural community. He makes their living through farming and raising ducks and chickens to sell. Due to financial hardship, he aims to improve his business. He wants the business to generate sufficient income to provide the necessities for his family and support the education of his two children. To improve his business, he wants to access additional capital of PHP 7,000. He will use this amount to buy more ducks and chicks, and cracked corn  for feeding his ducks and chickens. Through hard work and strong determination, Jojo hopes that someday, he will improve the living status of his family.

loans.use: to buy more ducks and chicks, and cracked corn for feeding them

loans.name: Andrita

texts.en:
Andrita is 52 years old and married with six children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Andrita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Mae Ann

texts.en:
Mae Ann is 30 years old and married, with one child in school. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items, such as sugar, soap, diapers, noodles and other groceries.

Mae Ann requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future Mae Ann would like to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 26 years old and married. She has two children, one of whom is in school. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Cheryl has been raising pigs for three years, and she earns additional income from a general store.

Cheryl is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
A $1000 loan is offered to Lucia to improve her business. She is married and she has four children. She has a kiosk where many people come to shop every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as slippers, shoes, socks, kids games, dot flowers, handbags, kitchenware, umbrellas and children's shoes. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2010. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Lucia independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future. She has a garden, and also has animals like buffalo, pigs, and others. Her husband is in agriculture.

loans.use: to buy slippers, shoes, socks, kids games, dot flowers, handbags, kitchenware, umbrellas and children's shoes.

loans.name: Esmeralda Nahuala Group

texts.en:
Nahualá is a bustling, small, rural town on the Pan-American Highway in the highlands of Guatemala. The highway is often filled with 'chicken buses' that are renovated American school buses, transformed into colorful art projects and packed full of people and, sometimes, their chickens! Nahualá is the hub of the area, as nearly all the population lives on the outskirts of the town. 

The vast majority of the population speaks the Mayan dialect of K’iche as their first language and, to a lesser degree, Spanish. Most of the adult population has had little or no education. The people do not have many ways to support themselves and there is a dire economic need. Friendship Bridge is a vehicle of hope for seven ladies in the Trust Bank's 'Esmeraldas Nahualá Group' or 'Emeralds of Nahualá.'

Previously, Juana was featured. She needed a loan to purchase yarn for her textile business. Many of the women in the town have textile and handicraft businesses. Juana reports that she has made wonderful progress in her business and was most grateful for the loan. 

For this report, we would like to introduce Francisca, who is a 40-year-old mother of two children and about to begin her second loan cycle. Francisca is a nurse and also sells medicine. 

She is requesting a loan to increase her inventory of medicine, to meet the demand. She is bilingual and speaks both Spanish and K’iche. In addition, Francisca is from Nahualá and well-acquainted with many in the town. Her dream is to create more income and open her own pharmacy.

The seven ladies of the Trust Bank's 'Esmeraldas Nahualá Group' have enjoyed the participatory educational components of their monthly meetings when a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer shares useful information that affects the daily lives of the women.  Some topics covered include hygiene, nutrition, health, and self-esteem.

The Microcredit Plus Program of the organization, that combines small loans and education, has proved itself to be an effective way for the women to empower themselves and eliminate poverty. Last January, the ladies received a loan through Friendship Bridge, generously funded by Kiva investors. The women report that the loan has been paid back in full and on time. Because of the progress that the women have made, the Trust Bank is applying for a second loan.

loans.use: to purchase medicine to sell.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for years and she earns well from this. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. She has had to work hard, with the determination to have a better income, to provide her children with better education. 

To improve sales, Aida would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 17,000, she could already purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Aida hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family as well as her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their lives and businesses every week.  There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Sokheang

texts.en:
Sokheang (in the photo) is 29 years old, and lives in Khsach Kandal district, Kandal province, Cambodia.

Sokheang has been married since 2003, and has one son and one daughter. They are still young.

She has been a weaver for two years, working out of her home. Her husband is an air-conditioner electrician for a private company and has one year of experience. Now she would like to apply for a loan to buy silks for weaving and to repair her toilet.

She makes a strong commitment that she will use this money for this goal, and that she can pay it back to Maxima.

loans.use: to buy silks for weaving and to repair her toilet.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora, aged 46, is married to a farmer and blessed with seven children. She has been in the food vending business for almost three years, in which she sells/roams around their village and earns a net income of PHP 300 daily. Her net income from this business is usually spent on their food expenses and the school allowances of their children. Due to insufficient funds she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase dried fish and vegetables to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
This is Criselda. She is thankful for the financial assistance that was extended to her as she was able to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Criselda hopes that her business will continue to improve and she also desires to have other sources of income. She also wants for her children to complete their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been operating her own piggery for five years and she earns well from this. She sustains all her needs through her business while ably helping her family at the same time. She also works hard with the determination of having a better income.

To further improve profit, Jessica would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional pigs to sell. With PHP 42,000, she could already purchase feed for her pigs and also buy additional pigs to raise which are needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Jessica wants to have her own farm to place her piggery. She desires for her family to have good health and security every day. She is an active community partner of C.C.T. She meets with her fellowship* group every Wednesday.

*All C.C.T. community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional pigs and feed

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 41 years old and married. She has six children, all of whom attend school.

Editha works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 16 years, and she earns additional income from E-loading (selling prepaid minutes for mobile phones).

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more groceries to sell. Editha has borrowed and repaid 24 loans from NWTF, before this loan. She aspires to save enough money so she could continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married mother of nine children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family. She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from pig fattening.

Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF. She will use this loan to buy additional kitchenware and ingredients for her food-vending business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional kitchenware and ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
Isidro, es reconocido en su comunidad por ser una persona responsable y dedicada al cultivo de granos básicos y crianza de ganado, negocio que ha heredado de sus padres, lo desempeña desde hace 25 años junto a su propia familia, lo cual le da como ventaja que no tiene que pagar mano de obra, sus labores inician a las seis de la mañana y finalizan a las dos de la tarde; Isidro está acompañado, vive con su compañera de vida y dos hijos de 25 y 22 años de edad, todos dependen de los ingresos que su negocio genera.
Está solicitando un crédito para comprar fertilizantes, insecticidas, semilla y 8 qq de abono para cultivar maíz, está inversión será de mucha ayuda para obtener una cosecha abundante y sin problemas de plagas, tanto para el consumo familiar como para comercializar, los riesgos son  los cambios climáticos y los precios variables de los insumos agrícolas en el mercado.
Isidro tiene su sueño de continuar trabajando para tener una actividad económica rentable que le proporcione ingresos económicos necesarios para darle a su familia un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Isidro's known in his community as a responsible person who is dedicated to growing basic grains and raising livestock.  He inherited the business from his parents and has worked in it for 25 years with his own family, which gives him an advantage because he doesn't have to pay for labor.  He starts work at 6 in the morning and finishes at 2 in the afternoon.

Isisdro's in a relationship and lives with his life partner and his two children, ages 25 and 22, all of whom depend on the income he earns.

He's requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide, seed, and 8 quintals of soil amendments to grow corn for both family consumption and to sell.

This investment will be a big help to him for getting an abundant crop without problems with disease.  The risks are changes in temperature and the variable price of agricultural inputs in the market.

Isidro's dream is to keep on working so he has a profitable job that provides the income he needs to give his family a better future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, seeds, and soil amendments to grow corn

loans.name: Miraflor

texts.en:
Miraflor is 33 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Miraflor is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Miraflor has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 52 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. 

Susana is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Susana requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Susana has been raising pigs for 29 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain this business.

In the future, Susana would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Abdulio

texts.es:
Abdulio, tiene su propio negocio el cual consiste en cultivar maíz y frijol, también comercializa ganado; es acompañado, vive con su compañera de vida, no tienen hijos; esté negocio lo practica desde muy joven como una fuente de ingresos para abastecer su hogar de lo necesario, su padre le enseño el oficio, el negocio lo fundo hace 34 años, inicia sus labores a las ocho de la mañana finalizándolas a las cinco de la tarde, el ganado lo comercializa en los alrededores del municipio en que reside.
El crédito lo invertirá en comprar una vaquilla, profilácticos y forraje, fortalecerá el negocio, protegerá el ganado de enfermedades y lo alimentará mejor, de esta manera tendrá oportunidades de mejorar las ventas e ingresos.
Los proyectos de Abdulio son diversificar sus cultivos, aumentar la ganadería, cancelar sus deudas y tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Abdulio has his own business cultivating corn and beans. He also sells livestock. He is married and lives with his wife. They don't have children.  He started this business when he was very young as a source of income to establish his household.  His father taught him how to do this work.  The business was started 34 years ago.  He works from 8 AM until 5 PM. He sells the livestock in the regions around his home.

This loan will be invested in buying a heifer (young, female cow), food for the livestock, and prophylactics (medicines to prevent disease), which will strengthen his business.  He wants to protect the livestock from disease and to feed them well.  These activities will improve his sales and thus his income.

Abdulio's projects are to diversify his crops, increase his livestock, pay off his debts, and to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a cow, feed, and medicine - which will strengthen his business.

loans.name: Vor

texts.en:
Vor (shown in this photo) is 60 years old and lives in the Chba Ampov district of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He has been married since 1982 and has four sons and four daughters. They have been married. They have no child in their family.

Vor is a mason with seven years of experience, while his wife has been a caretaker of elderly people in their village for four years. He decided to apply for a loan to buy cows to hire to his neighbor. He hopes that next year he will get one cow and then can sell it to get more money to support his family.

loans.use: to buy cows to hire to his neighbor.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
Rafael is thankful for the PHP 50,000 loan assistance that was granted to him, because he was able to purchase more, and a greater variety of, grocery items, toiletries, and beverages that he needed for his business. His earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another PHP 50,000 loan. He will use this loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in his inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase, with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

In the future, Rafael hopes that his business will continue to cover their everyday needs and that he will always be able to help his family. He meets up with his co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products to sell at his store

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is aged 39, married to a farmer and blessed with six children. She has owned and managed a food stall in their village for almost four years and earns a net income of PHP 200 daily. Her net income from her business is usually spent on their daily expenses at home. Her business picture shows that she doesn't have any commodities, but she already disposed of her products before they took her solo picture. Due to insufficient funds she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase food ingredients, fruits, vegetables, and fruit juices to sell in her food stall. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and grow.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients, fruits, vegetables, and fruit juices to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 57 years old, married to a farmer, and blessed with four children. She has owned and managed a welding shop in their village for almost seven months. In this business, she earned a net income of PHP 2,000 weekly. 

Due to insufficient funds in her business, Lourdes would like to avail herself of a loan, amounting to PHP 18,000, to purchase round bars, tools, and equipment for her welding shop. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase round bars, tools, and equipment for her welding shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional ducks, chickens and cracked corn.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 29 years old and married. She has three children, who are all in school. Maricel works very hard to provide for them, running a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items, such as soap, sugar, and other groceries.

She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future Maricel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Edith Yamileth

texts.es:
Edith, vive junto a su madre, su compañero de vida y un hijo; con el fin de tener un mejor estilo de vida familiar hace 7 años fundo su negocio, el cual consiste en la vender diferentes tipos de pescado fresco y otros mariscos, lo realiza de forma ambulante en su comunidad y sus alrededores, por el momento no representa dificultades en su negocio.
Invertirá en la compra de un carretón, para acomodar las hieleras y salir a vender sus productos, le facilitara incrementar las ventas, tener mejores ganancias y ampliar sus recorridos. Espera resarcir su deuda sin dificultades.
Edith aspira seguir teniendo una fuente de ingresos con la que pueda apoyar a su compañero de vida en los gastos de su hogar y dar a su hijo un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Edith lives with her mother, her life partner, and a child.  Seven years ago she started her business so her family could have a better lifestyle.  She sells different types of fresh fish and other shellfish.  She sells on foot in her community and on the outskirts.  She has no difficulties with her business at the moment.

She's going to invest in a cart for her coolers and go out to sell her products.  This will make it easier to increase her sales, earn more profit, and expand her routes.  She expects to pay back her debt with no problem.

Edith wants to continue to have a source of income to help her life partner with the household expenses and give her son a better future.

loans.use: to buy a cart for her coolers and go out to sell her products

loans.name: Ep Ruvumba Group

texts.fr: Monsieur Barheza  est le représentant des enseignants de l’école primaire Ruvumba, une institution éducative chrétienne présente dans la ville. Agé de 70 ans, il est enseignant de formation, marié et père de 9enfants scolarisés. Il a pris connaissance de l’existence du produit credit enseignant au sein de Hekima qui a retenu son  attention. Cet ainsi, qu’il vient de solliciter un crédit pour acheter une parcelle. Son objectif est d’avoir une maison en matériaux durable. Il remercie Hekima pour cette nouvelle initiative en faveur des enseignants.
texts.en:
Barheza represents the teachers of the Ruvumba primary school, a Christian school in town. At 70 years old, he is a teacher by profession, married, and a father of nine children, who go to school.

Barheza learned about Hekima's loan program for teachers and so is seeking a loan to buy a piece of land.

His goal is to have a long-lasting house. 

Barheza thanks Hekima for this new initiative that helps teachers.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land

loans.name: Gladys María

texts.es:
Gladys es una mujer de experiencia, sabiduría y mucha paciencia.

Es madre de 2 hijos y ha trabajado prácticamente toda su vida para sacarlos adelante.

Ella tiene un pequeño Kiosco en la que vende frituras, golosinas y refrescos. 

Trabaja todos los días de 5:00 Am  a 7:00 Pm para tener sus productos listo y fresco para sus clientes que en su mayoría son los vecinos del sector donde vive.  

Ella desea capitalizar su negocio y tener un gran avance de insumos e inventario de productos, por eso acude a un préstamo para comprar surtido de bebidas y frituras.

Una de sus principales dificultades es la falta de dinero para invertir en su negocio pero confía en la ayuda y buen corazón de las personas para sacar su actividad adelante.
texts.en:
Gladys is an experienced business woman with a lot of knowledge and patience.

She is the mother of two children and has worked practically her entire live in order to get by.

She works every day from 5:00 AM until 7:00 PM in order to have her products ready and fresh for her customers.  Her customers are her neighbors that live in the regions near her home.

She wants to improve her business and increase her income by investing in more products. She is seeking a loan so that she can buy an assortment of beverages and snacks.

One of her biggest challenges is the lack of money to invest in her business. She trusts in the help from this loan and in the good hearts of the people that are helping her move her business ahead.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of beverages and snacks for her business.

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Phal, age 50, is a famer living in Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of five children, three of whom are still in school. To support her family, Phal has been growing rice for 18 years.

For Phal, this is the first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is applying for a loan to pay for her daughter's tuition fee. She hopes that this loan will enable them to keep her at school until her graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sangien's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from Kampong Speu province, Sangien is 50 years old and she has six children. The main source of the family's income is from growing rice. The current business earns her about KHR 25,000 per day. 

Sangien is just with VisionFund Cambodia for this cycle. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. She wants to use her portion to buy a water filter for use by her family. She hopes for her family to have clean water for drinking.

loans.use: to buy a water filter for use by her family.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy gasoline, spare parts and accessories needed for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer casada, es una persona muy trabajadora y muy responsable, trabajó con su familia en  diferentes negocios donde adquirió experiencia en las ventas. 

Desde hace 4 años inició con una tienda de abarrotes para trabajarla como independiente y  labora desde las 7:00 am a 10:00.  

Rosa sueña con tener un supermercado a futuro, por lo pronto con el crédito solicitado desea adquirir al por mayor una gran variedad de productos como verduras, granos, frutas, hortalizas etc., y poder brindarle a sus clientes artículos de excelente calidad. 

Con este negocio ha podido salir adelante poco a poco y ha intentado mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is a married woman.  She's a very hardworking and responsible person.  She worked with her family in different businesses and acquired experience in sales.  Four years ago she started on her own with a grocery store.  She works from 7 a.m. until 10.

Rosa dreams of having a supermarket in the future.  With the loan she's requesting she wants to get a variety of products wholesale, including vegetables, grains, fruit, and greens, and be able have products of excellent quality for her customers.

She has been able to get ahead little by little and improve her quality of life with this business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, grains, fruit, and green vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Koemsreu's Group

texts.en:
Koemsreu is living in Kampong Speu province. He is 32 years old and a married father of one child who is still in school. To support his family, Koemsreu has been farming rice for 15 years. The current business earns him about KHR 28,000 per day.

This is the first micro-loan for Koemsreu with VisionFund Cambodia. Now, he is leading his group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Koemsreu wants to use his portion to buy a water filter. He hopes for his family to have clean water to drink.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Somblomwaoga Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe de trois femmes battantes a pour responsable Sibdou. Ce groupe travaille avec ACFIME depuis Mars 2014 mais jusque là elles font les remboursement sans problème. Sibdou est  marié ,mère de 04 enfants dont 03 sont scolarisés. Elle fait des gâteaux qu'elle revend dans les différents supermarchés et boutiques.elle exerce cette activité depuis 03 ans. Cet prêt pourrait l'aider à acheter de la farine de blé, de l'huile de qualité et les autres ingrédients pour faire de bon gâteaux vendre. le bénéfice lui permettra d'aider son mari maçon à payer la scolarité de leurs enfants; de faire face aux besoins élémentaires de la famille et accroître son activité.
texts.en:
This group of three hard-working women has Sibdou as their leader. They have worked with ACFIME since March 2014 and have not had trouble making repayments.

Sibdou is married and a mother of four children, of whom three go to school. She makes cakes that she resells in different supermarkets and shops. She has been in this business for three years.

This loan will help to buy wheat flour, quality oil, and the other ingredients to make good cake to sell. 

Earnings will allow her to help her husband, who is a mason, to pay their children's school fees and support the family's basic needs, as well as expand her business.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour to make cakes to resell

loans.name: Sumber Usaha Group

texts.en:
The Sumber Usaha group received a loan from MUK, and they were able to repay the loan well. Ni Wayan, head of the group, managed her loan wisely. Any repayment of the loan can be done on time, under the supervision of the head of the group. Ni Wayan sold her piglets, after keeping them for two months, at a satisfactory price. Now she can renovate her house.

Ni Wayan is very grateful for the benefits she earned, and she thanks the Lenders for their support. For electricity and water, Ni Wayan spends 200,000 IDR per month.

Now, the Sumber Usaha group receives their new loan. The group expected to increase the amount of their loan, but after they had an evaluation from MUK’s staff, the group still receives the same loan amount as before.

Ni Wayan, is still the head of the group. She already has two sows, and she is using her portion of the loan to purchase super-quality feed, only. She must protect the health of her sows. She hopes the sows can birth safely, and the piglets can grow healthy. She will sell the piglets for fattening or pig barbeque. She has a plan to save all the profit, and use it for business capital later.

One of the members couldn't attend the meeting, because she was having a religious ceremony at the Temple.

loans.use: to purchase super-quality feed for her animals

loans.name: Sayohat

texts.en:
Sayohat is a widow. She is 52 years old. Sayohat lives with her children in northern Tajikistan. 

With the purpose of earning a living, she began her own business nine years ago. Sayohat has opened a café. She cooks pillaw and other national Tajik dishes in her café. She sells dishes to local people. Sayohat cooks dishes herself. She is a very industrious woman and provides high quality services to her clients. Her clients often return to her café. 

Sayohat must buy food items, such as rice, carrots, onions, and oil. With this aim, she is asking for a loan of TJS 7,500 (somoni). This loan will help her to increase her working capital and maximize her profit. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy rice, carrots, onions, etc. for her cafe.

loans.name: G.s Hossana Group

texts.es:
La señora Ordelina tiene 59 años de edad, vive con sus ñietos y su esposo,  su actividad principal es la venta de leña y cuenta con más de 12 años de dedicarse a esta  actividad económica.
Doña Ordelina está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de leña y poder surtir su negocio y esto le vendrá a mejorar sus ingresos en el hogar, sus ventas las realiza al contado.
Está muy agradecida con los créditos que se le han otorgado ya que ha salido adelante y han sido de mucha ayuda, esto le permite cubrir los gastos familiares su sueños es tener una estabilidad económica y mejorar su hogar.
Doña Lucy se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos desde hace varios años.
Doña María se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado.


Trojes, Honduras - Octubre del 2014
texts.en:
Ordelina, 59, lives with her grandchildren and her husband.  Her main job is selling firewood; she makes sales in cash.  She has more than 12 years of experience making a living in this job.

Ordelina's requesting the loan to buy firewood to stock her business.  This will improve her household income.

She's very grateful for the loans she has received because they have been a big help and she has gotten ahead.  This allows her to cover the family expenses.  Her dream is to have financial stability and improve her home.

Lucy has sold clothing and cosmetics for several years.  María earns a living selling clothing and footwear.

Trojes, Honduras, October 2014

loans.use: to buy firewood

loans.name: Sunshine Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand is Mary, a member of Sunshine Self Help Group, which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the year 2014. She is 23 years old, married, and blessed with two children. 

Mary joined HiH EA to benefit from training in enterprise and financial management. Her main economic activity is vegetable farming and she grows tomatoes, carrots, onions, and cabbages. 

She is borrowing money to purchase certified seeds and she hopes for a bountiful harvest. This will lead to more supply in the market, increase her income levels and, thus, be able to support her children's education and meet her family's basic needs.

Mary appreciates Kiva and its lenders for the continued support and she promises to promptly repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds to plant.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 50 years old and is married with seven children. Three of Lilia's children are in school.

Lilia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Lilia requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Lilia has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain this business.

In the future, Lilia would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ushirika Group

texts.fr: Madame Masembe, femme ambitieuse  est  présidente de l’association d’affaire Ushirika. A l’âge de 38 ans, elle est mère de  5 enfants  scolarisés  et  est engagée à un Infirmier. Elle vend divers médicaments dans la rue c’est ainsi qu’elle sollicite ce nouveau prêt pour acheter un 1 carton d’amoxyciline, 1 carton de novalgines  et 1 carton d’aspirine.  Elle rencontre un problème de loyer  raison pour laquelle son rêve est de prospérer dans ses activités afin d’avoir un logis. Ainsi, elle remercie grandement Hekima pour son initiative de soutien aux femmes commerçantes.
texts.en:
Masembe is an ambitious woman and president of the Ushirika group. At 38 years old, she is engaged to a nurse and is the mother of five children, who go to school. 

She sells various medicines in the street and it is for this reason that she is seeking a loan. She plans to buy one box of amoxycillin, one box of novalgine, and one box of aspirin.

She has problems with rent, so she dreams of prospering in business so that she can have a home.

She greatly thanks Hekima for their initiative to support female merchants.

loans.use: to buy one box of amoxycillin, one box of novalgine, and one box of aspirin

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita operates a school canteen, a hog raising business, and a transportation business. She started raising hogs in 1981 and has three years of involvement in the school canteen in her community.

Emelita plans to purchase more stocks of grocery items for the school canteen as well as feed and materials such as cement and gravel and sand for the renovation of her pig pen, but she does not have enough capital. Therefore, she is seeking a loan of PHP 10,000. She knows that this loan amount will help her to increase her income and improve her way of living.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for the school canteen and materials needed for renovation of her pig pen

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 53 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Helen has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

Helen has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Jenerose

texts.en:
Jenerose is a 34-year-old mother who owns and manages a small retail store to help her husband in generating income. She aims to further improve her business so as increase her income and finance the education of her two children. 

Jenerose would like to acquire more stocks of grocery items to resell. but she has limited capital. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of PHP12,000.00 to buy more canned goods, noodles, biscuits, candies, beverages, seasonings and soft drinks to resell. Through this financial assistance, Jenerose hopes that she will make her business more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, noodles, biscuits, candies, beverages, seasonings and soft drinks to resell

location.town: Brgy. Domang, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Onan Hipolito

texts.es:
Onan, utilizo el préstamo anterior para adquirir  frutas y verduras además compro materia prima para la elaboración de panes con pollo y refrescos, se ha mantenido trabajando, tiene nuevos clientes y generando ingresos para cumplir con sus obligaciones, su familia está viviendo con mejores comodidades.
Sus deseos de ir mejorando su negocio han hecho que nuevamente solicite un crédito para comprar pollo, tomates, aderezos, condimentos, azúcar, servilletas, aceite, etc., para elaborar los panes y refrescos con los que mantendrá a sus clientes satisfechos y su negocio funcionando.
texts.en:
Onan used the previous loan to purchase fruits and vegetables; he also purchased raw materials to prepare bread with chicken and beverages. He has kept working, he has new clients and he has generated revenue to comply with his obligations; his family is living with better amenities. 

His desire to improve his business has made him request, once again, a loan to purchase chicken, tomatoes, dressings, condiments, sugar, napkins, oil, etc. to prepare the sandwiches and beverages; this will allow him to keep his clients satisfied and his business running.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, tomatoes, dressings, condiments, sugar, napkins, oil, etc., to prepare de sandwiches and the beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy juices, sodas, spring water, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
"Hard work and patience" have been Marissa's guiding principles in running her variety store. She started operating this kind of business in 2005 and continues to this moment. Her husband works as a driver of a ten-wheeler truck.

Marissa and her husband aim to have a better way of living and to increase their income. In regard to their goals as a couple, Marissa decided to seek financial assistance amounting to PHP 20,000, which allows her to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, sugar, milk, canned goods and Nescafe to sell.

She is hoping that lenders will grant her requested loan amount so that she can obtain a greater income to sustain her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, sugar, milk, canned goods and Nescafe to sell

loans.name: Williams Antonio

texts.es:
William  tiene 27 años de edad, es casado y tiene 1 hijo de 7 años de edad y es un excelente estudiante de la escuela que les queda cerca de la comunidad, el hijo de Williams se ha convertido en el motivo de la lucha de trabajar cada día para brindarle un futuro mejor y una mejor condición de vida.
	
Durante 12 años ha venido trabajando con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación en el trabajo de carpintero en su casa de habitación ubicado en su comunidad, también teniendo una segunda actividad como agricultor en su comunidad. 

Los fines con que el desea realizar un préstamo, es en la compra de materiales de construcción tales como block y hierro para la construcción de su vivienda y  es para  la realización de su más grande sueño en la construcción de una vivienda para tener las condiciones de vidas adecuadas.

Una de las más grandes aspiraciones de Williams es poder vender sus productos en su comunidad para que las personas conozcan del trabajo que el  realizan, he dar estudios a su hijo para que llegue a profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
Williams is 27 years old, is married and has one child who is 7 years old and is an excellent student at the nearby school. His son has become the reason he strives every day to offer him a better future and a better way of life.

For 12 years he has worked with great effort and dedication as a carpenter from his house, as well as having a second job as a farm worker in his local community.

The reason he wishes to take out a loan is to buy construction materials such as blocks and iron for the construction of his house. It is to realize his greatest dream of building a home to have decent living conditions.

One of his greatest aspirations is to sell his products in his community so that people recognise the work that he does. He also wants to enable his son to study so that he can become a professional person in life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Viviana Marlene

texts.es:
Viviana es una madre de familia amorosa, siempre preocupada por el bienestar de su familia, tiene 3 hijos preciosos que son el motor de su vida y por quienes lucha día a día para poder brindarles un futuro mejor.
Desde hace más de 20 años se dedica al negocio de venta de medicina natural, gracias a ello ha podido ayudar a muchas personas, ella cree que le está yendo bien en su negocio por su constancia, dedicación y porque siempre ofrece productos de calidad.
Viviana está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería para surtir su negocio, de esta manera sus ingresos mejorarán y así más adelante podrá tener su propio local.
texts.en:
Viviana is the mother of a loving family, and she is always concerned about her family's wellbeing. She has 3 precious children who are her life's inspiration, and for whom she strives day after day to be able to provide them with a better future.

For more than 20 years, she has had a business selling natural medicines. Thanks to this, she has been able to help many people. She believes that her business is going well because of her persistence and dedication, and because she always offers quality products.

Viviana is grateful to Kiva lenders because with their help, she will be able to buy a greater quantity of merchandise to stock her business. This way, her earnings will improve, and in the future she will be able to have her own store.

loans.use: to buy natural products to stock her business.

loans.name: Firdaskhon

texts.ru: Фирдавсхону 23 года он учиться в университете на  экономическом факультете. Он хочет стать в будущем бухгалтером в крупной нефтяной  компании. Он живет со своими родителями, они находятся на пенсии, но у них есть свой маленький бизнес. Они делают шашлыки и продают. У них много клиентов, потому что его родители делают шашлыки уже несколько лет и имеют своих постоянных клиентов. Но Фирдавсхона другие планы, он надеется что последний курс, где он должен защитить свою дипломную работу помогут найти достойную работу. Надеется что он успешно построит свою карьера. И кредит которую  он получит помогут осуществить его планы и мечты.
texts.en: Firdaskhon is 23 years old. He attends a university, majoring in economics. He wants to become an accountant at a major oil company in the future. He lives with his parents, who are retired and have a small business. They prepare and sell kebabs. They have many customers because they have been cooking kebabs for several years and have regular clients. But Firdaskhon has other plans. He hopes that the last course, where he has to submit his diploma thesis, will help him find a decent job. He hopes to successfully build his career. And the loan that he requested would help realize his plans and dreams.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.ru: Диловар родился в 1996 году. Он не женат. Диловар с 2003 года по 2014 года учился в средней школе. После окончания школы он поступил в Таджикский Государственный Университет Политики и Бизнеса по специальности юрист. Диловар успешно учился в школе и старается и в университете тоже учиться отлично. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 725 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие. В будущем он имеет большие планы.
texts.en: Dilovar was born in 1996. He is not married. Dilovar attended a secondary school from 2003 to 2014. After graduating from the secondary school, he was accepted to the Tajikistan State Politics and Business University to become an attorney. Dilovar studied excellently in school and tries to do the same at the university. He has to pay for this tuition, but does not have money. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 725 US dollars to pay for his university tuition. He awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy. He has big plans for the future.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin, con el crédito anterior mejoro su negocio teniendo como resultado mejores ingresos los que le sirven de respaldo para cumplir con los compromisos familiares y el pago de su deuda.
Nuevamente solicita un préstamo que en esta oportunidad le servirá para comprar insecticidas, fertilizantes y abono para limpiar el terreno de la maleza y dar un buen desarrollo al cultivo de maíz, espera tener una buena cosecha para alimentar a su familia y satisfacer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
With the previous loan, Martin improved his business, resulting in better earnings that provide support for fulfilling family commitments and repaying his debt.

He is applying for another loan. This time, he will use it to buy insecticides, fertilizers, and compost to clear the land of brush and allow his corn crop to grow well. He hopes to have a good crop to feed his family and satisfy his customers.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, fertilizers, and compost to clear the land of brush and allow his corn crop to grow well.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is a 38-year-old resident of Tanza Cavite, Philippines and she is married to Noel. She and her husband, who is also a painting technician, manage their household while operating a business. They work hard for their children and to provide income for their everyday needs.

Emerita maintains a direct-selling business, along with her sari sari store. She is shown in the photo in her store. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through the popular direct-selling brands, like Avon, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct-selling brands. 

A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealers' prices are lower than those in the catalog and the difference is the profit that dealers are investing in as their income. Emerita's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, Emerita is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products, like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments, and other products needed in her direct-selling business. She will also use portion of the loan to buy grocery items to expand her product inventory.

Emerita hopes to grow her business. She wants her family to be in good health and free from any sickness. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise needed in her direct-selling business.

loans.name: Ruzikhol

texts.ru: Рузихол получила финансирования и безгранично благодарит кредиторов Kiva за помощь и поддержку, она надеется с таким же успехом, ей удастся получить кредит во второй раз. Рузихол использовала кредит целенаправленно и купила теленка. Она намерена получить еще один кредит и приобрести больше телят бычков, чтобы увеличить поголовья скотин. Рузихол надеется сделать свой бизнес устойчивым и улучшить финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en: Ruzikhol has previously obtained financing and is forever grateful to the Kiva lenders and support. She hopes that she will be able to obtain a second loan with just as much success. Ruzikhol used the loan purposefully and purchased a calf. She intends to obtain another loan and buy more calves and bulls in order to increase the livestock headcount. Ruzikhol hopes to stabilize her business and improve her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy calves and bulls in order to increase the livestock headcount

loans.name: Joram

texts.en:
Joram, a 48-year-old married father of 16 children, sells fish, working hard to sustain his big family. He used his previous loan to expand his business and is very grateful for that. 

Joram has requested a new loan to buy more fish to sell. He hopes to educate  his children and create for them a better future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Edita

texts.es:
Edita, tiene como actividad económica la crianza de cerdos y cultivo de granos básicos, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 16 y 22 años de edad, todos trabajan juntos para salir adelante como la familia unida que son, inician sus labores muy temprano cada día, de seis de la mañana a tres de la tarde, alimentan a los cerdos y luego se dedican trabajar en el campo para realizar las actividades que el cultivo de granos básicos  demanda, ya cuenta con 10 años de tener establecido su negocio.
Comprará 8 qq de abono para dar un mejor cuido al cultivo de maíz y 2 qq de concentrado para alimentar a los cerdos, le servirá para tener un negocio más rentable y sostenible, espera mejorar la situación económica para resarcir su deuda, los riesgos son posibles plagas que afecten el cultivo y que los cerdos se enfermen.
Edita tiene como visión continuar trabajando para mejorar es estilo de vida familiar y ofrecer a sus hijos un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Edita, who earns a living by raising pigs and growing staple grains, lives with her husband and two children who are 16 and 22 years old. They all work together to make progress as a united family.

They begin their work very early every day, working from 6 in the morning until 3 in the afternoon. They feed the pigs and then work in the fields to carry out the tasks that the growing of the staple grains demands. They have run this business for 10 years.

Edita will buy 8 quintals of fertilizer to provide better care for the corn crop, and 2 quintals of animal feed for the pigs. This will allow her to have a more profitable and sustainable business, and she hopes it will improve her economic situation so she can repay her debt. The risks are that blight could affect the crops and the pigs could become ill.

Edita’s vision for the future is to continue working to improve the way of life for the family and offer her children a better future.

loans.use: to buy 8 quintals of fertilizer to provide better care for the corn crop, and 2 quintals of animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Gloria Estella

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer pujante, servicial y trabajadora, a sus 50 años de edad, es casada y madre de dos hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.

Desde hace 4 años se desempeña en el campo de la confección, prestando el servicio de confección a terceros y a clientes directos, el oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica y trabaja sola todos los días, así genera los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.

Actualmente se motiva a solicitar el crédito para comprar 2 maquinas planas que le permitirán cumplir con la entrega oportuna de los pedidos que tiene pendientes, logrando fidelizar sus clientes actuales. 

Gloria manifiesta que desea continuar realizando su labor con mucho empeño, pues quiere ampliar su negocio y poder generar oportunidades de empleo, además de garantizar una estabilidad económica para dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gloria is a very committed, helpful and a hard-working woman at her 50 years of age. She is married and is the mother to two children, whom she has helped move forward with a lot of effort and dedication. 

For over 4 years she has worked in clothing, providing clothing services to third parties and direct clients. She learned this job empirically and she works alone every day. This is how she generates the necessary revenue to support her husband with the family income. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase 2 plain machines that will allow her to comply with the timely delivery of the goods she has pending. This will allow her to create loyalty among her current customer base. 

Gloria mentions that she wishes to continue working with a lot of effort since she seeks to increase her business and generate employability, as well as guaranteeing financial stability and a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase 2 flat machines for her clothing workshop.

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.ru: Мавзуна родилась в 1995 году в семье служащих. В 2002 году поступила в среднюю школу и успешно закончила. В 2013 году поступила в Политехнический Институт Технологического Университета Таджикистана на факультет Менеджмент и управления и в настоящее время является студенткой 2 курса. Она активная и целеустремленная девушка, участвует во всех молодежных студенческих мероприятиях. Среди однокурсников имеет хорошую репутацию. Мавзуна запрашивает займ для оплаты своего обучения. Она надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en:
Mavzuna was born in 1995 in a family of white-collar workers. She started middle school in 2002 and graduated successfully. In 2013 she entered the Polytechnic Institute at the Technological University of Tajikistan, at the Faculty of Management and administration. Currently she is a second year student. 

Mavzuna is an active and purposeful girl, who participates in all student activities. She has a good reputation among her class mates. Mavzuna requests a loan to pay for her tuition. She hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her tuition

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.en:
Shahlo is a married mother of two children who are school-aged. Three years ago, through her own initiative, she began her own business, selling dried fruits. Shahlo sells variety of dried fruits and nuts and her store is located in a local market.  Her father and brother help her with managing the business. 

Shahlo is the main breadwinner of her family since her husband is a builder and has a small income. Her greatest dream is to be able to see her children become highly educated people. That is why she always strives to provide them with a better education. 

Shahlo is asking for a loan of TJS 3,000 (somoni) to buy dried fruits and nuts, to increase working capital and, in this way, to attract more customers. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy dried fruits to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to upkeep and fertilize his cocoa crops.

loans.name: Aizada

texts.ru: Айзада, 52 года, замужем, мать 6 детей. У Айзады среднее образование, уже много лет она занимается сельским хозяйством. Сегодня в хозяйстве Айзады есть 4 коровы, 17 овец, также на собственном земельном наделе мерою 1,67 Га она занимается полеводством, выращивая картофель, помидоры и клевер. Экологически чистая и вкуснейшая продукция пользуется большим спросом и приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 25,000 сомов(KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айзада обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 бычков. В будущем Айзада планирует направлять доходы от кредита на развитие ее сельскохозяйственной деятельности.
texts.en:
Aizada is 52 years old, married, and the mother of six children. Aizada has secondary education. She has worked with agriculture for many years already. Currently Aizada has four cows and 17 sheep on her farm, and also her own plot of land of 1.67 hectares, where she works with field crop cultivation, growing potatoes, tomatoes and clover. Her ecological and tasty products are in high demand, and bring a monthly income of 25,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Aizada turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) to purchase two bull-calves. Aizada plans to use the income from the loan to develop her agricultural business.

loans.use: to purchase two bull-calves for fattening up subsequent resale

loans.name: Birobiya

texts.ru:
Ее зовут Биробия. Ей 42 года. Она проживает в городке под названием Турсунзода. Она мать двоих детей. Ее дети школьники. Биробия занимается шитьем "курпы" и "куппачи" 
   "Курпа" и "курпача"- это ватные матрасы. "Курпа" шьют стандартно квадратном размере, ее используют в качестве одеяла. Курпача длинные матрасы используется как диваны. 
   Биробия из тех жителей, которая сохранила один из многих национальных символов своего народа. Ватные матрасы до сегодняшних дней востребованы. Биробия берет кредит для купли материала для работы, в том числе вату, тканей и ниток. У нее не хватило средств для приобретения достаточной суммы денег и ей пришлось обратиться за кредитом.
texts.en:
This woman is called Birobiya. She is 42 years old and lives in a town called Tursun-zoda. She is the mother of two children. Her children are of school-age. Birobiya works with sewing "Kurps" and "Kurpachas". "Kurps" and "Kurpachas" are cotton mattresses. A "Kurp" is sewn as a standard square and is used as a blanket. A "Kurpacha" is a long mattress which is used as a sofa. 

Birobiya is one of the residents who has preserved one of the many national symbols of her people. To this day, cotton mattresses are in demand. Birobiya takes a loan to purchase materials for work, such as cotton, fabric and thread. She did not have sufficient funds for the purchase and she had to apply for a loan.

loans.use: to purchase cotton, fabric and thread for sewing national mattresses

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 41 years old and married. She was blessed with five children, and they are currently residing in a rural community. Due to financial hardship, she aspires to improve her small retail store to earn a higher income. 

She would like to acquire more stock of grocery items to sell, but she doesn't have enough capital. For this reason, she would like to access financial assistance amounting to PHP 12,000 to buy beverages, laundry soaps, canned goods, breads, noodles, seasonings, soft drinks, and vegetables to resell. She is hoping that this financial assistance will enable her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy beverages, laundry soaps, canned goods, breads, noodles, seasonings, soft drinks, and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 58 years old, married and has five children.  

Nida is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nida has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Nida would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Carlos Ernesto

texts.es:
Carlos, con ayuda de créditos y buena administración de los mismos, ha mantenido con vida su negocio de transporte, ha dado mantenimiento a su vehículo, tiene nuevos clientes y mejores ingresos, las circunstancias familiares han cambiado positivamente. 
Opta por un nuevo préstamo para invertir en hacerle cambio de llantas y otras mejoras a su vehículo, con lo que continuará dando seguridad y buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carlos, with the help of loan and effective loan administration, has maintained his transportation business alive. He has provided maintenance services to his vehicle; he has new clients and more income. His family circumstances have positively changed. 

He has opted for a new loan to invest in tire-changing and other improvements to his vehicle. This will allow him to continue providing security and a good service to his customers.

loans.use: to invest in changing tires and other improvements to his vehicle, this will allow him to continue providing secutiry and a good service to his customers.

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.ru: Шавкат честный и жизнерадостный молодой человек. Он родился в 1989 году. Шавкат учится в Национальном Университете Таджикистана. Он студент 4 курса. Он учится по специальности экономист-финансист. Шавкат учится заочно и параллельно работает в государственном учреждении.  Он живет с родителями. В свободное время от занятий он помогает своим родителям по домохозяйству. Он очень начитанный молодой человек. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Shavkat is an honest and happy young man. He was born in 1989. Shavkat studies at the National University of Tajikistan. He is a fourth year student. He studies to be a Financial Economist. 

Shavkat is a correspondence student, and he works at a public office in parallel. He lives with his parents. In his spare time, he helps his parents with the household. He is a very well-read man. He requests a loan to pay for his tuition. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase vegetables, beef, corn, cocoa, among others.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and transport.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 25,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is aged 58, married to a farmer and blessed with eight children. She has managed a vegetable production business in their village for almost ten years and earns a net income of 300 PHP (Philippines pesos) daily. 

Due to insufficient funds for her business, she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to 10,000 PHP to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for her vegetable production business. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more productive.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and fertilizers for her vegetable production business.

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian is a married mother of two and lives in Msambweni. She sells green groceries, and is helped by her family. Lillian is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. 

Lillian is requesting a loan of KES 25,000 to buy beans, green vegetables, oil, vegetables, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.use: to buy beans, green vegetables, oil, vegetables, tomatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Sarat

texts.en:
Sarat is a 32-year-old single construction worker living with his widowed mother and a great aunt in the Kampong Chhnang province of Cambodia. Being a worker since 2010, Sarat can earn approximately $5 a day. 

Now Sarat would like to request a loan to buy steel and zinc sheets to expand the house roof forward. This loan will help him have a nicer house. In the future, he wants to be a construction foreman.

loans.use: to buy steel and zinc sheets to expand the house roof forward

loans.name: Proscovia

texts.en:
Proscovia is a thirty-four-year-old woman. She is married with two children and lives in Kasese, Uganda. She operates a produce business selling dry beans, rice, and g-nuts, among others. She used the previous loan to buy cassava flour to sell. 

Proscovia has a dream of expanding her business, although she is faced with a challenge of limited capital and competition. 

Proscovia is hardworking and wants money to buy beans and g-nuts for selling.

loans.use: to buy beans and g-nuts for selling.

loans.name: Marian Nataly

texts.es:
Marian es una joven mujer de 19 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es el corte y confección de prendas de vestir. 
Ella es inteligente, sociable, amable, alegre, optimista, responsable y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en ‘Sacaba’ que se caracteriza por ser un valle semi-tropical, dónde la venta de comida es abundante, variada y todo se acompaña con chicha (bebida fermentada de maíz).
Marian es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo, viste a la moda, su lengua materna es el quechua, también habla español y vive en casa de sus padres que cuenta con los servicios básicos de agua y luz. Su negocio es el corte y confección de prendas de vestir, también arregla prendas como; botapies, largos de faldas, ancho de blusas, etc. Las herramientas que utiliza mayormente son: regla "l", regla curva francesa, regla curva sastre, cinta métrica, gredas para marcar, variedad de tijeras, etc. Sus inicios fueron como ayudante de sastre donde aprendió el oficio y con una máquina casera se independizó. Su negocio prospera debido a que en el lugar dónde vive no tiene competencia y su tienda se encuentra sobre la avenida por lo que todos los que pasan por el lugar la conocen. Ya lleva un año trabajando de forma independiente y este es el primer préstamo que solicita. Ella sueña con tener una boutique de ropa de su propia confección, y necesita una máquina de coser industrial porque la máquina que usa actualmente está desgastada y muchas veces se malogra eso le hace perder trabajos y tiempo.
Es por esos motivos que Marian solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de coser industrial y comenzar a lograr sus metas.
texts.en:
Marian is a young woman of 19 years of age, she is single with no children and her business is dressmaking. She is intelligent, sociable, friendly, happy, optimistic, responsible and hard working. She works in Sacaba, which is known for being a semi-tropical valley, where sales of food are plentiful, varied and all accompanied by chichi (a drink made from fermented corn).

Marian is of dark complexion, medium height with long dark hair and she dresses fashionably. Her first language is Quechua, she also speaks Spanish. She lives in her parents’ house which has basic services of water and electricity.

Her business is dressmaking , she also does clothing alterations like trouser length, skirt length, blouse width etc. The tools that she uses most are: a straight ruler, a French curve, a tailor’s curve, a tape measure, tailor’s chalk for marking, various scissors etc.

Marian began in this business as an assistant to a tailor, where she learned the trade, and with her own domestic machine she became independent. Her business prospers as where she lives there is no competition for her services and her shop is located on an avenue where everyone who passes by gets to know her. She has been working independently for a year and this is the first loan she has requested. 

She dreams of having a clothing boutique of her own clothes, and needs an industrial sewing machine because the machine she currently uses is worn out and breaks down a lot and this means she wastes work and loses time.

For these reasons Marian is asking for a loan to buy an industrial sewing machine and begin to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine and begin to achieve her goals.

loans.name: Eliphaz

texts.en:
Eliphaz, a 42-year-old man, is married with two children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a cocoa farmer and a businessman. He is very hardworking, and he hopes to expand his business and serve more people for better profit maximization. 

He has cocoa gardens but also buys and sells cocoa. He is affected by inadequate capital and seasonality changes. He wants a loan to buy merchandise such as cooking oil and bread to sell.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as cooking oil and bread to sell

loans.name: Juana Marleni

texts.es:
Juana, vive con su señor esposo y su hija de 12 años de edad, es propietaria de una sala de belleza, la cual fue establecida hace 13 años, se ha preparado mediante cursos y ya cuenta con experiencia en el negocio, es la manera como ella genera ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, su horario de trabajo es de ocho de la mañana a siete de la noche, una de sus ventajas es que el negocio está ubicado en su residencia y así puede permanecer pendiente de los cuidados de su familia, por el momento no representa dificultades en el negocio.
El financiamiento que está solicitando le será de ayuda para comprar cosméticos, tratamientos faciales, tintes, tijeras, etc., abastecerá su negocio con productos básicos para mejorar el servicio a sus clientes, los riesgos son la competencia que existe en la zona.
Los proyectos de Juana son incrementar sus ingresos, cancelar su deuda, dar un mejor estilo de vida a su familia y apoyar a su hija en prepararse académicamente para que tenga mejores oportunidades de desarrollo en la sociedad.
texts.en:
Juana lives with her husband and their twelve-year-old daughter. She owns a beauty salon, which she established thirteen years ago. She has completed training courses and has experience in this business. This source of income allows her to help her husband with their family expenses. Her work schedule is from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm. One of the advantages is that her business is located in her home so she can still take care of her family while she is working. The business has not run into any problems so far.

She is requesting financing to help her buy cosmetics, facial treatments, dye, scissors, etc. to stock her business. These basic products will allow her to improve the services she provides her customers. The existing competition in her area is the only risk she faces.

Juana's projects are to increase her income, pay off her debt, give her family a better lifestyle and support her daughter in her education so that she can have better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, facial treatments, dye, scissors and other products for her business.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Эту активную молодую женщину зовут Шахноза, ей 26 лет. Она живет в городе Исфара вместе с двумя маленькими детьми и свекровью. Муж Шахнозы работает в России. Их детям по 4 и 6 лет. Они еще не ходят в школу. Шахноза тоже активно трудится для обеспечения семьи. Четыре года назад она начала бизнес по купле и продаже сухофруктов. Ей в деятельности помогает свекровь. Они оптом закупают сухофрукты и затем продают по розничной торговле. Сейчас для продолжения деятельности Шахнозе не хватает немного средств и поэтому она обратилась за кредитом. Шахноза верит, что с Вашей поддержкой она сможет продолжить и расширить свой малый бизнес.
texts.en:
This active young woman is called Shahnoza. She is 26 and lives in the city of Isfara together with her two small children and her mother-in-law. Her husband is working in Russia. Her children are four and six and don't go to school yet. Shahnoza works very hard to take care of her family. Three years ago she started a business buying and selling dried fruit, something her mother-in-law helps with. They buy the dried fruit wholesale and then sell it for a profit. 

Shahnoza doesn't currently have enough money to continue her business and therefore is looking for a loan. She believes that with your support, she will be able to continue and expand her small business.

loans.use: to buy dried fruit for resale

loans.name: Pokiza

texts.ru: Покизе всего 21 год. Она уже замужем и имеет годовалого ребенка. Ее муж находиться на заработках в Российской Федерации. Покиза живет вместе с ребенком и родителями мужа. Покиза занимается выращиванием крупнорогатых скотин. В работе по уходу за скотами ей помогает свекр. Она любит свою работу и старается расширить деятельность и создать устойчивый бизнес. Покиза планирует получить кредит и купить пару голов скотин. Сейчас у нее малое  количество крупнорогатых скотин и она намерена их увеличить с помощью заемных средств. Поддержите Покизу.
texts.en: Pokiza is only 21 years old. She is already married and has a one-year-old. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia. Pokiza and her child live with her husband’s parents. She raises cattle with help from her father-in-law. She loves her work and is trying to expand their activities to create a sustainable business. Pokiza is planning to take out a loan to buy some cattle. She currently does not have many cattle and intends to increase their numbers with borrowed funds. Support Pokiza.

loans.use: to buy calves and young bulls

loans.name: Guldasta
