texts.ru: Гулдаста молодая и жизнерадостная девушка. Ей 21 года. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Гулдаста и ее семья живут в столице Таджикистана. Она имеет средне-специальное образование. Гулдаста работает в государственном учреждении. Она очень трудолюбивая девушка и ее все уважают за ее честность и трудолюбие. Гулдаста обратилась в ИМОН первые за займом, так как она больна и ей необходимо лечится. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони для покупки лекарства. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие. Будущем она мечтает выйти замуж за хорошего человека и создать свою семью.
texts.en: Guldasta is a cheerful young woman. She is 21, unmarried, and lives with her parents. Guldasta and her family live in the capital of Tajikistan. She has a specialized secondary education and works at a public institution. She is a very hardworking girl and is respected for her honesty and hard work. Guldasta applied for a loan with IMON because she has an illness that needs to be treated. She is requesting a loan of 2,500 somoni to buy medicine. She is waiting for your kindness and hopes for your mercy. In the future she hopes to get married to a good person and start a family.

loans.use: To buy medicine for her treatment

loans.name: Candelaria De Dolores

texts.es:
Candelaria, estabilizo mejor su negocio de tienda y mini carpintería, con la inversión del financiamiento anterior, cuenta con nuevos clientes e ingresos, comparte un nivel de vida junto a su familia más confortable y logro cancelar su deuda.
 Con el fin de continuar mejorando su negocio opta por solicitar un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en bebidas, aceite, huevos, golosinas, pan, etc., para la tienda, así como también pita de junco, cordel, barniz y otros materiales para la carpintería, espera seguir teniendo buenos resultados.
texts.en:
Candelaria was able to stabilize her small store and mini carpenter's shop through her previous loan.  She now has new clients and income.  She shares her income with her family, and they are more comfortable and have been able to cancel their debt.  

With the aim of continuing to improve her business she is requesting a new loan in order to invest in drinks, oil, eggs, candies, bread etc. for her store.  She will also purchase hemp, cord, varnish, and other materials for carpentry. She hopes to continue to have good results.

loans.use: to invest in drinks, oil, eggs, candies, bread etc. for her store.  She will also purchase hemp, cord, varnish, and other materials for carpentry.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano, en este momento no cuenta con recursos económicos suficientes para realizar los trabajos de agricultura, por lo que se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un nuevo crédito para comprase fertilizantes, insecticidas, abono y semilla que le ayuden a continuar cultivando granos básicos.
El préstamo anterior le facilito a Mariano obtener una cosecha abundante con la que alimenta a su familia y surtió las demandas de sus clientes, poco a poco está mejorando su situación económica y su familia se mantiene.
texts.en:
Mariano does not currently have sufficient income in order to do his agricultural work, which is why he needs to request a new loan in order to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, feed and seed which will help him grow basic grains.  

With his previous loan Mariano obtained an abundant harvest with which he fed his family and met the demands of his customers.  Little by little he is improving his economic situation and the maintenance of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, feed and seed which will help him grow basic grains.

loans.name: Gulruhsor

texts.ru: Гулрухсор трудолюбивая женщина 29 лет. Она замужем и имеет 4х детей. У Гулрухсор нет высшего образования. Она замужем. У ее мужа так же нет высшего образования.  Муж Гулрухсор в данный момент находится в РФ на заработках. Гулрухсор сама со своей семьей живет в сельской местности. Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание Гулрухсор занимается своим делом, откормом и продажей крупно рогатого скота. От данного дела она имеет хороший доход. В данный момент Гулрухсор хочет приобрести корм на зиму для скота. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд за кредитом. Гулрухсор заранее благодарит нашу организацию за поддержку и надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en: Gulruhsor is a hardworking 29 year old woman. She is married and has four children. Neither she nor her husband have a university education. Her husband currently works in Russia and she and her family live in a rural region. In order to earn an income to buy food, Gulruhsor runs a business fattening and selling cattle, which earns her a good living. She currently wants to buy cattle feed for the winter, so she went to Arvand for a loan. Gulruhsor thanks Arvand in advance for their support and hopes for a positive outcome.

loans.use: to purchase feed for livestock

loans.name: Niyazhan

texts.ru: Ниязхан 62 года, замужем, есть взрослый сын. У Ниязхан - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 21 год назад. Благодаря упорному труду Ниязхан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 корова, 10 овец. Также есть земельный надел размером 1,62 ГА, на котором она ежегодно выращивает пшеницу и клевер под внутрихозяйственное потребление и реализацию. Ежемесячный доход Ниязхан составляет до 25,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Ниязхан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для дальнейшей перепродажи. Ниязхан планирует накопить средства на ремонт ее дома.
texts.en: Niyazhan is 62, married, and has an adult son. She has a vocational education and earns the main income for her family by raising livestock and planting crops. She started farming 21 years ago, and thanks to her hard work she currently has a cow and ten sheep, along with a 1.62 hectare plot of land where she grows wheat and clover for use on the farm and to sell. She earns up to 25,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to continue expanding her business, Niyazhan applied for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy cattle to later sell. Niyazhan is planning to save money to repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to fatten and resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics and hair oils to sell.

loans.name: Cherry Ann

texts.en:
Cherry Ann aspires to improve her small retail store and earn sufficient income to cover the necessities of her family and finance the education of her children. She is 34 years old and blessed with three children attending school. 

Due to insufficient working capital, she would like to access an additional capital of PHP 12,000 to buy canned goods, soft drinks, sugar, cooking oil and laundry soap to resell. She is hoping that she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, sugar, cooking oil and laundry soap to resell

loans.name: Beatriz Juana

texts.es:
Beatriz es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, trabaja en un programa de cuidado de niños desde hace más de 5 años en su ciudad natal, Huaraz. Desde muy joven ha trabajado para sacar adelante a sus hijos, quiere verlos convertidos en grandes profesionales más adelante. En sus tiempos libres le gusta salir a caminar para meditar sobre cómo se está desempeñando en su vida y así corregir sus errores.
Beatriz está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá apoyar a su hijo con sus estudios superiores, de esta manera él saldrá adelante y ella se sentirá muy contenta y tranquila con esto.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a very hardworking and determined woman. She has worked for over 5 years in a programme taking care of children in her native city, Huaraz. Since she was very young she has worked to help her children to succeed, she would like to see them become great professional people in the future. In her free time she likes to go out for walks to meditate on how she is doing in her life, and thus correct her errors.

Beatriz is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the support they have offered she will be able to support her son with his higher studies and she will feel so happy and content with this.

loans.use: to support her son in his studies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase detergents, toilet paper, bread, eggs, sweets, candies, etc

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
José, es un agricultor que trabaja desde hace 12 años en un horario de siete de la mañana a tres de la tardeen el cultivo de granos básicos y hortalizas, el oficio lo heredó de familia, hoy en día al desempeñar está actividad obtiene ingresos para cubrir sus gastos personales; está soltero, vive con su madre, a quien apoya económicamente. En este momento no representa dificultades en administrar su negocio.
Solicita capital para comprar hilo e insumos agrícolas, son materiales necesarios para cultivar pepinos, tendrá más producto, atraerá nuevos clientes y sus utilidades serán mayores, el riesgo son los cambios climáticos.
José sueña con cancelar sus deudas, tener un nivel de vida más digno y mantener funcionando su negocio.
texts.en:
José is a farmer who has worked for the past 12 years on a schedule from seven in the morning until three in the afternoon cultivating basic grains and vegetables.  He inherited this work from his family.  These days he does this work in order to obtain income to cover his personal expenses.  He is single and lives with his mother, who he supports economically.  Currently he has no problems managing his business. 

He is asking for a loan in order to buy string and agricultural feed. These materials are necessary for growing cucumbers.  He will have more product, attract new customers, and have better resources. The risks that he faces are climate changes. 

José dreams of paying off his debts, having a more dignified level of life, and maintaining his business in a way that functions well.

loans.use: to buy string and agricultural feed. These materials are necessary for growing cucumbers.

loans.name: Jose Guillermo

texts.es:
José, tiene una carpintería mejor equipada y con nuevos clientes, además su nueva situación económica le permite dar a sus hijos un mejor estilo de vida y cancelo su deuda, estos son beneficios de la buena inversión del crédito anterior.
En esta oportunidad solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar clavos, barniz, madera y otros materiales para mantener la carpintería funcionando, cubrirá las nuevas exigencias de sus clientes y seguirá mejorando el entorno familiar.
texts.en:
José has a carpenter's shop that is now better equipped and with new customers.  In addition, his new economic situation allows him to give his children a better style of life and cancel his debt.  These are the benefits that he received from his previous loan. 

At this time he is requesting a new loan in order to purchase nails, varnish, wood and other materials in order to maintain his carpentry shop in order.  It will allow him to meet the new demands of his customers and to continue supporting his family.

loans.use: to purchase nails, varnish, wood and other materials in order to maintain his carpentry shop in order.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 36 years old and lives in Uganda. She is a widow and the mother of five children, three of whom are still in school. Her main source of income is the sale of agricultural produce, including maize, cassava and nuts. Her major clients are residents of Nyamarunda, where she lives; she says she started her business in 2006 to support her family as a single mother. Ruth has applied for a loan to expand her business. Her dream for the future is acquire more land on which to grow crops. The major problem she faces is price fluctuations, especially since she cannot transport her products to major towns, where she could earn a higher price.

loans.use: to buy corn, nuts and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Jose Buenaventura

texts.es: Jose de 64 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, el se dedica a la venta de hamacas desde hace 30 años, vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Jose está solicitando un crédito para la compra de hamacas por mayor  para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Jose is 64 years old and lives in his own home with his son. He has been working selling hammocks for thirty years. He sells them as a street vendor covering different neighborhoods. The profit he makes allows him to cover some of his household expenses.

Jose is requesting a loan to buy wholesale hammocks in order to keep up his sales and earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy wholesale hammocks.

loans.name: Las Tres Marias Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Las Tres Marías” y está constituido por 05 socias dinámicas y solidarias. Giovanna de 45 años de edad es separada con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas y cereales ambulatoriamente. Gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar su calidad de vida. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de galletas, chocolates, caramelos y turrones. Su mayor deseo es contar con un local propio para poder incrementar sus productos.   El grupo “Las Tres Marías” agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva por darles la oportunidad de progresar en sus negocios. Giovanna se encuentra sentada, es la primera del lado derecho.
texts.en:
This is the group "Las Tres Marías" [The Three Marias] which is made up of 5 dynamic and supportive partners. Giovanna is 45 years old and separated with 2 dependent children. She makes a living selling candy and cereals as a street vendor. Thanks to her efforts she has achieved a better quality of life.  She requested the loan to buy cookies, chocolates, candies and nougat.  Her biggest dream is to have her own shop to be able to increase her products.  

The group "Las Tres Marías" thanks Kiva’s investors for giving them an opportunity to progress in their businesses. Giovanna is sitting in the photo, first person on the right.

loans.use: to purchase cookies, chocolates, candies and nougat.

loans.name: Sisi Kwa Sisi Group

texts.en:
Charles, who is in his mid-50s, is married with six children; three of them are still in school while three of them are grown-ups.  He has been running two projects, a genge (small general store) and milk selling for three years now.  He works from 6 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Charles's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase his general store stock and to start selling milk.  He is doing great with the loans.  He used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses.  He will use this loan restock the out-of-stock items in the store and to increase the milk stock. He dreams of buying another plot of land and building a house to rent out.

Charles will share this loan with his loan group "Sisi kwa Sisi" which consists of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items in her convenience store and to increase the milk stock.

loans.name: Maftulby

texts.en:
Maftulby is 46 years old and married. She has 3 children. Maftulby was born in the capital of Tajikistan. She finished junior college.

As a main source of income for her family, Maftulby raises livestock, having launched this business 12 years ago by buying cattle. Thanks to Maftulby's hard work, her farm presently includes two cows and some sheep. She also services the nursing service for small children of her neighbors.

Maftulby is going to increase the number of cattle she feeds in order to maximize business. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 TJS to buy cattle to increase her livestock headcount. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cattle for increasing working capital

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald used the previous loan to buy building materials such as sand and cement for his residential house. He is still in transport and at the same time running a video library. He faces challenges of limited capital plus bad roads that cause constant mechanical breakdowns of his motorcycle. Besides that, he has hopes of expanding his business to new areas. 

Ronald needs a loan to add new stock of the latest videos to his video library.

loans.use: to add new stock of the latest videos to his video library.

loans.name: Uba

texts.en: Uba is married and the mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house, which has electricity and piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. Uba earns a living by operating a poultry-selling business. Disease is one of her biggest challenges. She dreams of becoming a poultry wholesaler in the future. She is requesting a loan for Kshs 50,000 to buy chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, desea aprovechar la temporada para continuar cultivando granos básicos, por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito para invertir en 6 qq de abono e insecticidas, para ayudar que el cultivo de 16 tareas de maíz tenga un mejor proceso, espera que su cosecha sea abundante y de calidad.
Al administrar bien el crédito anterior Luis ha tenido mejor productividad de granos básicos y logro vender a buen precio el dulce de atado, mejores ganancias, ha cancelado sus deudas, su familia tiene una mejor alimentación y  educación.
texts.en:
Luis wants to make the most of the season to keep on growing basic grains, so he's requesting a new loan.  He's going to invest in 6 quintals of soil amendments and insecticide to help him better process his 16-cord corn crop.  He hopes to have an abundant and high-quality harvest.

By managing the previous loan well, Luis has had better productivity with his basic grains and was able to sell his dulce de atado candy at a good price.  He also earned better profits and paid back his debts, and his family has better nutrition and education.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments and insecticide to better process his corn crop

loans.name: Iris Maritza

texts.es: Iris de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos y su compañera de vida, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 8 años, vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas frutas y verduras por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Iris is 34 years old and lives in her own home with her four children and her life partner. She has been working selling fruits and vegetables for the past eight years. She is requesting a loan to buy more wholesale fruits and vegetables to keep up her sales and earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy more wholesale fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en casa desde hace varios años, tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de productos y los buenos precios, el joven vive  con su padre y su compañera de vida, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de golosinas, sopas, aceite, refrescos, etc. todo por mayor para surtir su tienda y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
This young man's face has been pixelated because he is 26 years old and lives in a high risk area. He has a small store located in his home, which he opened several years ago. He has lots of customers because he carries a wide array of products and his prices are good. He lives with his father and his life partner.

He is requesting a loan to buy wholesale sweets, soups, oil, soft drinks, etc. to stock his business and earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy wholesale sweets, soups, oil, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy maize flour, rice and cooking flour.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is aged 42, married to a farmer, and blessed with five children. She has owned and managed a vegetable production business in their village for almost 24 years and earns a net income of PHP 5,000 monthly. Her income from this business is spent on their daily expenses. 

Due to insufficient funds for her business she would like to access a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase seedlings, fertilizers, and insecticide spray to use on her vegetable production. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow productively.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings, fertilizers, and insecticide spray to use on her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn has been raising hogs for six years and has been running a variety store for five years. She is married and has been blessed with five children.

Marilyn is seeking additional capital amounting to PHP 5,000 to be used for buying grocery items for her store and feeds for her hogs. She knows that this loan amount will enable her to obtain greater income so that she can help her youngest child finish her studies and improve her living condition. She is hoping to obtain her requested loan amount.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for her store and feeds for her hogs

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
This is Carolina, 52, a resident of Busuanga Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Carlos and they have two children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Carolina operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food on one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. She also sells basic food ingredients in her stall for additional income.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 1000 in sales every day. She also manage their pension house where they can usually earn up to 9,000 PHP in income per month.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Carolina dreams of managing her own restaurant business someday and she also desires to expand her pension house. She  meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables  needed in her business.

loans.name: Santos Salvador

texts.es:
Santos, está planeando la próxima siembra de maíz, pero no cuenta con los recursos económicos que le faciliten adquirir de manera rápida los materiales necesarios para cultivar, solicita un nuevo crédito para invertir en abono, semilla, herbicidas e insecticidas, con los que busca agilizar los procesos para tener un mejor resultado en el cultivo de maíz.
Los efectos del préstamo anterior son tan positivos para Santos, ya que la cosecha de maíz y frijol fue abundante y sin plagas, mejoro la alimentación diaria de su grupo familiar y obtuvo mejores ganancias con las que ha podido ir cancelado sus compromisos.
texts.en:
Santos is planning the next corn planting but doesn't have the economic resources which allow for the quick acquisition of the materials required to cultivate.  He is requesting a new loan to invest in compost, seeds, herbicides and insecticides with which he's looking to speed up the process of getting better results in his corn production.  

The effects of the last loan were very positive for Santos. He had a more abundant and pest-free harvest of corn and beans.  This has improved the daily nutrition of his family and he had better earnings which have allowed him to pay off his past debts.

loans.use: to invest in compost, seeds, herbicides and insecticides with which he hopes to speed up the process to obtain better results in his corn production

loans.name: Floride

texts.en:
Floride is 35 years old. She is married with 2 children who are 4 and 18 years old; both of them go to school. She has a shop and has been running this business for the past 3 years.

With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, beans, and maize flour for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more rice, beans, and maize flour for selling.

loans.name: Yonah

texts.en:
Yonah is a 52-year-old married man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer growing food crops like tomatoes and bananas. 

He faces challenges of limited capital, but besides that, he has hopes of improving his agriculture enterprise. Yonah needs a loan to buy herbicides for his plantation.

loans.use: to buy herbicides for his plantation.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Petu

texts.en: Petu is a 20-year-old university freshman whose major is Information Technology. He is from Tbong Khmum province in Cambodia. Because of a lack of financial support, Petu would like to secure a loan to pay for his tuition. With this loan, he will be able to graduate successfully. In the future, after graduation, he is going to find a good job and save money so that he can have his own business.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees

loans.name: Laurelio

texts.en: Laurelio is a farmer who plants and harvests various vegetables. He is 54 years old and has two adult-aged children. He wants to improve his farming business so that he can give his family a better life. Laurelio would like to do this by expanding his vegetable farm, but he has limited capital. That is why he is requesting a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy fungicides, fertilizer and insecticides for his farm. Because he is a hard-working father, he believes that he can further improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fungicides, fertilizer and insecticides.

loans.name: Sweet Ann

texts.en:
Sweet Ann is a married woman and a mother of a 3-year-old child. She lives in Concepcion, Iloilo. She has been engaged in a motorcycle transportation business with her husband for more than two years now. This is the source of their income.

Sweet Ann is asking for a loan to pay for the maintenance of the motorcycle. With this, they will be able to maintain the good working condition of the motorcycle. Sweet Ann dreams of making her business a success and sustainable. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her child.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of the  motorcycle

loans.name: Mt Ulunguru Group

texts.en:
Ester, who is in her late 30s, is married with three children who are still in school.  She has been running a business of selling vegetables of five years now; she works from 6am to 1pm daily, and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Ester's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase on the vegetable stock and has paid back her loan successfully. She is doing fine with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. She used the profit to pay school fees, bought a plot of land and covered household expenses. 

She will use this loan to increase her vegetable stock and meet her customers' demand. She dreams of owning a food shop.

Ester will share this loan with her loan group "Mt Ulunguru Group" which consist of ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her vegetable stock and meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Uaminifu Group

texts.fr: Madame Fataki est  présidente dans le  groupe de crédit Uamimifu.  Elle est  mariée à un agent de la fonction publique à l’âge de 49 ans et  mère de 6 enfants   scolarisés.  Elle est vendeuse des souliers homme au marché central de la ville depuis 2004.  Ce nouveau prêt va l’aider à acheter  1 sac de sandale pour homme, 1 sac de sandale pour enfant  et  ½  sac de ketch pour enfant.Son objectif c’est de devenir grossiste et ouvrir un dépôt commercial. Elle remercie Hekima pour son initiative de soutien aux  femmes pauvres économiquement actives.
texts.en:
Madame Fataki is president of the loan group called Uamimifu.  She is married to a civil administrator, aged 49, and the mother of six children who are enrolled in school. She has been selling men's shoes in the central market of the town since 2004. 

This new loan will help her to buy one sack of men's sandals, one sack of children's sandals, and 1/2 sack of children's shoes. Her ambition is to become a wholesaler and open a commercial depot. She thanks Hekima for its campaign in support of poor women who are economically active.

loans.use: to buy one sack of men's sandals, one sack of children's sandals, and one-half sack of children's shoes

loans.name: Mitsanze

texts.en:
Mitsanze is a married man with children. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mitsanze operates a fish selling business, selling from home to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a stiff competition from other fish sellers in his business.
 
With the KES 50,000, he wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Gulruhsor

texts.ru: Гулрухсор жизнерадостная женщина 27 лет. Она разведена и имеет одного ребенка. Сама Гулрухсор живет со своим ребенком в городе Турсунзаде. У нее среднее специальное образование. Чтобы зарабатывать на пропитание Гурухсор работает швеёй. Гулрухсор шьет платья, а также свадебные платья. От данного дела она получает хороший доход.  Она берет заказы на дому, чтобы одновременно и работать и воспитывать своего ребенка, заниматься домашним хозяйством.  Сейчас Гулрухсор хочет купить новую швейную машинку для продвижения своего бизнеса. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд за кредитом. Гулрухсор заранее благодарит нашу организацию за поддержку и надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en:
Gulruhsor is a cheerful woman of 27. She is divorced and has one child, with whom she lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She has a specialist high school education and earns a living as a seamstress. She sews dresses and wedding dresses and receives a good income. She takes orders from her home so that she can work and, at the same time, take care of her child and her home.

Gulruhsor wants to buy a new sewing machine to keep her business going. Therefore she has turned to Arvand for a loan. She thanks the organization in advance for the support and hopes for a good result.

loans.use: to purchase  a sewing machine

loans.name: Duty

texts.en:
Duty is an old client of Ugafode Microfinance who is applying for a loan of UGX 4,000,000. He runs a garment shop at a local market and has been doing this for more than five years. 

He is requesting a loan to finish the construction of his house and to restock his business so that he can raise money to maintain his family, pay school fees for his children and develop himself. Duty is an honest and very hard working man but is always limited by capital. He intends to open another outlet in Mbarara town where he thinks that turnover and profit margins can increase.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for his house and garment for his business

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en:
Sophorn is a 19-year-old accounting student at a university in the city. She is from Tbong Khmum Province of Cambodia. Due to a shortage of finances, Sophorn would like to request a loan to pay for her tuition fees. This loan will help her get higher education. 

For her future job, she wants to work in a bank with a reasonable salary to help her family.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction material for his house

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is thankful that she was granted a 12,000 PHP loan which she used to buy spare parts and pay for maintenance of her tricycle. Through her earnings, she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 15,000 PHP loan which she will use to pay for the repair and maintenance of her tricycle. It is important that her unit is always in a good running condition to ensure efficient service and continuous income. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Estelita aims to buy a new tricycle for better transport service. She aspires to give her children the best education for a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the repair and maintenance of her tricycle (three-wheeled transport vehicle).

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is thankful that she was granted a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan, which she used to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed for her weaving business. Through her earnings she was able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses.

She would now like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan, which she will use to purchase additional supplies of raw materials like fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business. Her income from her weaving of doormats sustains her family's basic needs and the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her. 

Yolanda hopes that her business will grow more to have her own place. She wants to help her children buy their own house. She prays to be happy and healthy in old age. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is a businesswoman who sells produce. She is married and the mother of five children who range in age from four to fifteen. She is in dire need of money to buy dried beans and corn to sell at a profit. Her major source of income is farming, and her main crop is maize. She has been doing this since 2007. Her dream is to educate all of her children and acquire more land so that she can increase the size of her crop. She describes herself as hardworking and honest. She thanks UGAFODE and Kiva for the assistance they provide.

loans.use: to buy beans and corn to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
This is Charles. The cleared his A levels in 2003 and was not able to join University immediately. He managed to secure admission to university in 2008 but he has not been able to finish because of financial issues so he has been off and on with school. He encourages young people in his community to not give up and to keep trying so that their dreams will one day become a reality. 

His dreams to become a law professor and leave a lasting legacy in his generation. He is now in his last year in campus and with a Kiva loan he will be able to pay for his tuition fees and buy a laptop to complete his school project.

loans.use: To pay for is tuition cost for University and buy a laptop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Sanam

texts.en: Sanam is 43 years old and married with a daughter and a son. The family has lived in an Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) settlement for a long time. Her husband is a driver. Mushviga has been earning money from farming for 20 years and has gained good skills. She raises crops and seasonal fruit trees, such as quince, persimmon, etc. Quince and persimmon are very delicious and useful fruits especially when fresh. People like these fruits because of their taste and use them to prepare jams and make juice. Her monthly income is 200AZN. She receives additional income by raising hens and cocks.  Sanam needs money to repair her house. She applied for 1500AZN loan in order to buy new fertilizers and garden tools. She plans to increase her income so she will be able to repair her house in the future. This is her second loan and she has a positive client history.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizers and garden tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair her leaking roof

loans.name: Ixtiyar

texts.en:
Ixtiyar is 49 years old, married, and he has three sons. His wife is a teacher. He grows and sells fruit (apples, oranges, pears, lemons, bananas, etc.) and vegetables (greens, potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers, onions and so on) at the local bazaar. His monthly income is 190 AZN. Ixtiyar's elder son  helps him to grow fruit and vegetables.

Azeri people like eating delicious fresh vegetables. Beside that vegetables are used in preparing different soups (tomato soup, lentil soup), salads, national dishes such as roasted eggplant, etc.  The demand for fruit is also high. They use fruit to make fresh juice, fruit pies, and different sorts of jam.

Ixtiyar wants to expand his business and improve his family's living conditions. Therefore he applied for a 1200 AZN loan. He will use this money to buy more fertilizers and garden tools.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and garden tools.

loans.name: Konul

texts.en:
Konul is 32 years old. She is married and has a son. Her husband earns for the family, working as a laborer. The main source of income for family is the raising of seasonal vegetables (onions, greens, etc.) by Konul. She has been raising vegetables for nine years and has good skills in this area.

Greens and onions are very popular in Azerbaijan national cuisine. They are used in the cooking of kebab, levengi, qutab, doghramajh and other dishes. That’s why these vegetables are in high demand. Konul raises and then sells them at a local bazaar.

Her income for this small business doesn’t cover life's demands. Her harvest isn’t profitable enough, and she plans to raise other vegetables and fruits additionally. The living costs in Azerbaijan are expensive; especially, it’s hard for IDP (internally displaced person) families. 

She applied for 1,500 AZN (Azerbaijan new manat) in order to buy new, good fertilizers and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new, good fertilizers and expand her business.

loans.name: Sanam

texts.en:
Sanam is 53 years old married with two sons and a daughter. She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) and lives with her family in a settlement for IDPs. Her husband is a driver. She is engaged in husbandry, where she raises cows and sheep, and has been selling meat, milk and (wool) for almost ten years. Her monthly income is 100 AZN. 

There are lots of different kinds of delicious dishes in Azerbaijan cuisine that include meat (dolma, kebab, dushbere, qutab, khash). And that's why people's demand for meat is very high. Milk is also used daily, preparing different sweets (cookies, pies, etc.). Beside that, milk is very useful for health. 

Sanam's living conditions are very hard and she needs to increase her income and help her family. She applied for 1,500 AZN loan in order to buy more husbandries. Please support her.

loans.use: to buy more cows

loans.name: El Cocal Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario El Cocal, lo integran tres socios emprendedores, está coordinado por la señora Gladys, quien tiene la edad de 35 años, casada y madre de tres hijos de las edades de tres meses, 11 y 14 años, es propietaria de un taller de zapatería ubicado en su domicilio con cinco años de experiencia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuero sintético, conos de hilo, hebillas, suelas, pega blanca, pega amarilla, forros, etc., es el vigésimo ciclo que solicita el financiamiento de la institución y los beneficios han sido múltiples uno de ellos es que ha logado aumentar su producción, mejorando así sus ingresos. Otra de integrante es la señora Rosibel, quien tiene la edad de 41 años y se dedica a la hecha y venta de tortillas en su domicilio, se ha dedicado a este negocio desde hace treinta años y el señor Marcial de 47 años propietario de un taller de electrodomésticos en su domicilio desde hace catorce años.
texts.en:
The communal bank "El Cocal" is made up of three enterprising members. The group is co-ordinated by Señora Gladys, who is 35 years old, married and has three children who are three months, 11 years and 14 years old. She is the owner of a shoe workshop located in her home and has 5 years' experience.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy synthetic leather, spools of thread, buckles, soles, white and yellow glue, lining etc. This is the 20th loan she has asked for through the institution and she has seen many benefits. One of these is that she has managed to increase her production, thus improving her income. 

Another member is Señora Rosibel, who is 41 years old and works making and selling tortillas in her home, which she has been doing for 30 years. The last member is Señor Marcia who is 47 years old, and is the owner of an electrical appliance repair business based in his home for 14 years.

loans.use: to buy shoe making materials.

loans.name: Vân

texts.en:
Mrs. Vân operates a food stall selling liquor, beer, and snacks. Vân is 52 years old and she is married with three children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent.

This is Vân's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Vân has been involved in her business for eight years.

The main hardship that Vân faces in her life is not having a hygeinic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

 Vân hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and with her profit, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is a 53-year-old, married woman from Ilo-ilo, Philippines. She has four children. The oldest child is 25, while the youngest is 11 years old. 

She is engaged in a rice retailing business. She sells rice in the their community. She has been into this rice retailing  business for almost six years. In addition to that, Annie is also engaged in buying and selling surplus products like tools and equipment.  

Annie requested a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy more sacks of rice and have additional capital for the surplus business. This would help Annie sell more rice and eventually augment a higher income for her to cater for the family's daily needs.

In the future, Annie would like to expand her buy-and-sell business to provide her children with a proper diet and quality education.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice and have additional capital for her surplus business

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona shown here with her husband Renante, 33, is married and the mother of four children aged five to 17. She is from Carles, Iloilo, in the Philippines. 

Nona has been engaged in the fishing business for many years. Her husband works as a fisherman too. Together, they work hard to provide for their family through fishing. Nona is asking for a loan to buy a new engine and compressor. These parts will replace the old ones, which always malfunction and cause delays in their fishing activity.  

Nona dreams of expanding her family's livelihood and saving money for her children's tuition.

loans.use: to buy a new engine and compressor

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 45-year-old  married woman from Dulag, Leyte. She is the mother of six children, the youngest of whom is two years old. Marites goes fishing and sells the fish to earn a living. Her husband is a fisherman. In addition, Marites raises pigs. 

Despite their hard work, the couple have run out of capital to finance their fishing livelihood. Therefore, Marites is requesting a loan to buy fishing net and additional pigs to raise. This will help her to improve her catch and to sell more pigs. 

With the additional capital, she can then improve her profits and set aside some savings for emergency purposes and eventually send her children to school for a bright future.
 
Marites hopes to expand her business activities and make them a success.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and additional pigs to raise

loans.name: Consolita

texts.en:
Consolita, age 60, operates an electric generator, that provides electric power supply to individual  homes in  her community.  She has been engaged in this business for more than 20 years. Consolita lives with her family in Carles, Ilo-ilo. She and her husband have one grown-up child. 

Consolita  is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 40,000 in order to buy electric wire, gears, radiator and fuel. These materials will help her keep her operation smooth and sound and produce good results, thus providing her customers with an excellent source of electricity.

 Consolita would like to expand her business to have a sustainable livelihood in the future.

loans.use: to buy electric wire, gears, radiator and fuel

loans.name: Chẫn

texts.en:
Chẫn works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is 57 years old and she is married with one child. Chẫn lives in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Chẫn's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Chẫn has been involved in her business for more than 10 years.

The main hardship that Chẫn faces in her life is not having a hygeinic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

Chẫn hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and with her profit, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and bricks to build a toilet.

loans.name: Edith Grasiela

texts.es:
Edith es una joven madre soltera de 21 años de edad, tiene un pequeño de 2 años quien es el motor de su vida y por quien lucha día a día para brindarle un futuro mejor. Con mucho esfuerzo pudo abrir un pequeño negocio y vende distintos productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, papa, entre otros productos y cree que le está yendo bien por su gran desempeño y esfuerzo.
Edith está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio, de esta manera podrá ofrecer mayores productos a sus clientes y así mejorar sus ingresos. Más adelante espera adquirir su propio local para un mayor ahorro y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Edith is a young 21 year old single mother. She has a 2 year old little boy who is her life's source of energy, and for whom she works hard to give a better future. With a lot of effort she was able to open a small store, and she sells different basic staples such as rice, sugar, potatoes, among other products. She feels she is doing well because of her performance and effort. Edith is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because with the support they have given her she will be able to buy merchandise for her store. This way she will be able to offer more products to her customers, and in this way improve her earnings. Later, she hopes to buy her own store so she can save more, and to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: German

texts.es:
German tiene 65 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 02 hijos dependientes. German vive con sus hijos y su cónyugue. German vive en el centro poblado de Piquijaca en el distrito de San Felipe, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. Caserío mediano con aspiraciones a superarse; en dicho caserío la población se dedica a la agricultura siendo el cultivo de lima el de mayor producción, así como al comercio.

German se dedica a la carpintería cuenta con un taller propio, y con una experiencia de más de 10 años en el rubro el cual funciona en su propio domicilio, además German se desempeña como albañil en su caserío y caseríos de la zona cuenta con experiencia como albañil, además se dedica al cultivo de lima cuenta con 01 hectarea de finca frutera, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales, por su buen servicio y experiencia cuenta con clientela de la zona. El destino del crédito es para invertir en el negocio compra de madera y herramientas y compra de abono para su finca de lima. Invirtiendo en su negocio podrá adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
German is 65 years old and lives with his partner. They have two dependent children who live with them. He lives in the village of Piquijaca, in San Felipe district, which belongs to the province of Jaén, in the Cajamarca region of Peru's northern mountains. This small community strives to improve itself and most of the village residents are farmers and merchants. Limes are the main crop. 

German works as a carpenter and has his own shop. He has over ten years of experience in this line of work and runs his business in his home. He also works in construction in and around his community and has experience in that field. He also works growing limes, owning 2.5 acres of orchards. He has very good working and personal references because of the good service he provides and his experience. He has lots of customers in the area. 

German will use this loan to invest in his business. He will purchase wood and tools, as well as fertilizer for his lime trees. Investing in his business will allow him to increase profitability and to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wood and tools for his business and fertilizer for his lime trees.

loans.name: Wella

texts.en:
This is Wella, 33, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Water and they have one child who is already in high school. She works hard to meet their daily household needs and pay for the schooling of her child.  

Wella is in the food business; she has a chicken barbecue business just in front of her house. Chicken barbecue is a favorite food among Filipinos. People will usually just buy barbecue for dinner especially those who come from work at the office; they will drop by a stall that sells barbecue. Wella is already known for her sweet and delicious chicken barbecue so she is already popular in their area, with neighbors and the local working community as her regular  customers. She also sells fashion jewelry items as shown in her photo. She earns a minimum of Php 600 net income a day.

To help her maintain her business, Wella is requesting a Php 15,000 loan to buy dozens of chickens needed for her business.  She believes that with this financial assistance  her sales and earnings will increase.  She thanks God in advance for your great help.

Wella dreams of having another branch of her barbecue business. She wants to secure the education of her child until college for a bright future.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for dozens of chickens for her barbecue business and also some fashion jewelry items to sell.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 56 years old and married with four children.

Samson works hard to provide for his family. He runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Samson has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. He has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Samson aspires to save enough money so he can afford to send his children to college.

loans.use: to buy medicines for her pigs and groceries for her store to sell.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Emelda works hard to support her family.

She has a cafeteria business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Emelda is borrowing PHP 17,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy coffee, milk, and sugar for her cafeteria business.

Emelda has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
(Note to Editor: The term 'nguyen chat' means 'pure' - the product that the client sells is pure sugar cane juice, it has nothing to do with her last name.)

Hue is requesting another loan, which she will use to buy soft drinks, coffee, and sugar to stock her coffee shop. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and sales and help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, coffee, and sugar to stock her coffee shop

loans.name: Mon's Group

texts.en: Mon’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Mon works as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.  Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Clara Isabel

texts.es: Clara una mujer joven de 25 años con excelentes proyectos y aspiraciones para su vida, que se dedica a la venta de mercancía de productos para cuidado personal con un lindo propósito el cual es salvar vida a partir del cambio de hábitos alimenticios y ahora solicita un crédito que le permita comprar más productos y seguir con su hermosa labor que vale la pena aclarar representa su única entrada económica y se propone a seguir cambiando vidas y llevar un hábito alimenticio saludable a todas las personas que acepten el cambio
texts.en:
Clara is a 25 years old women with great projects and ambition. She sells nutritional complements and vitamins to help her clients change their eating habits and be more healthy.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more products to resell and help her clients adopt more healthy eating lifestyles.

loans.use: To buy nutritional complements for her business

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 29-year-old female Ugandan, and a single mother of two children, aged 2 and 4. She resides in a nearby trading center.

She has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings to buy cosmetics, since it is her main business that she supplements with income from farming. She joined the cosmetics business after realizing there was enough market from women in the area. She is confident she will make sales to earn a profit.

Florence is grateful that the Kiva lenders are willing to support her enterprise to grow. She describes herself as hardworking and honest.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, a septic tank, and a closet at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Nemat

texts.en:
Nemat is a 25-year-old refugee. He is married and has a little son. The family lives in an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) settlement. His wife is a housekeeper and educates their child. Nemat has been raising fruit trees (quince and persimmon) and selling the fruit at a local bazaar for three years. His monthly salary is 150 AZN (Azerbaijani new manat).

Quince and persimmon are very popular fruits in Azerbaijan. They are very tasty and useful for health. People use them to make pies or jams for tea. They also use dried quince and persimmon. This is very useful when people get ill. 

The assortment of fruit trees isn’t wide, and this makes Nemat’s income very low. It’s impossible for a young family to cover life's demands. Nemat wants to provide his son an excellent education and bright future. He does everything that he can to reach this aim. 

He applied for 1,200 AZN in order to buy fertilizers and grow other sorts of fruits. Expansion of his assortment will increase his family’s income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and grow other sorts of fruits.

loans.name: Sari Kencana Group

texts.en:
The Sari Kencana group made the payment of 10,000,000 IDR to MUK on time. They tell us that there was an increased profit they earned during the loan period of six months. The pigs grew fat and healthy. They could sell the pigs for a high price because of lots of demand from the market. The situations stimulated their spirit to run the business. The group hopes the cooperation between MUK, Kiva, and the client will continue smoothly and last longer. 

Jro Nyoman, as the head, is controlling and monitoring the member of her group. She was helped by other boards. She sells all her pigs and earns a satisfactory profit. She saves all the profit and uses it for business capital later.

The Sari Kencana group is receiving a new loan of 10,000,000 IDR. The loan is being used to increase the number of piglets, renovate the cages, and purchase superior feed. The group still needs a loan until they have enough capital to run the business by themselves. Now they already have savings and use it for capital.

Jro Nyoman and the members feel happy receiving the support all this time from lenders, Kiva and MUK. She will use the loan to purchase two local piglets and feed. She hopes she can have enough saving soon and continue the business by herself.

loans.use: to purchase two local piglets and feed

loans.name: Pacar Seribu Group

texts.en:
Pacar Seribu group is a group of nine women who have businesses as flower farmers. The flowers that are planted are special flowers that are used as a means of Hindu prayer. This flower is named “Pacar”, so this group is named Pacar Seribu (thousand) or a Thousand Pacar flowers.

The group is headed by Ni Putu, with nine members and a total 18,000,000 IDR loan. Farming as flower growers, she elaborated, was more than five years. Hilly areas with cold enough temperatures are very suitable for planting Pacar flowers.

With a loan of 2,000,000 IDR per member, Ni Putu used it to buy flower seeds, fertilizer and pay for maintenance costs. Her husband helped with all these activities. Flowers are treated for two weeks to one month and are ready for harvest. Ni Putu and other farmers already have a buyer for the flowers.

Ni Putu has plans to lease land to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy flower seeds, fertilizer and pay maintenance costs.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
El señor  Wilfredo  de 40 años de edad es  casado, tiene tres hijos que dependen de él, vive en la comunidad de Nacaome, valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 5 años  a la venta de leña, también vende verduras Y frutas es un excelente cliente y su deseo es mejorar su calidad de vida.
Don Wilfredo está ocasión esta solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de leña que es uno de sus negocios y tiene varios pedidos de este producto, espera que esta inversión le permita seguir apoyando a su familia y que su negocio sea más prospero.
Don Wilfredo uno de sus sueños es tener un mejor carro para transportar la leña y sus verduras.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2014.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 40 years old. He is married and has three dependent children. He lives in the community of Nacaome, a valley in southern Honduras, where he has his own home and has been selling firewood for the past five years. He also sells vegetables. He is an excellent client and his wish is to improve his quality of life.

WIlfredo requests the loan to purchase firewood for one of his businesses. He hopes that this investment will enable him to continue supporting his family and that his business becomes more prosperous. One of his dreams is to own a better car to transport the firewood.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October 2014.

loans.use: to purchase firewood for his business.

loans.name: Nhoma 12 Thôn Đông 05 -Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Dân, 40, is married with four children. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the Nhoma 12 thôn Đông 05 -Quảng Nham solidarity group. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province. She has a food stall, where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Her main hardship in her business is a lack of capital.

Dân is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to sell. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
 
With her business profit, Dân hopes to maintain a successful business, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Nancy Soledad

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Montecristi se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla
En este lugar vive la señora Nanny, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo mayor de edad, estudia en universidad y aun vive en su casa. Su esposo trabaja en maquinaria pesada.
Doña Nancy es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado trabajar para así salir adelante, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí  vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites,  legumbres además de ciertas cosas de bazar, papelería, helados, entre otros productos, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hijo le ayudan en su trabajo cuando está desocupado. Tiene 6 años con su negocio el cual le da muchas satisfacciones.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para surtir más su tienda. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace 6 años  y le gusta por los servicios que ofrece la institución. Sus sueños es que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The communal bank Montecristi meets biweekly in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich precolonial culture and its nationally and internationally renowned crafts. The famous Panama hat comes from this area.

This is where Nanny lives. She is 46 years old, married, and has one adult child from this relationship. He is attending university and still lives at home. Her husband works with heavy machinery. 

Nancy has always liked to work in order to get ahead. She has a grocery store set up in her home, where she sells all sorts of products like rice, sugar, oil, beans, and also some other items like paper products and ice cream. She works every day from 6:00 am to 9:00 pm or later. Her son helps her at work when he isn't busy. She has been running this business for six years and it has been a very gratifying experience.

She will use this loan to buy groceries to further stock her store. She has belonged to her communal bank for six years and enjoys it because of the services it provides. Her goal is for her store to keep growing.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Her name is Remedios. She is 59, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines, and married to Jaime. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating a business. She works hard to augment their income, to meet their daily personal and household needs.

Remedios has been operating a computer rental shop for thirteen years. In their area, very few people own a Personal Computer at home. People go to an Internet Café, for either their business documents, or for school requirements. She rents out computers by the hour, and offers printing and typing services. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in rentals, every day.

To help her improve her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to purchase a new PC. Her income from her Internet Shop helps in a big way, to meet their daily personal and household needs.

Remedios aims to grow her business and wants to save money for their old age. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week, to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for a  new PC for her Internet Shop.

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.en:
Ladylaine (the student and a daughter of Emeliana) is 18 years old and is 3rd of the three children in the family. Her mother Emeliana a member of NWTF, supports the family through her business selling ready-to-wear in the Philippines.

Ladylaine is studying Bachelor of Science in Business Administration and is currently on her 2nd year of this 4-year course.

Ladylaine is borrowing PHP 20,000 to pay tuition fees of the first semester of the school year 2014-15.

When she graduates, Ladylaine plans to be gainfully employed so she could help to improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Shushanik

texts.en:
Shushanik is 52 years old and lives in the area of Stepanavan in the Lori region. 

Shushanik give thanks for her first loan she received through Kiva with which she bought 2 young calves.  She hopes for a second loan. 

Her family’s main income is still from farming and her occupation as a milker. Shushanik lives with her husband and with their handicapped daughter. She has a lot of hardships connected with her daughter’s care, house and farm. She bears all these since she is a very optimist woman and believes one day her family will have better living conditions. 

In the barn nearby her house, Shushanik keeps her farm cattle, 4 cows, 2 calves and 2 heifers. Her farm cattle provide enough milk both for sale and for her family's needs as well. 

Shushanik will be thankful to have this loan which will help her to buy more hay for her farm cattle.  She has already stored some for winter, but it seems like not enough for the whole winter period.

loans.use: to buy more hay for her cattle.

loans.name: Lloren

texts.en:
Xyryl (a student) is 16 years old and is older of the two children in his family. His mother, Lloren, who is a member of NWTF, supports the family through her buy-and-sell frozen foods business in the Philippines.

Xyryl is studying for a bachelor of science in civil engineering and is currently in his first year of this five-year course.

Lloren is borrowing PHP 20,000 to pay for the tuition of Xyryl her son, for the first semester of the 2014-15 school year.

When he graduates, Xyryl plans to be gainfully employed so he can help his family to improve their quality of living.

loans.use: to pay tuition

loans.name: Qusai

texts.en:
Qusai is a 24-year-old ambitious man living with his family consisting of six members in Irbid-Jordan. Qusai is a Diploma student majoring in Air Conditioning Engineering, and he is in his second year. 

He is seeking to experience work life after getting his Bachelor's degree, where he can learn more about his study field. Because he currently doesn't have enough money to pay his upcoming semester fees, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Noufa

texts.en: Because Noufa is a conservative lady, she asked her husband to take her place in the photo. Noufa was born in 1971. She is a married lady who has been supporting her family financially by running her own business selling clothes to her friends and neighbors for five years. Because her business has been a good source of income, she is seeking to expand it in the future . Now she wants to buy a new collection of winter clothes that her customers requested. But because she doesn’t have enough money to do so, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to bring in more winter clothing items to sell

loans.name: Carlos Vidal

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 18 años de edad  de estado civil casado vive con su esposa en el cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar, en la comunidad Nueva Esperanza.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Rural Cooperativa Curi-Ñan  se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad de Nueva esperanza, esta se dedican a las labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Carlos se dedica a la agricultura y a la cría de animales a demas trabaja en las mañanas en una compañia que se dedica a las limpieza de las carreteras . Solicita el crédito para la compra de cerdos y pollos para criarlos y venderlos. Su meta es incrementar su negocio. Su desafío es las enfermedades y el mal tiempo. En su tiempo libre le gusta viajar con la esposa.
texts.en:
Carlos, 18, is married and lives with his wife in Guaranda in the Bolivar province, in the Nueva Esperanza community.

He is a member of the solidarity group 'Rural Cooperativa Curi-Nan' which operates in the Nueva Esperanza community.  They are dedicated to agricultural work and livestock.

Carlos works in agriculture and the raising of livestock. He is asking for a loan to buy pigs and chickens which he will raise and then sell. His aim is to increase his business. His main challenges are diseases and the bad weather. 

Carlos also works every morning in a street-cleaning company. In his free time he likes travelling with his wife.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens

loans.name: Samar

texts.en: Because Samar is a conservative lady, she asked her son to take her place in the picture. Samar is a 55-year-old married woman who wants to provide her children with the best education. Her 21-year-old son is a university student majoring in Special Education, and he is in his third year. He is seeking to pass his Bachelor’s so that he will experience work life. But because of the financial crisis his family has been facing, he couldn’t pay for his upcoming semester fees. For that reason, Samar wants to help him by applying for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her son's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Sandra Patricia

texts.es: Patricia tiene 23 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos  el mayor de 5 años  que está estudiando  y el menor de 2 meses, Patricia se dedica a la  crianza de pollos que los tiene en un galponcito,  ella también se dedica  al jornal de trabajo en el campo, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, Patricia aspira que  su negocio le vaya muy bien y poder readecuarlo para que le deje mas ganancia  ya que en la actualidad  es  la  única  fuente de ingresos para ella mientras se  recupera de lo que nació  su bebe, la aspiración de Patricia es darles lo necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Patricia is 23 years old, is a single mother, and has 2 children. Her older child is 5 years old and is studying, and her younger child is 2 months old. Patricia raises chickens, which she keeps in a shed. She also works as a day laborer on the farm. 

The loan will be invested in buying chickens. 

Patricia hopes that her business goes very well and that she can readjust it so that it leaves her with more earnings, since at present it is the only source of income for her while she recuperates from the birth of her baby. Patricia’s aspiration is to give the necessary things to her children.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Shoira

texts.ru:
Шоира очень трудолюбивая и жизнерадостная женщина в возрасте 39 лет. У нее высшее образование. Замужем и имеет двоих детей. Шоира сама живет со своей семьей в городе. Она одновременно и работает и учится. У Шоиры это второе высшее образование.
Чтобы оплатить свою учебу Шоира обратилась в МДО Арвадн за помощью. Она заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку и надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en: Shoira is a very hardworking and happy 39-year-old woman.  She has a higher education, she is married and the mother of two children.  She lives with her own family in a city.  She is working and studying at the same time.  She is studying toward a second college degree.  She has turned to MDO Arvand for financial support in order to be able to pay her tuition fees.  She thanks Arvand in advance for their assistance and is looking forward to a positive outcome.

loans.use: to pay for her education.

loans.name: Agus

texts.en:
Agus is married and lives with his wife in Depok, a satellite city located in the south of Jakarta. To support his family living, Agus sells mobile phone airtime and serves utility bill payments service for his community.

Agus joined Ruma about two years ago because he wanted to increase his family’s income. He feels really excited to expand his own network. He also believes that using technology will make his business easier to run.  As the business runs, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to purchase a bluetooth printer that is used to support his business in providing mobile services for his community. Agus thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a bluetooth printer that is used to support an agent's business in providing mobile services for his community

loans.name: Aulia

texts.en:
Meet Aulia. Aulia is a housewife and she lives with her husband and their only child in Depok, a satellite city located at the south of Jakarta. Aulia is also a part-time Arabic teacher. 

To support her family living, Aulia runs small stall which sells mobile phone airtime credits to her customers. Aulia joined Ruma about four months ago because she wanted to increase her family’s income. She feels really excited to expand her new business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. As the business runs, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide access to mobile services for her community by processing airtime transactions in weekly basis. 

In the photo, Aulia is in her small stall. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in her community

loans.name: Zahraa

texts.en:
Zahraa is a 26-year-old married mother of four children, who works hard to support her husband and beloved family in their living, through taking good care of them and preparing their necessary living needs. Zahraa is a tailor who runs  her business from her house. She takes good care of her house and family and provides her beloved husband, who works in tissue paper factory, a peaceful family living.
 
Today, Zahraa is acquiring this loan to pay school tuition fees for three of her beloved children; one of them is next to her in the picture. 

The loan is part of Al Majmoua's Back to School program, designed to finance school expenses such as books, stationary, transportation, and fees for students whose families have low incomes. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of school expenses. By supporting this loan, you're enabling access to education for students with limited options.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees for three of her beloved children.

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en: Ayman is a 35-year-old married father of three children and a Palestinian refugee who opened a restaurant for refried beans and chickpeas a year ago to cover the needs and expenses of his beloved family. He succeeded with his eighteen years of experience in this domain to satisfy his customers with different tasty plates. Today, Ayman is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his children's school tuition fees. He always hopes to improve his family's living conditions. That's why he is working hard and trying desperately to expand his business.

loans.use: to pay his children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Usalama Group

texts.en:
Shamila, who is in her late 20s, is married with two children, one of whom is in school and the other one who is still small. She has been a food vendor since 2010. She works from 6 am to 4 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Shamila's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her mamalishe stock and has been able to pay back her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy food ingredients. She dreams of building her own house.

Shamila will share this loan with her loan group "Usalama" which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients.

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.en:
Bahtiyor is a kind man, married, and the father of three children. He has a secondary education, and he has been involved in agriculture since 2004. He currently owns some sheep and some cows. Little by little over the years, he has developed the business. At first it was so difficult for him to feed cattle and to manage the business. His wife and children help him with managing the business. 

He has turned to IMON INTERNATIONAL and requested a loan of 8,000 somoni. He will use his loan to purchase four sheep for fattening and selling. 

He plans to reinvest the earnings from his loan into further increasing his livestock headcount.

loans.use: To buy four sheep for fattening and sale
